loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Savorn U. is 55 years old and is the leader selected by the four group members located in Char village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use the loan to purchase supplies, equipment and other items to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Savorn U. owns a small store where she sells desserts. With this business she is able to earn a small income to support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy dessert supplies to support her business activities. With this loan she hopes to increase her income to improve her family’s standard of living.

Mrs. Savorn U. is widow with a child who is also a dessert seller and who supports her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies for making more desserts

loans.name: Jamal Agha Group

texts.en: Shakiba is the daughter of A. J.. She is 26 years old, married, and has one son. She is the leader of 'Jamal Agha' group. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She has a brother who is single and he is responsible for whole family including his father and mother who benefit from the income he generates through his business, a fresh fruit and vegetable shop. So his sister (Shakiba) has requested a loan for her brother. With this loan he wants to buy more fresh fruit and vegetables. Her brother is very happy that he has got a chance to progress as soon as possible.

loans.use: buy more fresh fruits and vegetables for his shop

loans.name: Alicia Berthilda

texts.es:
Alicia Berthilda C. B. tiene 49 años de edad y es casada, tiene  2 hijos, Luis de 10 años y Miguel de 8 años. Ellos viven en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.
Alicia es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa de Agua Clara, que está ubicada a una distancia de 2 horas de Chillanes.  Son 15 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría tienen pequeños negocios 
Alicia se dedica a la crianza de pollos que compra y venda en el cantón de Bucay. Solicita el préstamo para aumentar su negocio. Su meta seria seguir adelante.
En su tiempo libre, a Alicia le gusta preparar comidas.



Alicia is 49 years old, married and live with her husband and 2 children Luis (10) and Miguel (8) in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra)
Alicia is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small shops.
Alicia raises chicken she buys and sells in the canton of Bucay. She is requesting this loan to increase her business. Her objective would be to go ahead.
In her free time, Alicia likes to cook.
texts.en:
Alicia is 49 years old, married and lives with her husband and 2 children Luis (10) and Miguel (8) in the neighborhood of Chillanes, in Bolivar province (Central Sierra). Alicia is a member of the rural loan group “Santa Rosa de Agua Clara”, which is located two hours away from Chillanes. The group is composed of 15 members in total, most of whom have small businesses. Alicia raises chickens that she buys and sells in the canton of Bucay. She is requesting this loan to increase her business. Her goal is to get ahead economically. In her free time, Alicia likes to cook.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase her business

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: He is young, energetic and full of hope for success in the business world. He is Francis, a 24-year-old man living in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with two children and heads a family of four people, which he sustains with the income from his retail shop where he sells sugar, soap, salt and rice, among other things. He has operated the retail shop for two years now. Francis achieved the feat of his shop when he sold his season's harvest of tobacco. He dreams of owning a wholesale shop one day. With the loan funds, he intends to purchase sugar, rice, salt and soap to sell in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, rice, salt, and soap to sell

loans.name: Asomuddin

texts.en:
K. Asomuddin is 33 years old, married, and has four children. He is a very enterprising person. Thirteen years ago he began to work with inoculated animals and go door-to-door in the city selling the meat. At that time, he didn't own a space for a butcher shop. After getting married, he and his wife decided to open a grocery store and butcher shop. Today, Asomuddin is in charge of the butcher shop, and his wife runs the grocery store. To expand their business, Asomuddin requests a loan to buy some animals for their butcher shop and foodstuff for their grocery store. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve their agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to provide poor and low income clients with the assistance they need to develop a viable business. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for their butchery and grocery store

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, de  42 años, vive en su casa que es  propia junto a su esposa  Francisca (38), y sus 2 pequeños hijos.Lleva 20 años cultivando alverja y papa, con la ayuda de su esposa, quien al mediodía siempre le lleva los alimentos a la chacra y se queda trabajando con él, hasta la tarde. Lo que  más le gusta  es observar crecer y madurar los productos oriundos de la zona que siembra en sus terrenos propios, y  le disgusta que en tiempo de cosecha los mayoristas traten de pagar precios muy bajos, a pesar de la calidad de sus frutos, por eso desde algunos años traslada lo recolectado desde sus tierras hasta la capital. Y ya tiene clientes conocidos que siempre le compran su mercadería a precios considerables, lo que le permite ganar algo más de dinero. Considera  que su actividad es muy rentable, porque puede brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, y quiere instalar una tienda de comestibles en la ciudad, para que su esposa lo administre y no tenga que seguir con el trabajo sacrificado de la chacra.Es la  décima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP,  y como siempre esta orgulloso de seguir trabajando junto a los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes en este tiempo demostraron ser personas muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.Jesús tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  dos bolsas de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de abono, con los cuales sembrará papa, pues cuenta con las semillas de la variedad única, que es de buena calidad, de esta manera espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Jesus is 42 and lives in his own home with his wife Francisca (38) and 2 young children. For twenty years he has cultivated peas and potatoes with his wife's help. She brings him lunch in the fields and stays to help until the evening. His favorite part of all of this is watching these native goods planted on his own land grow and ripen. He dislikes that wholesalers try to pay low prices at harvest time despite the quality of his goods. For that reason, in the past few years he has taken his goods to the capital. He has regular customers there that buy his products at good prices and allow him to make a bit more money. He feels this is a profitable activity since it provides his family a better quality of life. He would like to have shop in the city for his wife to manage and leave the hard work in the fields. This is his tenth loan with MFP, and is very happy to continue his work with the members of the community group, who have shown themselves to be responsible in repaying their loans. Jesus plans to invest his loan buying pea seeds and a few sacks of fertilizer to help grow potatoes. He has a unique variety of quality potato seeds and hopes to keep growing through them.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds and fertilizer to increase his production

loans.name: Jaqueline

texts.en:
Jaqueline was born in 1970. She is married with two children. One of the children is 13 years old, and one is 9 years old. Jaqueline owns a business selling various products in Kigali city. She has seven years of experience in her business. Jaqueline employs one person from her community as a helper.

Jaqueline is now requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing large quantities so that her business satisfies everybody. The profit that Jaqueline expects to earn will allow her to save money for the future.

loans.use: To purchase large quantities to products to sell

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea N. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 52 years old and married. Andrea owns and operates a business providing motorcycle transportation services. Andrea has been engaged in her business for over 10 years.

In 2007, Andrea joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Andrea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Andrea is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Andrea from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other accessories for transport business

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es: Teofila, de 32 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos tienen tres hijos. Juntos residen en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa a base de madera. La actividad principal que realiza es el cultivo y comercialización de cacao y café, por otro lado alquila terrenos que posee, de esa manera se genera más ganancias. Asegura que aún le fata por desarrollar más su trabajo y se esta esforzando por ello, su anhelo es poder darle a su familia la felicidad y tranquilidad que necesitan.  Generalmente trabaja con su pareja, ambos son un gran equipo, pero cuando se necesita de más esfuerzo, es cuando contrata peones para que le ayuden extraer sus productos agrícolas en un menor tiempo. Normalmente su producto de cacao y café los vende en los centros de acopio de su localidad y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Su plan futuro es construir su casa a base de material noble con la necesidad de que los pueda dar seguridad y satisfacción a su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus pagos, además reitera que lo está yendo de maravillas con su banco comunal, debido a los beneficios que tiene. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de abonos, para que de esa manera lo pueda dar un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao y café.
texts.en:
Teofila lives with her common-law husband and together they have three children. The live in Quimbiri, located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle where they have their own wooden home. Their main business is growing and selling cacao and coffee. They also lease some lands that they own, thereby increasing their earnings. She says that she still has to develop her business and is working towards it. Her hope is to give her family the happiness and peace of mind they need. Normally she works with her husband as they make a great team, but when they need help they hire field-hands to help harvest faster. Normally the coffee and cacao is sold to wholesale receiving centers nearby. Their normal workday routine is to leave at 7:00 in the morning and return at 6:00 in the afternoon. Her plan for the future is build a house out of quality materials in order to give security and happiness to her family. This is her second loan with MFP and she is committed to continue paying on time. She also mentions that things are going very well with her community bank due to all the benefits she receives. She plans to invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizer so she can give proper care to her coffee and cacao crops.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer to improve cacao and coffee crops

loans.name: Maritza Beatriz

texts.es: Maritza Beatriz R. D. L., resiD. en puerto el triunfo, ubicado en Usulután, ella es una madre soltera, la cual vive junto a una hija D. 15 años D. edad y un hijo D. 9 años, así mismo vive junto a su madre con quien trabajan en conjunto por salir adelante. Maritza posee un negocio D. venta D. ropa para hombres, mujeres, jóvenes y niños, la cual comercializa sobre la calle principal que conduce a Puerto El Triunfo, un lugar muy turístico ubicado al oriente del país. Maritza solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad D. prendas D. vestir, y así mismo invertir en el mes D. septiembre y octubre, tiempo en el cual aún pueda encontrar la ropa a precios bajos, D. manera que pueda contar con una gran variedad D. ropa para noviembre y diciembre, fechas en las cuales las ventas se aumentan. Maritza es una persona muy responsable quien a pesar D. tantas dificultades a sabido sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Maritza Beatriz R. D. Lopez lives in Puerto el Triunfo in Usulutan, is a single mother who lives with her 15 year old daughter and 9 year old son. Her mother also lives with her and together they work to try to get ahead. Maritza has a business selling clothing for men, women, youth and children on the main road to Puerto el Triunfo. This is a tourist destination in the eastern part of the country. Maritza is requesting a loan to purchase more dress clothing during September and October when she can still get low prices in order to have a better inventory for November and December when sales increase. Maritza is a responsible person who despite many difficulties has succeeded with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia C. is from the town of Talibon. She is 50 years old. Letecia is married and has a 29-year-old child. She is a seaweed farmer. She plants and gathers seaweed with the help of her husband, who is also a fisherman. She also helps sell her husband's catch together with the seaweed that they have harvested. She has been involved in seaweed farming for more than 10 years now. 

Letecia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Tany Irone

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Salud Y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

Aquí encontramos a la señora Tany, ella mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tuvo  tres hijos, los tres ya son mayores pero su hija menor que es soltera vive con ella, el esposo es comerciante.

Tienen un almacén de venta de repuestos automotrices, trabajan todos los días ya que este es un negocio familiar, desde muy temprano abren su negocio a las 8 am y cierran a las 17h00, además de repuestos también venden aceites y otros lubricantes de automóvil y motocicletas, dice que le va muy bien en su negocio ya que junto a su local hay talleres mecánicos entonces aprovechan para vender a los clientes que necesitan los repuestos. Cada quince días el esposo viaja a Quito  y Guayaquil a realizar los pedidos que luego reciben en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar repuestos para tener de todo para sus clientes. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 18 ciclos y esta muy a gusto en el.

Su meta es comprar un camioncito para traer los repuestos de otras ciudades.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto every fifteen days the Salud Y Vida Communal Bank meets. This area is known for its traditions and for being a few minutes away from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we found Mrs. Tany, she has common law marriage where she has three children, all three are grown but her youngest daughter is single and lives with her, Tany’s husband is a merchant.

They have a store where they sell automotive spare parts and work everyday since it is a family business. They open the store from very early in the morning from 8 a.m and close at 5 p.m. Besides selling spare parts, they sell oils and other lubricants for cars and motorcycles. Tany says that she does very well in her business since next to her local there are mechanics and they take advantage of this by selling items to customers who need replacements. Every fifteen days, Tany’s husband goes to Quito and Guayaquil to fill in the orders that they have made in their store.

This loan will be used to buy spare parts to have everything their customers need. Tany has been in the communal bank for 18 loan terms and she is very happy in her communal bank.

Tany’s goal is to buy a little truck to bring the spare parts from other cities.

loans.use: To buy automotive spare parts.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto P. de 36 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de 5 años de edad. Desde hace varios años atrás que él se dedica a atender su propio negocio el cual es una tienda de productos varios como productos para el hogar, para uso personal y productos alimenticios. Luis vive en su hogar junto a su compañera de vida, la cual le ayuda a atender el negocio, ambos trabajan con muchos deseos de salir adelante y así mismo de mejorar su negocio, surtiéndolo con todos los productos posibles para obtener más ganancias. Luis solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda invertir en la tienda comprando productos como: pan, medicinas, golosinas, diferentes tipos de bebidas, detergentes, granos básicos y muchos productos más los cuales son primordiales en un negocio como este, ya que son los que más se solicitan. Luis desea mucho poder prosperar en su negocio, sobretodo porque es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto P., age 36, resides in the Department of Usulután with his wife and five year old child. For several years he has managed his own business. Luis has a store where he sells different household products, toiletries, and food items. He lives at home with his lifetime companion who helps him manage the business. They both work with great motivation to get ahead and improve their business. Their store is stocked will as many products as possible in order to generate more income.

Luis is requesting a loan so that he can invest in more merchandise for his store such as bread, medicines, sweets, different types of beverages, detergents, basic grains, and many other products that are essential to this type of business and frequently requested. He has great hopes of prospering in his business since this is his only source of income.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 64 years old, a mother of three children and a widow.  Her business involves buying bags of maize at her village and transporting them to bigger centers to resell at a profit. She also does dairy farming and sells her milk to neighbors and the rest she sells at the nearest center.
.
She learned about Kadet through an existing client. With this first loan she plans to purchase bags of maize which she will sell at a profit. Her future plan is to own a lorry which she will be using to transport the bags of maize for resale.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize for resale.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George N. is from Linao East, Tuguegarao City. He is 34 years old. George is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, George provides tricycle transport services to local community members. George has been engaged in his business for over 19 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP (Philippine pesos) a month for these activities.

In 2006, George joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. George has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. George is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to repair the motorcycle used in the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by George from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to his house. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair the motorcycle used in the business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 36 years old and married. To make a living, Maria owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Maria also helps her husband at their rice farm. She helps keep the farm free of weeds and pests.

Maria joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Maria is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi E. is married and has two children. Her husband is a cleaner. Esi produces and sells Fante kenkey (fermented dough usually made from corn/maize and served with soup or vegetables) at Abura. The profits from her kenkey business are used to educate her children and as a way of assisting her husband.  

Esi will use her loan to purchase maize to prepare kenkey for distribution to her customers. With the profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase corn

loans.name: José Genaro

texts.es:
En la parroquia Alajuela del cantón  Portoviejo  se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Alajuela, este sector es conocido por ser una zona donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura.

En este lugar conocimos a José el tiene 37 años de edad, está soltero y vive en una casa que el arrienda. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por las facilidades que brinda la institución para conseguir los créditos, además porque en cada reunión comparte y aprende de las charlas.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa, nos cuenta que en temporadas se dedica además a la cría de pollos pero que ahora con la entrada del invierno no lo va a hacer porque hay muchas perdidas por las enfermedades que les da en esta temporada. Trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada semana. Su mercadería  la compra  Guayaquil. Lo que más vende es ropa de hombre, pantalones, buzos, camisas.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, buzos, camisas, etc. Sus sueños son tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the "Alajuela" community bank meet in the parish of Alajuela, in Portoviejo canton.  This area is known for the fact that most of its inhabitants are farmers.

Here we meet 37 year-old José who is single and lives in a rental house.  This is his second loan cycle with his community bank and he likes it for the ease with which the institution provides loans.  He also likes it because in every meeting he shares with his fellow group members and learns somehting from the talks they receive.

José sells all kinds of clothes.  He makes his sales door to door and also sells from his home.  He tells us that during some seasons he also raises chickens but now, with winter approaching, he will not pursue this business because there are a lot of losses due to illnesses that the animals suffer during this season.  José works every day.  He leaves his products with his customers on credit and collects payment every week.  He buys his merchandise in Guayaquil.  What he sells most of is men's clothes: pants, track suits and shirts.

José will use this loan to buy pants, track suits, shirts, etc.  His dream is to own his own store.

loans.use: To buy pants, track suits, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: Tomas tiene 39 años esta es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento, pues ha sido muy importante para su negocio.  La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer los servicios de carpintería, hace más de 20 años que se dedica a esta actividad, la mayoría de sus clientes siempre le están solicitando diferentes elaboraciones de muebles mesa, sillas, camas entre otros productos. Este crédito es para la compra de junco, maque, herramientas entre otras cosas.  El desea proporcionarle mejoras a su local del negocio y mantenerlo siempre activo.
texts.en: Tomas is 39 years old and this is the first time he has taken out a loan. He is doing so because it is very important for his business. He works in the carpentry trade, and has offered these services for the past 20 years. Most of his customers are always asking him to make various pieces furniture, including tables, chairs, beds and other items. This loan is to buy reeds, lacquer, tools and other things. He wants to make improvements to his business premises and keep it running.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Otamurot

texts.en: Otamurot J. is 52 years old. He is married and has one child. He sells cattle. As a rule, Otamurot purchases the small cattle in the central market, feeds them and than resells them at higher prices in the local market. Being in this business for 14 years, he knows very well how to choose the animals, how to breed them and look after them. Thus, he gets up every morning in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful and to generate a stable, considerable income for his large family. Otamurot is planning to enlarge the stock and to purchase more cattle. For this purpose, he requests 6,000 Somoni that he will spend for the purchase of young cattle and for feed for them. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle for expanding the business

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es:
Don José, se dedica a realizar viajes y vender verduras, tiene 72 años de edad, vive con su esposa, tienen su propia casa y además es pensionado; Él posee un vehículo en el cual  realiza viajes familiares o colectivos, también vende verduras de forma ambulante.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la reparación del vehículo ya que necesita hacerle algunos ajustes, pero no dispone del total de dinero para pagar el mecánico y comprar los repuestos. 
Este préstamo le ayudara a solventar esta situación y a mantener el vehículo en óptimas condiciones ofreciéndole a los clientes un viaje más seguro y cómodo; Él busca mejorar cada día su trabajo y sus ingresos, para garantizar a su familia una vida mas confortable.
texts.en:
Don José travels and sells vegetables. He is 72 years old and lives with his wife in their own home. José is also a pensioner. He has a vehicle that he uses for families or groups that want to travel. In addition, he sells vegetables as a traveling merchant.

Don José is requesting a loan to repair his vehicle since it is in need of some adjustments. However, he does have all the money necessary to pay a mechanic and buy spare parts. This loan will help resolve this situation and keep his vehicle in optimal condition so that his customers can travel safely and comfortably. He looks to improve each day in his work and increase his income so that his family can have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle repairs.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionisio, de 63 años, es un hombre noble y responsable. Vive junto a su esposa María, de 54 años  y sus 5 hijos mayores, en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la albañilería, y él mismo construyó su casa, y el local con sus respetivos detalles para un spa. Desde entonces su hijo y su esposa se dedican a este negocio, hace más de 10 años, y les va muy bien. Por ello Dionisio, se siente orgulloso y contento por brindar todas las comodidades a su familia, por lo que ahora  ve la rentabilidad del negocio de su familia. Por ello, ahora se ha propuesto acondicionar un espacio apropiado para preparar jugos y mates,  para que se deleiten sus clientes mientras esperan su turno.  Por ello, este emprendedor hombre se ha propuesto  comprar cemento y cerámicas, para que prosiga su trabajo y, de ese modo amplíe su negocio como lo ha planeado. Posteriormente con estas ganancias más tu ayuda, anhela proseguir construyendo el tercer piso de su casa, para después alquilarlos. Es el décimo crédito que tiene con MFP, se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual, para seguir contando con posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita,  comprará mayólicas, cemento y renovar los espejos de su spa.
texts.en: Dionicio, who is 63 years old, is a dignified and responsible man. He lives with his wife, Maria, who is 54, and their 5 adult children, in their own house. He has worked all his life as bricklayer, and he himself built their house, including a section with all the appropriate details for a spa. Since then, for more than 10 years, his son and his wife have worked at this business, and it has gone very well for them. Dionicio is very proud of this, and he is happy to offer all the comforts to his family, because he now sees the profitability of the family business. Because of this, he now proposes to air-condition an appropriate space to prepare juices and mates, to please their customers while they wait their turns. To do this, this enterprising man has proposed buying cement and tiles, so that he can pursue his work and in this way expand his business as he has planned. Later, with these additional earnings to help him, he wants to continue constructing the third floor of his house, so that he can rent it out. This is his 10th loan with MFP, and he promises to make all his payments on time, so that he can continue to have help in the future. With the loan that he is applying for, he will buy tiles and cement and renovate the mirrors in his spa.

loans.use: Buy cement, tiles, and renovate the mirrors in his beauty salon.

loans.name: Luz Adilia

texts.es:
La señora Luz Adilia S. Herrera es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora. Ella desde hace 12 años inicio vendiendo licor actualmente tiene un bar bien surtido. 
Ella con el crédito renovara su permisos de operaciones que año con año se renuevan.
texts.en: Luz is a hard-working, enterprising woman. She started out selling liquor 12 years ago and now has a well-stocked bar. She plans to use the loan to renew her licenses, which she must do year after year.

loans.use: to renew her liquor licenses

loans.name: Marta Sonia

texts.es:
Marta  tiene la edad de 45 años, madre de cuatro hijos, que junto a su esposo han logrado apoyar. Marta trabaja en la venta de ropa usada en donde tiene variedad para grandes, pequeño, damas, caballeros. Inicio hace nueve años,  con poca mercadería en un mercado de la capital, en donde ha venido aumentando su inventario gracias a las ganancias y clientela que ha logrado.
Busca alternativa para poder comprar dos pacas de ropa mixta, ya que parte de su capital lo tiene invertido. En donde busca financiamiento en Afodenic, el cual otorgara su préstamo para lograr el objetivo de su compara de ropa. Y así poder cumplir con sus compromiso de pago.
texts.en:
45-year old Marta has four children. Together with her husband she has managed to raise them successfully. For the past nine years Marta has sold used clothing for adults, children, men and women. She started out with very little merchandise in a market in the capital city, but now she has increased her inventory as a result of a greater income and a larger customer base.

She is looking for a way to be able to buy two bundles of mixed clothing so is seeking a loan from Kiva partner Afodenic. Marta will use the loan to buy more clothing and will then be able to fulfill her promise to pay back the money.

loans.use: to buy two bundles of mixed clothing

loans.name: Rosa Hilda De Jesús

texts.es:
Rosa Hilda, de 64 años de edad, reside en casa propia con su hijo y un nieto. Doña Rosa se dedica a la venta de bebidas como sodas, agua, jugos, té, etc. Estas ventas las realiza de manera ambulante en lugares estratégicos de la zona. Ella se mantiene bien informada de las diferentes actividades que se realizan en los alrededores de su residencia ya que aprovecha los días festivos y sus celebraciòn para realizar su venta. Es una mujer llena de energía y no duda en ir a los diferentes lugares en los que hay fiestas, ferias, partidos de futbol, conciertos etc. Ya que es ahí en donde sus ventas se ven incrementadas. 

Como toda mujer emprendedora quiere aumentar el nivel de ventas para esto necesita tener variedad de bebidas para ofrecer a sus clientes en los diferentes eventos a los que asiste. Esto la ha impulsado a solicitar este crédito para poder lograr comprar variedad de bebidas como: sodas, jugos, agua, té helados y de más bebidas que sean demandadas por los clientes.  De esta forma espera obtener mayores ganancias que le ayuden a mejor su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Hilda is 64 years old and resides in her own home with her son and grandson.  Doña Rosa has a business selling beverages such as sodas, water, juices, tea, and others.  She sells as a street vendor from strategic locations within the area.  Rosa is well-informed about different events that take place near her home, so she takes advantage of these festival days to generate sales.  She is full of energy and does not hesitate to travel to different places where festivals, fairs, soccer games, concerts, and other events are taking place so that she can set up her business.  As a result, her sales have increased.  

Being an enterprising woman, Rosa wants to increase her level of sales.  For this reason, she needs to have a variety of beverages to offer to her customers at different events they attend.  This led her to request a loan so that she can buy a variety of beverages such as sodas, juices, water, iced teas, and other drinks that are in demand among her customers.  By working in this manner, she hopes to generate more income to help improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, age 37, is employed by a construction firm along with her husband. She and her husband live in Paynesville with their five children, who are between the ages of eight and 19, and they all attend school. (Susan herself had to leave school at the fifth-grade level.) 

For the past eight years, she has made a good income selling red oil. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase 10 gallons of oil for her business.

Susan plans to build a house for her children in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase 10 gallons of oil to offer for sale

loans.name: Tugeme Group

texts.en:
Asia, who is in her early thirties, is married with two children who are going to school. She has two barber shops and a general store and has also been selling second-hand clothes for 6 years. She works from 8.00 a.m. to 10.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Asia’s 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open her second barber shop and her general store and to start selling second-hand clothes in the area. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She has requested a loan to buy modern shavers. Her dream is to own a wholesale and retail spare-parts business for cars and motorbikes.

Asia will share this loan with her group, Tugeme, which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy modern  shavers.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is married to a businessman and she has three children, all of whom attend. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past one year, she has operated a fish-selling business, selling as retail to her neighbours. Kadzo also does farming which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of high costs of transportation in her business. Her dreams is to establish a retail shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for sale.

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr: Dédé a 37 ans et est mère de trois(03) enfants. Mariée à un maçon, elle-même est revendeuse de boissons alcoolisées (liqueurs) au marché d’Agoé Assiyéyé.son activité a commencé en 2000 et pour ses besoins de commerce elle achète ses bouteilles de boissons au grand marché de Lomé. Ce premier crédit auprès de WAGES lui servira à élargir sa clientèle et supporter les charges et les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en: Dédé is 37 years old and the mother of three. Married to a stonemason, she works as a vendor of alcoholic beverages (liquors) at the  Agoé Assiyéyé. Her business started in 2000. She buys bottles of alcohol at the big market of Lomé. This first loan from WAGES will allow her to expand her customer base and provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy alcoholic beverages (for resale)

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: La señora Julia es artesana, trabaja tejiendo chompas de lana y vendiendo las mismas. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de lana en mayor cantidad, pues debido a la temporada de invierno, sus chompas son muy requeridas y debe aprovechar esta oportunidad para mejorar sus ingresos la menos por los dos meses que restan al invierno. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona Huayna Potosi en  la ciudad de El Alto; es soltera y no hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y en Kiva.
texts.en:
Julia is a craftswoman who works knitting and selling woolen sweaters.  She needs this loan to buy yarn in larger quantities because her sweaters are very much needed in the winter season and she would like to make the most of this opportunity to improve her income over the two remaining winter months.

Julia lives in her own home which is located in the Huayna Potosi district, in the city of El Alto.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  This is the first time that she has obtained a loan from IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy yarn for her business knitting sweaters

loans.name: Melitina

texts.en:
Melitina is unmarried at the age of 38 years-old and lives in Piao, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte.

Melitina sells canned goods and other daily needs products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, oil, soy sauce, etc. to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns 3,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase goods and other products for her store such as noodles, canned goods, etc. 

Melitina has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for one month. In the future, Melitina hope to make her sari-sari store bigger and more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase goods and other products for her store such as noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal “El Molinito II” se reúne cada treinta en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú).  Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”. 

Janet nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 38 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. Actualmente, ella vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Ella vende camote, oca, plátano y yuca al horno por las calles de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 7 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Janet requiere el préstamo para comprar camote y yuca por kilos aproximadamente comprará 78 kilos por producto que le valen unos S/. 360.00 nuevos soles. El sueño de Maribel es abrir un depósito de venta de cerveza.
texts.en:
The “El Molinito II” (The Little Mill II) communal bank meets every thirty days in the city of Cusco (Perú).  Cusco is known for its tourism, commerce and for its traditional, Inti Raymi, festival and because one of the Seven Wonders of the World, Machupicchu, is located there.

Janet was born in Cusco and is 38 years old.  She’s married and has four children.  She currently lives in the same city where she was born and where she carries out her economic activities.  She sells roasted sweet potatoes, oca, banana and manioc along Cusco’s streets.  She’s been in business seven years now and does very well.

On this occasion, Janet needs the loan to buy sweet potatoes and manioc by the kilo.  She will buy approximately 78 kilos of product that cost about 360 new soles.  Maribel’s dream is to open a beer supply center.

loans.use: to buy sweet potatoes and manioc.

loans.name: Gulnara Del Rosario

texts.es: Gulnara de 35 años de edad labora  como secretaria del poder Judicial desde hace 4 años, solicita 2do crèdito con AFODENIC para  aRreglo de paredes en su vivienda y asi gozar de  mejores condiciones, su esposo trabaja como pintor  automotriz en su propio negocio, ambos son responsables y dedicados a su trabajo y a su familia, profesan la religion evangelica, su mayor sueño en la vida es que su familia permanezca unida y que siempre exista en amor de Dios.
texts.en: Gulnara, 35 years old, has worked as a secretary for the Judiciary for 4 years. She is requesting her second loan with AFODENIC to repair the walls of her home and so enjoy improved living conditions. Her husband has his own business as an automotive painter. They are both responsible and dedicated to their work and family, and profess the evangelical faith. Her greatest dream in life is that her family stay together and always live in the love of God.

loans.use: to repair the walls of her home

loans.name: Alma Nidia

texts.es:
La Sra. Alma Nidia es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, tiene un hogar conformado por dos hijas y su esposo los cuales han luchado juntos por construir su propia vivienda la que han acondicionado poco a poco gracias a todos los financiamientos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel, se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria en un colegio de la localidad con muchos años de experiencia.
Es el sexto crédito que solicita en Ceprodel para la compra de ladrillos, cemento, arena, pago de mano de obra con el fin de seguir mejorando su vivienda con todas las condiciones adecuadas y así brindarles un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Alma Nidia is from the town of El Sauce.  She has her own household which consists of her two daughters and her husband.  They have worked hard to build their own home which they have gradually improved thanks to loans that they have received from Ceprodel.  Alma Nidia works as an elementary school teacher in a school in the town.  She has many years experience.

This is Alma Nidia's sixth loan from Ceprodel and she will use it to buy bricks, cement and sand, and to pay labor costs.  Her aim is to continue improving her home so that it is in good condition and also to provide her daughters with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and sand, and to pay labor costs

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Ruel is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for seven years. He requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

Ruel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Ruel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is requesting the amount of PHP13,000 to buy feed and medicine for her pig raising business. She looks forward to having a bigger piggery business in the future. 

She is 54 years old and married with four adult-aged children. Her husband works as a farmer in the village where they are living. They work hard together to attain their goal of providing a good quality of life for their children. She believes that one way of doing this is to work harder and always be optimistic in battling through life's difficulties.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicine for her pigs.

loans.name: Tania Isabel

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO DE CALCA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Calca, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tania Isabel; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales como pollos y también la socia es profesora del nivel primario en el distrito de Calca, la socia las gallinas lo vende en forma ambulatoria, ella las hace engordar y crecer y los vende en el mercado de Calca, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar en el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Tania Isabel belongs to the communal bank "Valle Sagrado de Calca."  This bank is located in the Calca district, which is in Calca province of the department of Cusco.

Tania Isabel is 37 years old.  She is single and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business raising animals such as chickens.  She is also an elementary school teacher in the district of Calca.  She sells her hens in an itinerant manner.  She fattens them and raises them and sells them in the Calca market.  Through this business she is able to support her children.  Tania Isabel wants to expand and improve her business raising animals.  She requests a loan to buy chickens at wholesale.

Tania Isabel is happy to have this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy chickens at wholesale

loans.name: Josiah Mwangi

texts.en:
Josiah used his first loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. He planted and harvested, and it was very profitable.

This is his second loan and he plans to use this amount to buy more seeds and fertilizer for the next planting season.

Josiah hopes to become among the top leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area in the future.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for farming.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a hardworking business man aged 46. For the last year, he has been running a greengrocer's to make a living. Previously, he was operating a retail shop. In the next 5 years, he plans to manage a wholesale business. John has requested a loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is 36 years old. Her husband is 27 years old and works as a computer operator. The couple has a three-year-old son who is not yet in school. Yasmeen helps support her family by doing sewing and embroidery. She is very good at her work and her clothing is in high demand among her clients in the community.

Yasmeen is requesting a loan from the KIVA partner Asasah to buy a new sewing machine to help her finish client orders on time and earn more income. She has a good deal of experience and is confident that buying a new sewing machine will allow her to successfully upgrade her business.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa est une femme  âgée de 35 ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 2 enfants, tous scolarisés. Le premier a 7 ans et le dernier a 5 ans.  
Yawa travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2008. Elle vend des friperies, des bijoux et des chaussures  pour tous clients dans sa boutique. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la concurrence sur le marché. 
Yawa a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des friperies, des chaussures et des bijoux. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Yawa voudrait agrandir l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yawa is a 35-year-old woman who is married to a merchant. She has two children, both in school. The first-born is 7 years old, and the last is 5. Yawa has been working as a retailer since 2008. She sells second-hand clothing, jewelry, and shoes to any customers in her shop. She purchases her goods in Lomé, the capital of Togo. She works by herself. At the moment, her main difficulty is market competition. 

Yawa has requested her first loan with WAGES to buy some used clothing, shoes, and jewelry. She wants to reinvest in the business. In the next few years, she would like to expand it. 

With the profits, she says she plans on ensuring her children are educated.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing, some jewelry, and shoes to sell

loans.name: Mamadou Mansour

texts.fr:
Mamadou Mansour  est  un jeune aviculteur  âgé  de  31 ans qui a démarré son activité depuis  2008.Il est  célibataire  sans enfant.
Son activité consiste à élever des poulets de chair ; métier qu’il adore car l’ayant démarré dès le jeune âge.
Le prêt lui servira acheter de l’aliment volaille pour ne pas être en rupture et avoir de bons sujets.
Mamadou pourra avec ses revenus subvenir à ses besoins et renforcer son fond de roulement.
texts.en:
Mamadou Mansour is 31 years old, single and has no children. He is a poultry farmer and started a business raising broiler chickens (chickens raised specifically for meat production) in 2008. He loves his work, which he started at a very early age.

Mamadou Mansour will use this loan to restock on chicken feed so that he can raise healthy chickens. He will use the income from his business to take care of his needs and strengthen his working capital.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: Don Oscar es Habitante del municipio de San caralampio , junto a su familia , don Oscar desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de Piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo y no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para combatir  dicha plaga , ya que los siembras también ah sufrido daño por la naturaleza , asi como las inundaciones ya que parte del cultivo se vino abajo .Don Oscar se siente desesperado ya que si no aplica fertilizantes e insumos a su cultivo podría ser una pérdida total . Agradece al apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atraves de fondo Kiva ; ya que le dan la confianza a pequeños agricultores para que puedan salir adelante con la producción y asi mejorar sus ingresos para darle un mejor apoyo económico a su familia .
texts.en:
Don Oscar lives in the town of San Caralampio with his family.  

Don Oscar has been working growing pineapples for several years.  The biggest challenge he faces are the pests that invade the crop, and he doesn't have the financial resources necessary to combat such an infestation as the crops have also suffered damage from nature; part of his crops had already collapsed from flooding.

Don Oscar is feeling desperate, as if he doesn't apply fertilizers and other supplies to his crops, he could lose them altogether.

He is grateful for the support being offered by Afodenic through the Kiva foundation, as they are placing their trust in small farmers so that they can move ahead with their production and in this way improve their income to provide better financial support for their families.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose, 30 years old, is married and has six children, four of them in school. She has operated a business selling clothes in Buluk, South Sudan, for three years. Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Eliodora  Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Eliodora  Margarita es  una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como es : tacos dorados, enchiladas, empanadas  de pollo, tacos  dorados y entomatadas.
Es madre soltera tiene la cantidad de dos hijos por quien trabaja para darles una mejor vida y aprovechen las oportunidades que ella como madre les esta bando gracias al apoyo de fundación realidad.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración  de comida como son: chiles verdes, chiles  secos, quesos  , jitomate, cebolla, ajos  y maíz para la elaboración de tortillas echas  por manos mexicanas.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla a seguir adelante  ser madre y padre para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Eliodora Margarita is a hardworking woman who works selling Mexican snacks such as tacos, enchiladas, chicken empanadas, and entomatadas (tortilla with a tomato sauce).  She is a single mother.  She has two children that she works hard to give a better life so that they can take advantage of the opportunities she is giving them thanks to the support of Fundación Realidad.

She is asking for this loan to purchase ingredients to make food such as green chiles, dry chiles, cheese, tomato, onion, garlic, and corn to make handmade tortillas.

She is thankful to the Foundation for helping her get ahead and be both a mother and father to her children.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Sokhorn's Group

texts.en: Sokhorn, a mother of two little kids, is 25 years old and a villager from Battambang province. She is a farmer who does rice and cassava as the main source of income to support the basic need in family. This is the first loan for Sokhorn with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her cash-crop. She highly hopes that she can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and insecticide for her cash-crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Yelmar

texts.en: Yelmar was born in 1959 in Gubadli region of Azerbaijan. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) who resettled in Sumgayit city 14 years ago. He was married, but lost his wife during the war. When he started his business six years ago, he bought goods to re-sell. Now he sells cigarettes and other retail goods at the bazaar. Yelmar is requesting a loan to increase the  assortment and variety of goods he sells.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods he sells.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en: Thy L. is 41 years old and lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 children.  She works at a local organization teaching people how to become tailors.  She earns $5 at this trade, while her husband makes $7 driving a tuk-tuk (motortaxi-type vehicle) that he rents daily.  Thy L. will use this loan to buy a tuk tuk and motorcycle for their family to own so they don't have to face the day-to-day rental fees.  In the future, Thy L. hopes to buy one more tuk-tuk to rent out and to send her children to university.

loans.use: To purchase a tuk-tuk trailer and a new motorbike.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en: Mrs. T. is 28 years old and has just recently joined the TYM Fund. She has a 3-year-old daughter, and her husband is a driver and often on the road for an entire week. For the past 2 years, Mrs. T. has been operating a small grocery store on the ground floor of her house. Sales are low, because she has few goods to offer. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of US$250 to buy refreshments and cookies and, possibly, set up a little cafe in the back of the store.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for sale

loans.name: Tob

texts.en:
Mrs. Tob C. works selling vegetable at an open-air market and earns an average of $2.50 each day. Her husband works as a tailor and generally makes around $ 6.50 a day.

She is 43 years old and has three children. Three of her children are married and live separately from them.

Mrs. Tob C. wants to use this loan to add a greater variety of vegetables to meet the growing demands of her customers. She will also use some of the loan to repair her house.

loans.use: Expand the variety of vegetables to meet the growing demands of her customers.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 39, married with 6 children of her own and 2 dependents. She has a small general store in Kayunga, which she has operated for 3 years. With her loan she plans to buy more maize flour, soap, rice, g-nuts and hygiene products. Her dream is to one day have a bigger store where she can sell wholesale and to expand her business to other areas. The market for her items is wide and she is very honest and hardworking. She even markets to schools around the area.
Rose has been able to continue educating her children, built a house and helped farmers market their produce.

loans.use: Rose plans to use her loan to buy more hygiene products along with flour, rice, g-nuts, soap, etc. for her store

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
As a boy, Jose Alfredo learned from his parents that a grocery store, if properly managed, can afford one a good living. He has opened his own store and counts on the income to finance his studies at the university. He also works part time in construction. Between the store, the construction work and his homework, Jose works very hard to get ahead. At this time, he would like to buy more merchandise to stock the store and better serve his customers. He is asking for a loan of $325 which he promises to repay within 3 months. With your help, Jose Alfredo can finish his studies and find success.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

José Alfredo, es un hombre que lucha por salir adelante. Desde que estaba pequeño sus papás se dedicaron a los abarrotes, y el fue viendo que este negocio sabiéndolo manejar dejaba muy buenas ganancias. Es por esto que José decidió seguir el ejemplo de sus padres y poner su propio negocio de abarrotes que lo está sacando adelante para poder terminar de estudiar una carrera. Actualmente aparte de estudiar, y de tener la tienda de abarrotes trabaja medio tiempo en una constructora, y se divide el tiempo para poder realizar todas sus tareas. Esto habla de la lucha y la fuerza que tiene para salir adelante.

Sin embargo José está buscando crecer un poco su negocio al comprar más mercancía para poder tener más que ofrecer a sus clientes. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $325 para pagarlos en un plazo de 3 meses y con este dinero José piensa comprar más mercancía para ofrecer más y mejores productos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda José podrá terminar su carrera y ser un hombre de bien.

loans.use: To stock a small grocery store.

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Arsenio is 47 years old and his wife, Marina, is 51. They have two sons already grown who work independently and live in the capital (Assumption).

Arsenio has been working selling craft articles such as bedspreads, hammocks and tablecloths door-to-door for over twenty-five years. His wife weaves the bedspreads by hand with cotton threads as well as attending a small grocery that they have in their house.

Thanks to their hard work and their good business sense they have managed to maintain a family and also educate their children. As a result their children are already professionals with a good life ahead of them. Today Arsenio requests a loan in order to acquire thick cotton threads of many colors for weaving more hammocks and bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Arsenio tiene 47 años de edad y su esposa doña Marina 51, ellos tienen dos hijos varones ya mayores que trabajan en forma independiente y viven en la capital. (Asunción).

La actividad del señor Arsenio es la venta ambulante y a crédito de artículos artesanales como colchas, hamacas y manteles hace más de veinticinco años; su esposa elabora las colchas a mano con hilos de algodón además de atender una pequeña despensa que tienen en su casa.

Gracias a este trabajo y su gran vocación de emprendedor ha podido conseguir mantener una familia y además darle educación, por lo que actualmente sus hijos ya son profesionales, que tienen una vida hecha. Hoy Arsenio solicita el crédito para poder adquirir hilos gruesos de algodón de diversos colores para poder tejer mayor cantidad de hamacas y colchas.

loans.use: To buy thick cotton thread of various colors.

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Johana del Carmen G. D. is a single young woman with two kids who are studying in high school. This woman's business is a general food store. She has been working since she was young; her business started when she was separated from her husband. She says it was very difficult since she had no idea how she was going to support her kids. At one point in her life, she worked as a domestic worker, but due to it's low wages, she decided to invest in a general store instead.

These days, Ms. Johana works with CEPRODEL and has done so for the last 2 years. Seven loans have been extended to her which she has invested in her business to build her shop, and primarily to acquire products. Purchasing merchandise is her main need right now and the reason she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Natalie Kane, Kiva Volunteer.

Johana del Carmen G. D., es una joven soltera, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando su secundaria, el negocio de esta señora es una pulpería, ella desde joven ha trabajado, el negocio lo comienza cuando ella se separa de su esposo, nos comenta que fue muy duro ya que ella no tenia idea cómo iba a mantener a sus hijos, en un momento de su vida ella trabajó como domestica pero por los bajos ingresos que percibía decide invertir en la pulpería.

Hoy en día la señora Johana trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace 2 años habiéndole otorgado 7 créditos que los ha utilizado en la inversión de su negocio para construir su local pero principalmente para la adquisición de sus productos que es su mayor necesidad en este momento y por tal razón es que solicita el crédito.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.en:
The committee of women called “Working Women” is from Villa Elisa. They began with the work of Maria Ofelia G., who invited her women friends and neighbors to come together. Now they work with Fundación Paraguaya to better their businesses.

All of the women work hard in their respective businesses, whether it be selling clothes, food, or goods for the house. They understand that their children are all depending on them to bring in sufficient incomes so that they all can eat. The women all have the goal of keeping their children in school until they have graduated college.

The loan that they are asking for today will be used to buy more goods for their different businesses.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy items to sell including new and used clothing, fruits, yerba, cleaning supplies and fabric for sewing.

loans.name: Thol

texts.en:
Thol E. and his wife have been married since 1992. They have two sons and one daughter. Two of their children are in school and the youngest one stays at home. The family lives about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Thol E. has been a taxi driver for eight years. He carries people from his village to Phnom Penh City and from Phnom Penh to his village. His wife is a farm worker.

Mr. E. is requesting a loan for the first time. He is asking for $500 to buy a new motorbike for his business. This new motorbike will replace an old one.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to replace an old one

loans.name: Kimseang

texts.en:
Kimseang C., 40, is widow with no children. She lives with her parents and sister in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

For the past six years, Kimseang has earned a living by weaving silk into cloth. She sells her finished products to a middle man in her village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh.

Kimseang is requesting a loan of $1,000 U.S. dollars to buy raw silk use in her weaving. She also hopes to buy a motorbike for her family.

loans.use: To purchase silk to weave into cloth and a motorbike for her family

loans.name: Mujeres En Progreso (Women In Progress) Group

texts.en:
Lourdes, the leader of this group, is a 35 year old woman who lives with her husband Felix, and two teenage-aged children in the community of L. Guaricanos in the Dominican Republic. Things in L. Guaricanos are often very difficult; consistent and well paying work is hard to come by, but the people live on the outskirts of the capital and as a result are forced to pay somewhat inflated prices for everything from food to school supplies, prices that most people simply cant keep up with.

Lourdes runs a small business selling dried flowers, scented candles, natural medicines and a few different chemicals to help treat skin problems. She normally sells these items to people who know about her business from her home, and will also walk the streets a few times a week. She has asked for this loan so that she can buy a new selection of candles—candles are always sin demand since the power goes out an average of two to three time each day. She would also like to expand the types of herbal medicines she is able to offer her clients.

She hopes that with the extra income this loan will help her make, she will be able to improve the lives of her children and improve the manner in which they all live. She also says she hopes to raise them with good health, and teach them what it means to make an honest living in a world where many people resort to corruption and stealing to get by. She wants to see them all happy, and she hopes that she will able to see her family continue to move forward in their lives economically and happily.

On behalf of Lourdes and everyone here at Esperanza International, we thank you for supporting his dreams and goals!

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of more inventory for her business selling flowers, candles and medicines.

loans.name: Kinh

texts.en: Kinh S., 37, works with her husband selling fish at home. Everyday they purchase fish from a market vendor and resell them to the people in their area, making, on average, $9 per day in revenue. This couple has four children, all of  whom are students. Now Kinh is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchase more fish from the market to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Erika Maribel

texts.es:
Erika started her business in order to help her husband with the family expenses. A year ago, she started selling dairy products and cured food such as cheeses, sausages and chorizo among family and friends. Later people began to recommend her products and her clientele grew. She decided to invest her earnings in a paper products store, which while it has been operating for only a short while, is doing very well. It is ideally located close to a school.

She needs a loan for $200, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to buy merchandise, since her sales and clientele are growing. With your support Erika will move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Erika inició el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con el gasto familiar comenzó hace un año a vender lácteos y embutidos: quesos, chorizo y salchichas entre amigos y familiares, después la gente la empezó a recomendar con lo cual amplio su clientela, decidió invertir sus ganancias poniendo una papelería, con la cual tiene poco tiempo pero como esta cerca de una escuela le esta yendo muy bien.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía ya que sus ventas se han ido incrementando, con tu apoyo Erika saldrá adelante

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nguvu Self-Help Group

texts.en:
Gilbert is a leader and member of Nguvu Self-Help Group. He is 31 and married with four children. Gilbert has been operating a small retail shop on the main road of Suneka town for four years. He started his shop after saving money from his former job for several years.

Gilbert is a kind and hardworking man. From the profits he is able to feed, clothe, and educate his children. With the assistance of the loan, Gilbert will increase stock for his shop. He is excited to purchase some new items, which he believes will generate more income. Gilbert is beaming with optimism about the busy economic season that runs from September through January in Kenya. His long-term business goal is to open up a wholesale unit in the future.

In addition to his retail shop, Gilbert has diversified into livestock. He owns one dairy cow and ten chickens. Selling the milk and eggs add another stream of income towards his overall profits.

Disclaimer: Due to recent events in Kenya, the security situation in many communities remains unsettled, affecting many local businesses. Lenders to this entrepreneur should be aware that this loan may represent a higher default risk, and should be willing to accept this additional risk in making their loan.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 23-year-old Halima C. from Dar Es Salaam. She is married. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting 1 dependent who is an orphan. Halima has been running a grocery business since 2000, and her business is performing well. She works at the business for 16 hours per day, 7 days per week. Halima currently earns about $300 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $450 in order to purchase additional stocks of wheat flour, rice, and maize flour, sugar, etc. In the future, she plans to expand her business.

Halima thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of wheat flour, rice, and maize flour, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Anita tiene 48 años. Se dedica a muchas cosas que, ni en su conjunto, logran darle una calidad de vida adecuada a ella ni a su esposo taxista de 53 ni a su hijo de 12 años que cursa el 1º grado de secundaria, componentes de su hogar. Anita cocina menúes, lava ropa y, a lo que le dedica mayor tiempo y, obviamente, lo que le depara un mayor ingreso es a los tejidos de lana.


Estando cercana la temporada navideña, época del año en que más productos de lana vende, es que solicita encarecidamente un préstamo de 600 soles para poder plasmar toda aquella creatividad en los tejidos por lo que el dinero financiaría los implementos necesarios para su cometido.
texts.en:
Anita (or "Little Ms. Ana") is 48 years old. She engages in a variety of endeavors that collectively succeed in providing adequate support neither for herself, her 53-year-old husband who drives a taxicab, her 12-year-old son who is in his first year of secondary school, nor for their home. Anita cooks meals, takes in laundry and weaves items out of wool, an activity to which she devotes most of her time and which obviously provides greater income. Since the Christmas season is approaching, a time of year when she sells more wool products, Anita is urgently requesting a loan of $200 (600 nuevos soles), money that would finance the supplies needed to be able to translate all that creativity into finished products.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for the Christmas season

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Madame B. Amivi est née en 1971 à Lomé, mariée et mère de 4 enfants, elle vit actuellement à Tsévié avec son mari. Très tôt, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de vente de bouillie de maïs les matins et les soirs. Par la qualité de sa bouillie et de l’hygiène quelle pratique, elle est très connue dans sa localité. Elle sollicite un financement pour s’acheter des sacs de maïs et de sucre, les intrants pour son commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amivi B. was born in 1971 in Lomé and is married with four children. She presently lives in Tsévié with her husband. Early in her life, she began to sell maize porridge mornings and evenings. She is well known in her area for the quality of her porridge and her cleanliness. She is requesting this loan to buy sacks of maize and sugar and other ingredients for her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stockpiling maize to prepare porridge for sale

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Hello from Angelique U. from Western province of Rwanda! This entrepreneur is 31 years old and has four children. Angelique started her business with a small shop where she sold only milk, bread, and cake, but with our loans, her business has grown, as you can see from her business pictures. 

This entrepreneur is requesting for a loan of 500,000 Frw to increase her working capital and enable her to raise money to pay for her children’s school fees next year. This loan will be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: Increase her working capital

loans.name: Shamshad M.aslam Group

texts.en:
Shamshad baji is 30 years old and married. She owns a two-room brick house in a city named Vehari, Pakistan and has lived in it with her family for the last 25 years. She is an uneducated lady. She could not get an education because her parents could not provide one for her with their little financial resources. Her husband's name is M. A.. He has a business selling sewing machines and 10 years of experience in this business. Shamshad baji is the mother of two sons who are not yet school-age. She performs her duties as a mother and as a wife also. Her dream is to see her sons in good positions. To achieve her dream, she makes embroidered dresses and sells them in clothes markets. She does this work because her parents could not provide her other education or training, but she wants to give skills and opportunities to her kids.
