She successfully repaid her first loan that she took from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan and Kiva's Field Partner). Now she is applying again for a loan to buy more sewing machines to increase her husband’s income.

She is the group leader of three other women. Parveen baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her motorbike rental business. Saleema baji wants a loan to buy utensils for her utensils-selling business. Shahnaz baji wants a loan to buy sewing machines for her business selling sewing machines.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy sewing machines and utensils to resell, and to buy a motorbike to rent out.

loans.name: Korotimi

texts.fr:
Madame Korotimi Traoré est âgée de  44 ans, mariée elle vit avec son mari et ses 5 enfants  dans une grande  famille traditionnelle avec d’autres ménagers dans le quartier Sécoura de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Ayant abandonné l’école  pour  des raisons sociales, elle commence très tôt à mener les activités commerciales. Après avoir  mené plusieurs, elle  finit par  embrasser le métier de teinturière. Initiée par l’ONG ALPHALOG, son apprentissage a pris  3 ans. Elle mène cette activité depuis 13 ans et jouit d’une grande notoriété. Elle participe aux foires et expositions nationales et internationales. Elle est membre de la coordination régionale des artisans de Ségou, présidente de la fédération nationale des artisans du Mali (FENAM), vice présidente du réseau des femmes artisanes d’Afrique de l’ouest. Elle jouit également d’une grande clientèle diverse et variée, elle reçoit des  commandes  de partout.
Elle  est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis 42 mois. Après  3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
Ce prêt   sera  utilisé pour acheter, 50 pagnes de tissus, 5 cartons d’eau de javel et 2 cartons de savons. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières sur place.
Madame Korotimi Traoré vend lors des expositions, foires, festivals et au centre culturel Sinignesigui de Sécoura. Elle effectue ses ventes   au comptant et à crédit. Sa clientèle est composée d’hommes et de femmes, nationaux et étrangers.
Avec ce prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 200 000 FCFA, ce dernier lui permettra d’aider d’autres personnes surtout les filles en déperdition scolaire. Son rêve est de créer une entreprise dans le domaine de l’habillement.
texts.en:
Ms. Korotimi Traoré, age 44, is married and lives with her husband and children in a large traditional family with other households in the Sécoura district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having dropped out of school for social reasons, she started early on working in commerce. After doing several kinds of work, she ended up embracing dyes and tinting as a trade. With training from the non-governmental organization ALPHALOG, her apprenticeship took three years.

She has working in this trade for thirteen years and enjoys a great reputation. She participates in national and international fairs and expositions and is a member of the regional coordination of Ségou artisans of Mali (FENAM) and is the vice-president of the women artisans network of West Africa. She also enjoys a large, diverse, and varied customer base and receives special orders from all over.

She has had an association with Soro Yiriwaso for 42 months. After three solidarity loans and two individual loans, all repaid, she is on her third individual loan. The loan will be used to buy 50 lengths of cloth, 5 boxes of bleach, and 2 boxes of soap. She gets her basic supplies locally. Sales are made at expositions, fairs, festivals, and at the cultural center Sinignesigui de Sécoura. Cash or credit is accepted from customers composed of men and women, national and foreign.

With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA, which will enable her to help other people, especially girls in need of schooling. Her dream is to create an enterprise in the clothing sector.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic supplies for dyes and tinting

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 38-years old and married with six children. Juliana sells provisions and foodstuffs in her house, and she wishes to expand this business because she is determined to increase the prosperity of her family.  Juliana is requesting a loan so she can increase her inventory and expand her business opportunities. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Casiana,

texts.es:
Seis años Casiana estuvo trabajando en el comercio de diversos tipos de calzado en el centro de Chosica como ambulante. Luego de ello se asocio a una compañera suya para emprender otro negocio. 

Por un corto tiempo se dedico entonces a la venta de láminas escolares y papelería. Este negocio iba marchando bien hasta que lamentablemente su compañera cayo enferma. Debido a que el negocio no iba a poder ser retomado, dividieron la inversión puesta en él y cada una fue por su camino. 

Casiana pensó que seria buena idea abrir una tienda en la casa donde vivía. A raíz de ello, su negocio son ha dejado de crecer. Hoy la tienda tiene cinco años y cada vez esta mas surtida. No solo vende abarrotes, también verduras y dulces. Hace un año y medio invirtió en la instalación de un pequeño locutorio en su tienda.

Aunque no le va nada mal en su negocio, Casiana tiene pensado cambiar su negocio por algo mas tranquilo, que no demande mucho esfuerzo físico, puesto que es ella quien se encarga de hacer las compras de toda su mercadería, incluyendo la de las verduras.

Las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ella la ahorra para poder construir su casa propia en el terreno que ya posee junto con su esposo. Sus cuatro hijos son mayores e independientes, por lo que ahora la prioridad es tener un hogar propio donde vivir con su esposo, quien trabaja como chofer.
texts.en:
For six years Casiana worked selling all variety of shoes in the center of Chosica as a traveling saleswoman. Later, she joined up with a friend of hers to start another business. For a little time, then, she worked selling school and office supplies. This business was going well until, unfortunately, her partner fell quite ill. Because they weren't going to be able to continue with their business, they divided the investment they had put into it and each went her separate way. Casiana thought that it would be a good idea to open a store in the house where she lived. As a result, her business has continued to grow. Today she has been in business for five years, and her business is every day better stocked. She not only sells groceries, but also vegetables and sweets. A year and a half ago she invested in the installation of a little phone-center in her store. Although her business is going well, Casiana has thought about changing gears for something a little quieter that isn't so physically demanding, since she is the one who is responsible for buying all her merchandise, including the vegetables. She saves the earnings from her business so she can construct her own house on a lot she already owns together with her husband. Her four children are grown and independent, and now her priority is to have her own house where she and her husband, who works as a driver, can live.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
V. is 23 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a mother of a child who is still young. She is married to Mao, 20, who works in a restaurant as a cashier with a salary of $80. She is famous for always getting admirable comments from the manager.

To help reduce the family's expenses, V. is taking out a loan of $500 to buy a motorbike for her and her family's transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her and her family's transportation

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es: Milagros tiene 24 años, es soltera y vive en la casa de sus padres. Hace más de 4 años viene trabajando en el hotel “Las Brisas”, ubicado en la carretera central a 5 cuadras de su casa. Su trabajo de recepcionista dice gustarle, y el dinero que gana ahí, le permitió apoyar a su madre con sus cultivos en momentos de necesidad, además le agrada mucho la agricultura, en especial la siembra de café porque considera que es un producto muy rentable, sobre todo en las fechas festivas. Ahora Milagros va a empezar sembrar sus propios cultivos en un terreno de la chacra de su madre, porque quiere convertirse en una agricultora próspera. También aprovechará su trabajo en el hotel para ofrecer a sus clientes los granos de café de su chacra, sin la necesidad de intermediarios. Milagros está muy entusiasmada con su proyecto de siembra de café, a la vez está conciente que le llevará  muchos años de esfuerzo conseguir una clientela regular. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y tiene buenas expectativas acerca de los grupos solidarios y su dinámica de trabajo, por lo cual, hace el compromiso de pagar puntualmente cada una de las cuotas señaladas por su asesora de crédito. Con el dinero que solicita comprará plantitas de café para empezar con sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Milagros is 24 years old, she is single and lives with her paretns. For more than 4 years she has been working in the Las Brisas hotel, located on Central Road about 5 blocks from her house. She is a receptionist and she said she likes her job. The money that she earns has permitted to help her mother with the cultivations whenever she has needed the support, in addition, she loves agriculture, especially cofee because she considers it a very profitable product (especially on holidays). Milgros will start her own plantation in her mother's field because she would like to become a prosperous agriculturer. She will also continue with her work at the hotel to be able to offer her clients the coffee beans from her plantation, without needing a distributor. Milagros is very much looking forward to the coffee plantation project, but she is also mindful that it will take many years of hard work to earn a steady clientele. It is her first loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she has good expectations with independent groups and their work dynamics. She has made the compromise to pay her dues on time as indicated by her credit agent. With the funds she is requesting she will purchase coffee seedlings to start her first plantation.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase coffee plants.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama S., is twenty-eight years old, married, and has three children who are in school. Mariama lives with her family at Bawjiase in Ghana. She runs a small provisions kiosk in her neighborhood. She also sells food items such as macaroni, tomatoes, etc. on a table top in front of her kiosk. She has been in business for seven years. Mariama buys her goods from wholesalers in the city and markets in nearby towns.  She desires to buy the goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city in order to minimize the problem of frequent trips. She is a member of a group called “Shining Star”. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support in handling repayment.

loans.use: To buy groceries in bulk for resale

loans.name: Narciso Eusebio

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr.: NACISO, el es natural de Pilcopata, situada en el distrito de kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo, correspondiente al departamento del Cusco, correspondiendo a la entrada al parque nacional del Manu, a 8 horas de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es agricultor, el tiene terrenos en los cuales cultiva, arroz, yuca, plátano, piña. Pero el también tiene invertido su capital en una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, para lo cual también solicita el préstamo para reinvertir en la tienda de abarrotes y comprar aceite, azúcar, fideos, harinas y otros que esta zona no produce.

El socio se encuentra sumamente agradecido por el apoyo prestado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Mr. Narciso H. is a native of Pilcopata, located in the Kosñipata district of the Paucartambo province, department of Cusco. His town is near the entrance of the Manu National Park, located some 8 hours from the city of Cusco.

Our client is a farmer who has crop fields where he cultivates rice, cassava, plantains, and pineapples. He has also invested his capital in a small general store. He is requesting this loan in order to reinvest in his store by purchasing cooking oil, sugar, noodles, flour, and other goods that are not produced in the area.

Our client is extremely grateful for the support that he has been given, committing himself to paying back his loan within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock general store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stock in bulk for her business

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en:
Abiba is 38 years old, married, and the mother with seven children. Two of them are currently in school. She lives in her husband’s house at Sefwi in the western region of Ghana.

Abiba works very hard to support her husband to provide her children’s basic needs. She is a food vendor who sells rice and stew in the community where she lives. She started her operation about twenty years ago in taking care of her entire family.

Abiba’s food production is on a low scale because of inadequate funds to support her business. She wants to use the loan to buy more meat, vegetables and bags of rice to increase her ability to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support and provide for her family and to finance her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, vegetables, meat, firewood etc.

loans.name: Kifea Group

texts.en:
Asha is a member of the KIfea borrower group in Msamvu, Morogoro. She is a 48-year-old woman, She is married and the mother of four children. Her children are ages 22, 14, 19, and 8 years. She also cares for one other dependent. 

Asha started her own business selling charcoal two years ago . She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 50,000 Tanzania Schillings. 

This is Asha’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 150000 TSH in order to expand her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Asha hopes to get more food, save money, pay school fees and expand her business.

Siwatu, another member of the KIfea borrower group, has also requested 200,000 TSH in order to support her own business of selling food.

loans.use: To expand her business of charcoal

loans.name: Firuzahon

texts.ru: Фирузахон Палванова проживате в районе Руми. Возраст 22 года. Замужем, имеет 2 детей. Фирузахон имеет торговую точку на рынке "Баракат", где торгует овощами.  Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 2 лет. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Firuzahon P. is 22-years-old, lives in Rumi District, and is married with 2 children. She has been selling vegetables from the stall she has at the Barakat market for the past 2 years. She is seeking a loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her sales.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny tiene 27 años, es madre de 4 hijos, vive con su pareja quien trabaja en obras de construcción. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa para los distintos géneros, esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante, pues no cuenta con un local propio. Su mercadería la adquiere en su propia ciudad y posteriormente la lleva a ofrecer por distintos lugares, vendiéndola al crédito o al contado. Jenny está contenta con esta actividad porque le está yendo muy bien, pues anteriormente vendía comida, pero no le producía buenas ganancias. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es mantenerse activa y apoyar en algunos gastos familiares a su pareja. Para más adelante quiere comprarse una moto para visitar a sus clientes y vender sus prendas con mayor rapidez y facilidad, ya que actualmente lo hace caminando. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos los integrantes son colaboradores y se conocen entre sí. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra de más ropa y algunos zapatos para dama.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Alejandrina Claudia

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina es socia del Banco Comunal “San Salvador Luminoso”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Capachica, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 34 años de edad, estado civil casada y es madre de 4 hijos y estudio educación primaria completa, vive en Capachica.

La señora trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 8 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para la compra de productos de la región. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 200.00 Nuevos soles, el cual invertirá en la compra de abarrotes, también vende productos de la región.

Su mayor deseo es continuar su trabajo.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Alejandrina is a member of the San Salvador Luminosos Comunal Bank, which is located in the Capachica district, Puno province, Puno department. She is 34, married, and has four children. She has an elementary school education. She lives in Capachica. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for almost eight years. With her initial loan for 300 PEN she bought products from her region. She is now asking for a loan for 200 PEN to buy groceries. She also sells regional products. Her biggest wish is to continue working. She likes the savings and the punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries

loans.name: Corcona Corazon Group

texts.es:
CORCONA CORAZÓN:

Este grupo se formó en mayo año 2005, durante este tiempo los diez integrantes han recibido créditos que han ayudado a mejorar su negocio con la finalidad D. mejorar su calidad D. vida. 

Es así que la tesorera del grupo Grace R. A. decidió vender hace cuatro años abarrotes en un espacio D. su casa, esto lo hizo con el dinero que le daba su esposo lo cual lo estaba ahorrando para comprar dos sacos D. arroz, 1 saco D. azúcar, 1 caja D. aceite, 1 caja D. conserva y 1 paquetes D. fideos para el comienzo D. una tienda D. abarrotes. Tuvo algunos altibajos este negocio; pero la administración que supo dar Grace hizo crecer su negocio, resultado D. ello pudo mejorar su vivienda, terminar D. educar a sus hijos en la escuela, y empezar a darle una carrera técnica a su hijo mayor. 
No conforme con ello Grace y su esposo, deciden invertir en un vehículo que actualmente lo alquilan para así seguir generando ganancias adicionales, esto se dio con los préstamos que obtuvo con EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD más los ingresos D. su esposo como chofer y los D. la tienda. Su propósito es continuar D. educar a su último hijo D. cuatro años; además forjar un futuro para su vejez, dado que Grace no cuenta con una jubilación; es por ello que necesita el préstamo para seguir implementando más su tienda.


Arsenia R. C. D. O. tiene 58 años, madre D. ocho hijos, 3 aún dependen D. ella, al ver que no abastecían los ingresos que le daba su esposo como cerrajero; es que toma la decisión D. vender galletas, golosinas, gaseosas, sándwiches en un kiosco que alquiló, a fin D. cubrir los gastos D. la familia numerosa. Asimismo preparaba en casa tamales los fines D. semana; lo que también tuvo pequeñas ganancias Por un tiempo dejó D. vender debido a la recaída D. su último hijo con síndrome D. down, retomando poco tiempo en el negocio pero ahora D. cervezas, ventas que hasta momento ha sido rentable. 
Necesita el préstamo invertir una parte en cerveza y la diferencia comprar una vitrina y vasos, porque posteriormente quiere volver abrir el kiosco y seguir apoyando a su familia.

Libia O. R. venD. D. manera ambulatoria frutas, gaseosas, refrescos, sándwiches que ella misma prepara en casa, sus productos los coloca en una cesta y los ofrece a los pasajeros y turistas que se estacionan por unos minutos en el control (peaje) D. Corcona, para continuar luego su camino por el centro del Perú. Las ventas D. estos productos lo invierte una parte en la carrera superior a su mayor hijo que estudia mantenimiento D. máquinas pesadas y el resto del crédito en la alimentación para sus hijos. El crédito que necesita es para invertir en su negocio.
texts.en:
CORCONA CORAZÓN: This group was formed in May 2005. Since that time, the ten members have received loans that have helped to improve their businesses, with the goal of improving their quality of life. The group’s treasurer, Grace R. A., decided four years ago to start selling groceries from her home. She did this with money that her husband gave her. She saved it up to buy two sacks of rice, 1 sack of sugar, 1 case of cooking oil, 1 case of canned food, and 1 package of noodles to start a grocery store. She has had some ups and downs with this business, but Grace’s administrative skills caused her business to grow. Because of this she was able to improve her house, finish educating her children in school, and get her oldest son started in a technical degree program. Grace and her husband decided to invest in a vehicle that they rent out so that they can continue to generate additional income. They were able to do this with loans that they obtained from EDAPROSPO – PROSPERIDAD plus her husband’s income as a driver and the income from the store. Her goal is to continue educating her youngest child, who is four years old. She also wants to build a future for her old age, since she doesn’t have a pension. She needs the loan to continue running and improving her store. Arsenia R. C. D. Orozco is 58 years old and the mother of eight children, 3 of whom are still dependant on her. Her husband’s income as a locksmith wasn’t enough, so she decided to sell cookies, sweets, soft drinks, and sandwiches from a rented kiosk, with the goal of covering expenses for her large family. She also prepared tamales at home on the weekends, which also provided her with some small income. She quit selling for a while due to an illness of her youngest son, who has Down syndrome. She is now selling again but now she sells beer, which has been profitable so far. She wants to invest part of her loan in buying more beer and she’ll use the remainder to buy a display case and glasses, because she wants to eventually open the kiosk again and continue supporting her family. Libia Orozco R. is a street vendor of fruits, soft drinks, fruit drinks, and sandwiches that she prepares at home. She puts her products in a basket and offers them to passers-by and tourists that park for a few minutes at the toll gate in Corcona before continuing their trip through central Peru. She invests part of her earnings in tuition for her oldest son, who is studying heavy equipment maintenance, and the rest in food for her children. She needs the loan to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: P. owns a phone booth. She is 22 years old and single. She hopes for the loan amount of N50000 to purchase more phone rechargeable cards and Sims cards of all networks to sell. She thanks all kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more phone rechargeable cards and Sims cards of all networks

loans.name: Merelyn

texts.en:
Merelyn P. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old, married and has 5 school-age children. To make a living, Merelyn owns & operates a general store. The primary income for the business comes from selling daily use products like shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Merelyn has been engaged in her business for over 13 years, and earns approximately 2,700 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Merelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional products for sale in her store. Merelyn is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be her 6th loan from PMPC and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Deurng

texts.en:
Mrs. Deurng P. is a villager in Ta Saom village in Takeo province. She is married with five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. The other two are attending the local school; the youngest is too young to work or study. She owns a piece of land upon which she cultivates rice.

Her husband, Mr. Puth Teng, is a construction worker (he is on the right in the photo). Since his work site is far from home, it costs a lot to take a motorbike taxi to work. In order to reduce expenses, Deurng is asking for a loan to buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to ride to work.

loans.name: Delmar

texts.en:
Motorcycle transport is the primary source of income of Delmar and his wife Shanalyn in the village of Barangay Cataggaman Viejo Tuguegarao City. Aside from the transportation business, Delmar is also engaged in farming, while Shanalyn is a hog raiser in their village to earn extra income. 

For the continuous development of their transportation business, Delmar is again requesting a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 from lenders. He hopes that his loan will be approved again to enable him to maintain his motorcycle transport business. 

Delmar and Shanalyn are blessed with only one child. The couple hopes that their only child could finish a degree course.

loans.use: addtional capital for the maintenance of his vehicle

loans.name: Progreso Okinawa Group

texts.es: Las características del grupo “Progreso Okinawa” es que son personas que desean progresas para sacar adelante a sus familias a través de su trabajo y dedicación a sus negocios. Son personas muy trabajadoras como lo demuestra su representante la señora Ignacia que se dedica a la venta de Patasca que es un producto muy tradicional en Santa Cruz, el resto de las integrantes se dedican a la venta de pan, jugos, comida y al servicio de albañilería y empleos domésticos. La competencia con respecto a sus negocios es fuerte, ya que todos tienen que trabajar duro para poder sacar adelante sus negocios. El crédito será utilizado para la adquisición de materia prima, insumos y herramientas para poder elaborar un producto en menor tiempo y con mayor eficiencia y calidad para ofrecer al mercado. A pesar de ser si primer ciclo ya tienen experiencia en grupos solidaR. gracias a  créditos en instituciones similares a la Fundación Agrocapital, con la cual están agradecidas por la confianza y el apoyo económico que ayudara a cumplir sus metas y mejorar mas sus ingresos brindándoles una mejor educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The characteristics of “Progrsso Okinawa” group are that they are people who want to move their families forward though work and dedication to their businesses. They are hard workers as demonstrated by Señora Ignacia that sells Patasca, a typical product in Santa Cruz. The rest of the members sell bread, juice and food. Others are dedicated to bricklaying and domestic help. The competition with respect to their businesses is intense so they have to work hard so they can move ahead with their businesses.

The credit will be used in the acquisition of raw materials, consumables and tools to make products in less time and with better efficiency and quality to offer in the market. Despite the fact that this is their first loan cycle, they already have experience with solidarity groups thanks to credit from other institutions similar to Fundación Agrocapital. They are appreciative of your confidence and economic support that helps them to accomplish their goals and raise their income helping provide a better education for their children and a better quality of life for their families.

Translated from Spanish by karl baumgarten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La Sra. Delia es propietaria de una Despensa en la ciudad de San Patricio Misiones, ubicado sobre ruta 1, es madre de 2 jóvenes, quienes viven con ella en casa propia, su marido trabaja en la ciudad de Encarnación, quien viaja constantemente.
Ella con  su esfuerzo y la de su marido lograron abrir la despensa de la cual la pareja hoy en día se sienten orgullosos ya que ayuda en gran parte para los gastos de la casa. 
Ña Delia también la cuida a su madre quien vive con ella.
La Clienta opera con mucha satisfacción con la Fundación Paraguaya  por la atención que recibe y por que mediante la misma lograron ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is the owner of a small grocery store in the city of San Patricio Misiones, located on route 1. She is the mother of 2 youths who live with her in her own house. Her husband works in the city of Encarnacion, and he travels constantly. With the efforts of herself and her husband, Delia managed to open the store and today the couple feels very proud of this accomplishment since it helps them tremendously in paying the household expenses. Delia also cares for her mother, who lives with her. She is very satisfied with the business that she does with the Paraguayan Foundation, for the attention she receives and because through the Foundation she has managed to enlarge her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy basic merchandise such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, noodles, flour, drinks, bread, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase tailoring accessories and cloth.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal, 42 , lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with her husband and their four children. Amal has owned a grocery store since 1999, selling candies, canned food, beverages, etc. She has requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to expand her stock and diversify her merchandise, thereby helping her meet client demand. This is the first time that Amal has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

Amal decided to start her business because she wanted to supplement her husband’s income, and over time has gradually diversified her product offerings. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans to continue improving her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Asterio

texts.en:
Asterio M. is 53 years old and married to Anatolia Benitez. They have four kids who are grown up.

Asterio has been in the same line of work for fifteen years. To open his food stall he first had to sell some land that he inherited from his mother and then used the proceeds to buy his first merchandise. Asterio's wife helps him so that the couple can get ahead and hopefully help their children pay for their education.

The loan will be used to purchase food such as rice, sugar, herbs, oil, and noodles. Asterio would like to eventually expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, herbs, oil, noodles and other foods

loans.name: Dalia Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, en Managua, la señora Dalia A. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de embutidos y de queso siendo muy visitada por vender el producto de alta calidad.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los embutidos ya que lo necesita para su respectiva venta y de esta manera continuar en su venta en el mercado.
texts.en:
In the Mayoreo Market in Managua, Mrs. Dalia A. sells cheese and cold meats. She has many customers due to the high quality of her products. Dalia currently requests a loan to buy the cold meats she needs to sell in order to continue doing business at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cold meats

loans.name: Percy

texts.es:
Percy, tiene 40 años, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos de las cuales todavía depende de él, Cesar tiene 18 años, Diego tiene 13 años, Valery tiene 08 años y Luz Adriana tiene 03. 
Percy es de profesión albañil, él nos cuenta con mucha angustia que a medida que pasan lo años los hijos crecen y necesitan más cosas pero su sueldo de albañil no le alcanza entonces Percy tenia que dedicarse a otro negocio entonces vio la oportunidad de entrar a la venta de artesanía. Percy nos cuenta que fue difícil al principio abrir una pequeña tienda de venta de artesanía porque no conocía mucho del tema y también había mucha competencia pero a pesar de las adversidades logro cumplir su sueño de tener su propia tienda y ahora tiene un stand en el centro comercial “INTIPAKARI” que se encuentra ubicado en la avenida principal de la ciudad del Cusco. Percy vio que es un negocio rentable entonces decidió abrir un pequeño taller de fabricación de artesanía de la forma que el mismo se ha su propio proveedor. El socio es un hombre trabajador y responsable y no dudo un instante en ser parte del banco comunal “Sacsayhuaman”. Ya tiene varios ciclos trabajando con Arariwa. Percy usará el crédito para  comprar chompas, chalinas, guantes y chullos.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Percy is 40, married, and has four children who are still dependent upon him. Cesar is 18, Diego is 13, Valery is 8, and Luz Adriana is 3. Percy is a bricklayer. With much anguish he tells us that as the years pass the children grow and need more things. But, his salary as a bricklayer is insufficient. Therefore, Percy had to work at another business. He saw the opportunity to start selling handicrafts. Percy tells us that in the beginning it was difficult to open a small store selling handicrafts. He did not know much about the subject, and there was a lot of competition. In spite of the adversities, he was able to fulfill his dream of having his own store. He now has a stand in the Intipakari commercial center, which is located on the main avenue in the city of Cusco. Percy saw that the business was profitable, so he decided to open a small shop for making handicrafts. That way he is his own provider. He is a hard-working and responsible man. He did not hesitate for a minute to become part of the Sacsayhuaman Communal Bank. He has worked with Arariwa for several cycles. The loan is to buy sweaters, shawls, gloves, and "chullos" (Peruvian knit hats with ear flaps). He is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and he promises to makes his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweaters, shawls, gloves, and "chullos" (Peruvian knit hats with ear flaps)

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the village of Kinoguitan, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Elsie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John O. D. is a farmer in Nambal, Busia District. He has been involved in farming since 1973. He is married, 57 years old, and the father of seven children. He plants twice a year in tandem with the season but does vegetable farming during the dry spell by irrigation.

John decided to venture into the farm produce business after realizing that most of his land was lying idle. He would like a loan of Ksh 20,000 which he will use in expanding his farming area. His plan is to guarantee an education for his children.

loans.use: To expand his farming area

loans.name: Erlinda Calamba Group

texts.en:
Erlinda C. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacabn, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Erlinda is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults.

Erlinda is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 1200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Erlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase farming supplies, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Serwaah Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Esther is a women’s leader, hard-working and a resourceful mother of five children. She is 53 years old and still married to a blacksmith. She lives together with her family in a town close to Sunyani. Esther is a petty trader who sells fresh yams and cooking oil to customers in her community. Operating her business for the past 24 years, Esther has amassed good marketing experience and made many repeat customers.  She plans to invest the loan to purchase fresh yams and oil to meet her customers’ demand. She dreams of being able to put up a house from her savings to improve her family’s accommodation in her home town.

Esther is currently the leader of a trust bank group called 'S.', named after Esther, made up of ten members. The other members are also engaged in food processing and petty trading businesses.

loans.use: To purchase fresh yams and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Asnat

texts.en: Asnat P. is a married small-business woman. She runs a business selling both fried and fresh fish to her customers. She purchases the business goods direct from the fish market at the Ferry at wholesale and retail in Dar es Salaam. She sometimes purchases direct from the fishermen by order at wholesale. She succeeded in buying a plot of land at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam and she meets the children's school fees using the income generated by her business. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Yasohara Yesenia

texts.es:
La señora Yasohara Yesenia C. A., tiene la edad de 32 años es casada y su esposo labora como Auditor Interno en una Empresa Privada, tienen 2 hijos menores de edad que estudian la primaria, ella se dedica a realizar trabajos domésticos en un casa privada desde hace mas de 5 años, que ha representado una de las fuentes importantes en la economía de su hogar.

Ellos habitan en el Reparto Juan Ramón Padilla, en una casita muy humilde, y ahora en el invierno se le han presentado muchos problemas de inundaciones, es por esta razón que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de  materiales de construcción que permitan llevar a cabo estas remodelación del muro del frente de su vivienda esto para una mejor, comodidad, seguridad y salubridad de todos los miembros de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Yasohara Yesenia C. A., 32, is married and her husband works as Internal Auditor in a Private Company. They have two minor children who are in elementary school. She earns a living providing housekeeping in a private home which she has done for more than five years and which represents one of the important sources of income to her household. They live in the Juan Ramón Padilla development in a small and very modest house which during the winter has seen repeated problems with flooding. They are seeking a loan in order to purchase construction materials which would allow them to remodel the wall at the front of their home in order to improve the comfort, safety and health of all the members of their family.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodelling the wall at the front of their home

loans.name: Rolando Francisco

texts.es:
Rolando de 43 años, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), tiene un puesto de venta de pollos en un mercado de Fortín. 

Empezó hace 15 años en (1995) en un pueblo llamado “Balzar” (habitan agricultores), el compraba los pollos y se encargaba de matarlos y pelarlos, los vendía  en el pueblo, pero como quería mas ingresos decidió vivir en Guayaquil y comenzar con su negocio en un mercado, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su propio puesto y ahora vende pollos por libra, se levanta a las 05h00am a faenar los pollos. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar gavetas, pollos, un congelador. En el futuro quiere tener un local y construir mejor su casa.
texts.en:
Rolando is 43 years old and lives in the Fortín neighborhood of Guayaquil. It is on the hilly outskirts of the city and has dirt roads. He has a stand in the Fortín market where he sells chickens. He started this business 15 years ago in a rural town called Balzar. He would buy chickens and slaughter and pluck them before selling them around town. However, he decided that he wanted to earn more profits, so he moved to Guayaquil and began his business in the market. Little by little through his hard work he was able to buy his own stand and now he sells chicken by the pound. He wakes up at 5:00 a.m. to prepare the chickens. With the loan he will purchase drawers for his stand, chickens, and a freezer. In the future he hopes to have his own store and make improvements on his house.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drawers, chickens, and a freezer

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace D. is currently in the business of selling crates of beer in a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Grace is 31 years old and is married with a husband that is a teacher. She has 4 children, and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her bar.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DE CHAPI”; este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia  es la Sra. Judith; ella tiene 30 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos  ella es promotora  cultural desde hace 1 año;  La socia también vende ropa  a pedido para lo cual requiere capital.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa  para la venta. 

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Judith, 30, is a member of the “VIRGEN DE CHAPI” communal bank located in Huanchac district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She has a life partner and two children. She has been working as a Cultural Promoter for the last year and also sells clothes that customers order from her. She’s asking for a loan to buy more clothes to sell. She is grateful for and values the loan granted by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Milagro Del Carmen

texts.es: Milagro del Carmen V. H. de 50 años de edad, es una señora quien siempre ha luchado por salir adelante, ella posee una tienda la cual esta ubicada en el sector de la playa en el departamento de La Unión, su negocio ha estado ubicado por más de una década en este mismo lugar, el cual es una zona muy estratégica para ella ya que cuenta con una gran afluencia de turistas, quienes consumen sus productos, así como también clientes fijos los cuales viven en los alrededores del lugar. Milagro vive junto a su padre, dos hijos y su esposo, la tienda es la única fuente de ingresos con la cual esta familia cuenta, razón por la que todos trabajan en ella. Milagro solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de productos perecederos y de primera necesidad tales como: agua, bebidas, golosinas y otros más. Milagro es una mujer muy fuerte que pese a tantas situaciones adversas no pierde su deseo por salir adelante y ser mejor cada día.
texts.en:
Milagro del Carmen V. H., 50, is a woman who has always fought to get ahead in life. She has a store in a beach area in La Unión department. It has been in the same place for over 10 years. It’s a very strategic spot because of the large number of tourists that frequent it and buy her products as well as the regular customers who live around the area. Milagro lives with her father, her two children and her husband. The store is the only source of income this family relies on so they all work in it. Milagro is asking for funds to stock the store with perishables and basic needs items like: water, beverages, sweets and others. Milagro is a very strong woman who despite many adverse situations does not lose her desire to get ahead and be better every day.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perishable goods.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity A. is currently in the business of selling 'simsim' (sesame seeds), peas, beans and onions  and is requesting a loan to stock fish to sell.  Charity is 37 years old and is married to a husband who is a doctor. She has five children and four of her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to establish a small farm.

loans.use: Stock fish to sell

loans.name: Miguel Antonio

texts.es:
el señor Miguel Antonio Z. A. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en union libre señora Maria Leonarda Rodriguez con quien a procreado 4 hijos, Miguel y su familia viven en la colonia 18 de Diciembre de la comunidad de San Lorenzo desde hace 18 años.
Miguel se dedica a la elaboracion de tejas y ladrillos que se utilizan para construccion de casas, esta actividad la realiza desde hace unos tres años y tiene la ayuda de dos hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de tierra y barro para elaborar el ladrillo y las tejas.
su meta es poder tener una mayor produccion para asi tener mayores ganancias, las cuales necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Antonio Z. A. is 37 years old and lives with Mrs. Maria Leonarda Rodriguez. They have four children. Miguel and his family have lived in the 18 de Diciembre neighborhood in the community of San Lorenzo for 18 years.

Miguel works making tile and bricks used in housing construction. He has done this for three years and two of his children help him. He will use the loan to buy dirt and clay for making bricks and tile. His goal is to increase production and earnings, which he needs to cover the family’s expenses and to provide his children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy dirt and firewood

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian L. is from the town of Banga. She is 45 years old. Vivian is married and has two school-aged children. She is involved in rice farming. She makes sure the farm is free of weeds and pests to keep her crops healthy. She said it is easier to sell a good quality of rice. Vivian also runs a sari-sari (variety) store to help with her family's daily needs. She sells various kinds of products that the people in her neighborhood usually buy from her.

Vivian joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vivian has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Vivian is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Đặng

texts.en:
H.  Đặng Thị (20201030017) is a 37-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 4 school-aged children. H. owns & operates a business, generating income from providing general services to local community members. H. has been engaged in this business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3.800.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4.704.000 VND from SEDA. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business. H. is now requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be her 5th loan from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated to financially support immediate members of her family.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


H.  Đặng Thị (20201030017) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, H.  Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  H.  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 1 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, H.  kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2007, H.  đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  H.  đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.736.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Khoản vay sẽ là 5th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  H.  dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  hỗ trợ tài chính cho các thành viên gần gũi trong gia đình của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina O. lives in Trinidad Bohol. She is a wife and a passionate mother to her five children. She has had a sari-sari (variety) store since 2007. She sells a variety of goods so that she can help her husband earn a living for the family. 

She would like to apply for a loan of 3,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the money to expand her business and add additional goods to resell. In that way, she believes that she will be able to increase her profit and support the needs of her family.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie D. T. is a married woman who lives in Malocbaloc, Brgy. Agujo, Daanbantayan, Cebu. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: Food Vending and buying and selling firewood. Her husband Marcelo, who is 33 years old, works as a fisherman/trisikad driver to earn his living.  They have 3 children who are currently going to school and are between 5 to 9 years old. 

Rosalie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2009 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past two loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 5,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,600, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 3rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use as additional funds for her business operations so that she can continue to save up for future home improvements. 

 Rosalie D. T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: working capital for her business

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba A. is married and has two children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has been a junior high education, and is a seamstress at Abura. She has been in this business for ten years. Aba uses her income to assist her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Aba will use the loan to purchase more material to expand her sewing business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more material to expand her sewing business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad from Marka, Amman is 57 years old and the father of three children. He started his business years ago when he was producing a special kind of sweets but he was distributing his products using his own feet. The strong determination and aspiration of Mohammad along with his sons help turned his business into a successful and famous one.

He is requesting a loan of 1000 JD to purchase raw materials and to carry out maintenance on the bus used for his products' distribution. Mohammad is planning to open a shop for his business to increase market exposure. He will then be able to increase his family's income and employ more family members in the business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and to carry out maintenance on the bus used for his products' distribution

loans.name: Wulamatu

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Wulamatu K.. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 12 years. In 2008, Wulamatu established her business; she sells items such as bedspreads and trousers. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband. Working six days a week and six hours a day, she earns about 400,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000 and hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Wulamatu plans to buy stock from the neighboring country of Guinea. She would also like to educate her children to the university level. Wulamatu is very determined.

loans.use: Improve the stock of her business

loans.name: Las Esmeraldas Group

texts.es: L. Sra. Amelia, tiene 3 hijos  es conviviente  y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desD. hace 1 año, Amelia  es tesorera del grupo “Las Esmeraldas”, grupo conformado por 9 amigas. Amelia  trabaja vendiendo productos D. belleza  desD. hace 10 años y a su vez también venD. gaseosa, cerveza y los domingos comida, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a  logrado mejorar L. calidad D. vida D. sus hijos, brindándoles educación  y con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería y así empezar a vender ropa  . Sabemos que Amelia  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Amelia is in a common-law marriage and has three children.  She has been working with Edaprospo for one year.  Amelia is the treasurer of the “Las Esmeraldas” (The Emeralds) group, which is comprised of nine friends.

Amelia has worked selling beauty products for ten years.  She also sells soft drinks, beer, and food on Sundays.  Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has managed to improve her children’s quality of life and to proviD. them with an education.

In order to keep growing, she has requested a new loan to buy merchandise and start selling clothes.  We know that Amelia will reach her goals with a lot of work and effort.  The loans from Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: comprar mercaderia

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen G. was born in 1981 in Kapan. He lives with his parents, his wife and his two sons. Armen’s wife stays at home and takes care of their children. 

For about two years, Armen has running his butcher’s shop. He buys pork, beef, veal, mutton, lamb and chicken meat from villagers and sells it in his shop. Armen works very hard without any free days and thereby is able to keep his family. 

Armen asks for a $1,900 loan to buy a large lot of meat for his butcher shop.

loans.use: To buy a large lot of meat for his butcher shop

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carolina de 26 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, vive con sus hijos y su esposo, se dedica a la venta de verduras, frutas y hortalizas, primeramente comenzó ofreciendo atol, pero luego decidió buscar un negocio más rentable y es cuando inicio sus ventas en verduras, frutas y hortalizas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para surtir más en puesto de venta, adquiriendo verduras y frutas para mantener productos y ofrecer a los clientes la mejor calidad. Esta ayuda fortalecerá su comercio y así contar con mejores ganancias.
Las aspiraciones de Carolina es aumentar el puesto de venta, con productos frescos y de calidad, que sus hijos tengan acceso a culminar sus estudios y que mejoren sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carolina, 26, lives in Jiquilisco, Usulután Department with her children and husband.  She sells fruit and vegetables.  She used to sell atoll (a corn based drink) but then decided to find a more profitable business and that’s when she went into fruit and vegetable sales.

She is requesting a loan to better stock her sales stand acquiring fruit and vegetables to have better quality product available for her customers.  This help will strengthen her business and she’ll have better profits.

Carolina’s dreams are to enlarge her stand with fresh and quality products, that her children are able to finish their schooling and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Zacarias Mizael

texts.es:
Zacarías de 35 años, es un hombre trabajador que tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa. Comenzó la tienda porque su papa siempre le enseño hacer panes y vender víveres, poco a poco con la experiencia de su padre el decidió tener el mismo negocio. 

Ahora el tiene una pequeña tienda surtida con una panadería. Realiza tortas, bocaditos y vende víveres. Trabaja desde las 05h00am haciendo panes, bocaditos etc. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su tienda-panadería. Por eso quiere el préstamo para tener más ingresos y comprar vitrinas para su local. En el futuro quiere mejorar su negocio y ampliar su casa.
texts.en:
Zacarías is 35 years old.  He is a hard-working man who has a small store in the front of his home.  He set up his store because his dad taught him how to make bread and sell food products.  Gradually, with his father's exeperience, he decided to set up in this business.

Now Zacarías has a small store and bakery.  He makes cakes and snacks and sells food products.  He works from 5.00am making his bread, snacks, etc.

Zacarías has many aspirations for his store-bakery.  He would like this loan so that he can make more income and buy display cabinets for his premises.  In the future, he would like to improve his business and extend his house.

loans.use: to buy display cabinets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sweet rolls and French bread

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, desde hace más de 53 años tiene 5 hijos y todos trabajan de manera independiente, por lo que siempre está aportando lo mejor para mantener su negocio, este es el primer financiamiento por lo que ha sido muy importante, para salir adelante. Por lo que el viaja a diferentes departamentos para buscar los diferentes productos que sus clientes le solicitan. El crédito es para la compra de toallas, sabanas, cosméticos, calzado y artículos para el hogar. Ella sueña con mejorar el servicio con sus clientes y proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juliana works selling a wide range of merchandise. She has been in this business for 53 years. She has five children, each of whom works independently. This is why she does her best to keep her business going strong. This is the first loan that Juliana has received. It means a lot to her as it gives her a chance to get ahead in life. 

Juliana travels to different parts of the country in order to find the products that her customers have requested. She will use this loan to purchase towels, sheets, cosmetics, shoes and household goods. Her goals are to improve her customer service and make some improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase towels, sheets, cosmetics, shoes and household goods.

loans.name: Sang De Jesus Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SANG DE JESUS  est composé de deux personnes qui vivent toutes les deux dans le même quartier à Kowégbo à Cotonou.  C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sèdé Victorine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sèdé Victorine est née le 24 Février 1974 à Porto-Novo, capitale politique du Bénin. Sèdé Victorine est mariée à un certain Thierry et a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à charge. Sèdé Victorine et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis près de six ans, Sèdé Victorine vit à Kowégbo avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Sèdé Victorine exerce depuis huit ans environs, comme activité la vente de chaussures et de mêches dans sa boutique size à Sodjeatimey. C’est à Lomé au Togo, mais aussi à dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Sèdé Victorine achète ses produits. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Sèdé Victorine sollicite, ensemble avec son groupe, un autre crédit. Son ambition est de construire plus tard sa propre maison.
texts.en: SANG DE JESUS (Jesus Blood) is a group composed of 2 people who both live in Kowégbo, a neighborhood of Cotonou, Bénin. This is the second time that this group requests a loan from ALIDé, in order to increase their business. The group representative, Sèdé Victorine, is the one raising her hand on the picture. Sèdé Victorine was born on February 24th 1974 in Porto-Novo, the political capital of Bénin. She is married to a man called Thierry. They have 3 children who all go to school. In addition to their own children, they take care of two other children. Sèdé Victorine and her husband both take care of the family financially. Sèdé Victorine has been living in Kowégbo for about 6 years with her husband and her children. In order to take care of her family and to raise their standard of living, Sèdé Victorine has been selling shoes and hair weaves in her shop in Sodjeatimey for about 8 years. It's in Lomé, Togo, and also in Dantokpa, an international market in Bénin, that Victorine purchases those items. In order to meet the needs of her customers and to increase her income, Victorine, along with her group, is requesting another loan. Her ambition is to have her own house built in the future.

loans.use: to buy shoes and hair weaves.

loans.name: Comité Pyahu Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio Bernardino Caballero de la ciudad de Caaguazu, son 15 mujeres quienes se agruparon para formar un  comité solidario, las mismas son señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras, poseen un espíritu emprendedor y de ayuda mutua.
La que encabeza el grupo es Felicita, una madre soltera que lucha día a día para mantener  a sus 2 hijos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de limpieza para uso doméstico como detergentes, lavandinas, jabones, desodorantes de ambiente, entre otros, porque se dedica a la venta de estos productos y desea poder obtener un mayor ingreso familiar, pretende que utilizando este crédito pueda otorgar a sus clientes una mayor variedad en los artículos de limpieza doméstica.
Todas las integrantes son personas que se reúnen semanalmente, con el compromiso de coordinar las tareas del comité para una mejor organización entre las integrantes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the Bernardino Caballero neighborhood.  It has 15 women who joined together to form a solidarity committee.  They are very responsible and hard working; they have a spirit of enterprise and mutual help.

The group is headed by Felicita, a single mother who strives daily to support her two children.  She asked for the loan to buy home cleaning supplies like detergents, bleach, soap and room deodorizers, among others.

The group meets weekly in order to coordinate group tasks for better organization among the members.

loans.use: to buy cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Sol Marina

texts.es: Sol es una mujer de 54 años de edad que vive en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio al sur de la ciudad, ella es casada con un comerciante y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 24 a 27 años que están empleados en empresas;  desde esta comunidad llena de muchos encanto,  trabajo y solidaridad entre sus habitantes, Sol se dedica a la comercialización de mercancía variada, como ropa, calzado y cosméticos en general. Vende  su mercancía principalmente a crédito y está enfocada en  lo que la gente le encargue,  pero también trabaja mediante guías especializadas de productos, porque tiene una clientela que ella misma se esmera en cuidarla y consentirla ,  respondiendo siempre a sus pedidos , así mismo cada día le refieren a nuevos compradores;  su credikiva es el segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con él comprará productos cosméticos de oferta del  catálogo que maneja, calzado y ropa sobre un pedido que le han hecho y esto es justamente lo que hace que su inversión sea exitosa, porque de esta manera  su mercancía rota rápidamente entre los clientes que pagan puntualmente. Cuando en el año 2000 inició su negocio, lo hizo después de un experiencia  muy importante en el mercado en el año 1986, la cual  le sirvió mucho en la temporada actual;  esta es la razón por la cual se le ha facilitado negociar con los mejores proveedores de mercancías, conseguir clientes y sostenerlos satisfechos; Con el anterior financiamiento  ha visto su progreso  en el aumento de su clientela, pues contó con un capital de trabajo adicional.  Su sueño es lograr la sostenibilidad de su negocio para dejar a su familia una herencia de prosperidad y buen ejemplo, su mayor desafío es tener un capital de trabajo disponible para responder prontamente a los nuevos clientes, que cada día son más. Mientras Sol construye su sueño, se esfuerza por mantener una rentabilidad no menor del 26% y trabaja todos los días en su incremento.
texts.en: Sol is a 54 year old woman who lives in the citadel of "20 de Julio" in the city's south end. She is married with a merchant and she has 3 children, aged 24 to 27. They are all employed by private companies. This community is charming with much work and solidarity among its inhabitants. Sol is a merchant of a variety of merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, and cosmetics in general. She sells her merchandise primarily on credit and she focuses herself on her clients' orders, although she also works through catalogues of specialized products. She strives to be attentive and doting to her existing client base and to always respond to their requests, which is the reason why she is referred new clients, daily. Her Kiva loan is the second loan which she accesses through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner). With it she will purchase cosmetics products, shoes, and clothing which are on sale through the catalogue which she manages. A large order has been placed and this is exactly the reason why her investment will be a success. She is able to rotate her merchandise quickly among the clients that make their payments on time. When she started out her business in the year 2000, she profited from a very important experience she earned in the field in 1986. It has helped her greatly in her current business. She has allowed her to easily negotiate with the best merchandise providers and to earn a client base and to keep them happy. With the previous loan she observed an increase in her clientele, especially because she had additional capital funds. Her dream is to achieve sustainability for her business, to leave her family with a prosperous inheritance and a good example. Her greatest challenge is having to work with a small capital funds with which to respond quickly to new clients, who increase every day. While Sol builds her dream, she strives to maintain a profit margin of no less than %26 and she works every day to improve it.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics which are on sale, clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Elda

texts.en:
Elda is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines.  She is married with 6 children. 

Elda has a shop that sells snacks, detergent, noodles and biscuits.  She has had this business for 4 years.  She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Elda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Bibetou

texts.fr: Dame de 53ans, Bibetou vend des objets en plastique et du mais. Pour aider son mari retraité, elle sollicite ce prêt pour s’approvisionner en bassines, sceaux, plats à Lomé. Elle a 10ans d’ancienneté dans cette activité et revend à domicile. Il vend aussi du mais.
texts.en: A lady of 53, Bibetou sells plastic-ware and maize. To help her husband who is retired, she is requesting this loan to stock up on basins, buckets, and platters in Lomé. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells out of her home. She also sells maize.

loans.use: to buy plastic-ware.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José, tiene la edad de 47  años, está casado, vive con su hijo y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos y almacigo para su posterior siembra. El cuenta con el terreno ya preparado para su siembra y apto para la explotación de este cultivo en buenas condiciones. El quiere establecer una buena plantación de café para así obtenerle buenas cosechas en su futuro. El piensa en el futuro de su familia y quiere mejorar su nivel de vida cada día más.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José, 47, is married living with his son and wife who are his greatest priorities.  He intends to use the loan to buy farming supplies and seedlings for subsequent transplantation.  He has a field in good condition that’s prepared for planting and apt for this type of farming.  He wants to establish a good coffee plantation to get good harvests in the future.  He is concerned about his family’s future and wants to improve their standard of living more each day.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has had no previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings and farming supplies.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Supporting a family is a big responsibility for parents. This is a large family that has nine children. Five of them are married and live separately from their parents. Four of the nine are single. Some of the kids are studying at primary school and secondary school also.

Presently Mrs. Chea is a cake seller at a school. As for her husband, he is a farmer. Both of them can earn perhaps $5 per day. To allow her big family to live in comfort as rich people in her community, Mrs. Chea wishes to borrow the amount of $500 to raise chickens.

loans.use: to raise chickens.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 59 years old and is married with nine children. She lives in Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. For the past two months, Estrella has operated a business where she buys food such as bread and takes it to the market to barter. She also sells bread to earn a living.  Estrella has been a member of PMPC for three years.

Estrella is requesting a 3,000 PHP loan to purchase bread, soft drinks, and other food products to take to market to barter for corn or exchange for other items. In the future, she hopes that her children become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase bread, soft drinks, and other food products to take to market and barter

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Fatmata. She is married to a policeman and has 3 children, aged 4, 9 and 15 years. All of her children go to school. 

In 2001, Fatmata established her clothing and bedding business. She began her business because she learned from her mother, who trained her to do this business. "My business is special to me because I make profit from it, which I use to help my husband in supporting our family," said Fatmata. 

Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL1,200,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL3, 000,000. Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy men's jeans - 2 dozen @ SLL480,000, wax cotton - 1 pieces @ SLL1,950,000, ladies skirts - 1 dozen @ SLL48,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL300,000. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to open a shop and continue accessing loans that will enable her to achieve her dreams. She wants her children to live a good life and have a good education. Rise in transportation costs and rainy season are major challenges for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for men jeans - 2 dozen @ SLL480,000, wax cotton - 1 pieces @ SLL1,950,000, ladies skirt - 1 dozen @ SLL48,000.

loans.name: La Paix De Godomey Group

texts.fr: Le groupe LA PAIX DE GODOMEY est formé de quinze personnes qui habitent dans le même quartier et qui se réunissent un fois par semaine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Olympiade est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Olympiade est âgée de 31 ans et est mariée à un peintre du nom de Félix. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Olympiade vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales.
