Il y a près de deux ans, Olympiade mène comme activité la vente d'ustensiles de cuisine et des tissus à son domicile et par le système de distribution. De façon secondaire, Olympiade vend du charbon de bois à son domicile. Olympiade s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Olympiade désire obtenir un financement, ensemble avec les autres membres de groupe LA PAIX DE GODOMEY. Ce crédit leur servira certainement à augmenter leurs stocks de produits.
texts.en:
Group 'La Paix de Godomey' is composed of fifteen people who reside in the same district and who meet once a week. The group's representative, named Olympiade, is raising her hand in the picture. This is the first time that this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support in order to grow their business.
Olympiade is 31 years old and is married to a painter named Félix. The couple has one child, who attends school and is in their care. Olympiade lives together with her husband and her child. The couple provides for their family's various needs together.
For about two years, Olympiade has been retailing cooking utensils and fabrics from her home and through the distribution system. As a side business, Olympiade sells charcoal from her home. She gets her supplies from Benin.
In order to strengthen her business and to better satisfy her customers, Olympiade would like to be granted a loan together with the other members of group 'La Paix de Godomey.' This loan will definitely be used to increase their merchandise stores.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and charcoal.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Raquel has a shop that sells canned goods, chocolate powdered drinks, noodles & beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, shampoo & beverages  .
Raquel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Raquel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, shampoo & beverages

loans.name: Laili

texts.en:
Laili is a resident of Gulcho, a nice village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. She is 48 and married to a woodworker. Laili has five children: four daughters and a son. Two older daughters work in the sewing workshop and the other children study at school. 

Eleven years ago Laili got livestock as a present from her parents and since that time she has been engaged in livestock breeding. If the family needs money to meet their needs, she can sell some livestock. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase three farm animals for breeding. In the future Laili wishes to see her children married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is married and has two children. She is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Lolita is a farmer and grows corn and cassava to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years. 

She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her farm.
 
Lolita has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her farm .

loans.name: Mary Wanja

texts.en:
Mary used her first loan to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings for her farm. She planted and harvested, and it was very profitable.

She plans to use this second loan to buy more fertilizer and seedlings.

In the future, Mary hopes to become among the top farmers in the area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is 53 year old, an embroidery expert who shares the financial burden with her husband by doing decorative embroidery. She also has an animal selling business. She buys goats and sheep in their younger age, raises them and sells at a profit to butchers.

Her husband is a milk seller. He operates his business from the shop and offers good rates to his customers.

Nasreen is the mother of three sons and a daughter. Her sons have businesses of selling fruits and vegetables while her daughter is a seamstress.

Nasreen has applied for a loan loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her eldest son’s business. With the loan he will buy vegetables and fruits of fresh quality that will allow him to increase his profits and sales.

He has been operating his business for many years and Nasreen is hopeful that an investment will help him make more money from it.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a small entrepreneur who has been selling beauty products such as AVON cosmetics for more than five years now. With the minimal profits earned from the business she is able to provide daily allowances of her children.

Elizabeth, 53, is requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy more products to offer such as perfumes, lipsticks, makeup, powder and intimate apparel. She wants to increase her product offerings to make her business more profitable.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to see all her children earn degrees and someday help to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more products to offer such as perfumes, lipsticks, makeup, powder and intimate apparel.

loans.name: Guchi

texts.ru: Гучи женат и имеет троих детей. Он занимается выращивание и продажей сельскохозяйственных культур. Он является владельцем бизнеса и любит свое дело. Более 7 лет он продолжает свой бизнес и старается расширить его. Раньше он занимался купле продажей крупнорогатого скота. Гучи хотел бы получить займ в размере 4000 Сомони для покупки минеральных удобрений и мелко рогатого скота для того чтобы расширить свой бизнес и стать успешным в своем деле. Он надеется на вашу помощь и благодарит вас за вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Guchi is married and has three children. He is in the business of growing and selling crops. He is the owner of this business and loves his work. For more than seven years, he has kept his business going and is trying to expand it. Earlier he bought and sold cattle. Guchi would like to receive a loan of 4,000 somoni to purchase mineral fertilizers and small livestock to grow his business and become successful in this work. He looks forward to your help and thanks you for your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: purchase mineral fertilizers and small livestock

loans.name: Sadatou

texts.fr:
Sadatou est une femme âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant. Elle a 3 enfants.
Sadatou travaille comme commerçante depuis 1991. Elle vend des produits d'alimentations à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, n’a pas de difficulté.
Sadatou a requis son 1er crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des garnitures. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Sadatou voudrait ouvrir une boutique. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit de prendre soin de sa famille.
texts.en: Sadatou is a 42 year old woman.  She is married to a shopkeeper.  She has three children.  Sadatou  has worked as a shopkeeper since 1991.  She sells food products from her home.  She buys her products in Lomé.  She works alone.  At the moment, she has no business problems.  Sadatou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy garnishes.  She wants to re-invest in her business.  Over the next few years, Sadatou would like to open a shop.  She says that with the profits, she plans to take care of her family.

loans.use: to purchase general food products.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman with two children. Elizabeth is 31 years old, residing in the Philippines. Elizabeth owns and operates farm land, planting & harvesting rice for sale to earn a living.  She's been in this business for 10 years. Each month she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer. Elizabeth has been a member of GDMPC for 6 years. In the future, Elizabeth wants to make improvements to her house and to finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Aloysie

texts.en:
Aloysie is 26 years old and married with two children aged between 4 and 6 years old. She owns a tailoring business. This is her eighth year in this business, and she works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. Aloysie currently employs one person to help her.

Aloysie has requested a Kiva loan through Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various materials for her tailoring business. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and be able to buy her own house.

loans.use: to purchase various materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ngoeurn

texts.en:
Ngoeurn, 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She sells breakfast foods, such as Khmer noodles and porridge, from home.  Ngoeurn has had this business for over six years and is successful in her career.  Her husband has worked at the river port for over ten years.  All of her children are employed; three are garment workers and the fourth child is a truck driver. 

To improve her family’s circumstances, Ngoeurn requests a USD 1,000 loan for a new business to purchase groceries to sell from her home.   In the future, she would like to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell from home in order to generate extra income for her family.

loans.name: Gardelias Del Sur Group

texts.es:
Maria Elena cuenta con 29 años de edad es casada tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando Carlos y Alexis están estudiando la primaria, Kenia la secundaria, su esposo se llama Gregorio tiene 29 años de edad es campesino.

Ella se dedica al comercio vende tamales de arroz tiene aproximadamente un años con el negocio el préstamo lo invertirá en el negocio comprará los insumos que utiliza para los tamales como son arroz, aceite, chile, hojas para envolverlos ella vende sus tamales ahí en su pueblo, a doña Maria Elena le gustaría que su negocio creciera mas ya que dice que es de gran utilidad en su familia es una fuente de ingresos.

Maria Elena pertenece al grupo las gardenias del sur el cual esta integrado por puras mujeres trabajadoras a continuación serán mencionadas: Lidia, Josefina, Benita, Elizabeth, Delia, Marta, Maria, Guadalupe, Lizeth, todas realizan actividades comerciales como son: venta de comida, pan, abarrotes, atole, etc.
texts.en:
María Elena, 29, is married and has three children in school, Carlos and Alexis in elementary school and Kenia in secondary school.  Her husband Gregorio, 29, is a farmworker.  She works selling rice tamales, a job she has had for approximately a year.

She will invest the loan in the business.  She will buy the supplies she uses for the tamales, which are rice, oil, chilis, and leaves to wrap the tamales.

She sells her tamales there in her town.  María Elena would like her business to grow more because she says it is of great use in her family as a source of income.

María Elena belongs to Gardelias del Sur Group, which is made up of the following hardworking women: Lidia, Josefina, Benita, Elizabeth, Delia, Marta, María, Guadalupe, and Lizeth.  They all work in commercial activities such as selling food, bread, groceries, atole [a corn drink], etc.

loans.use: to buy the supplies to make tamales, such as rice, oil, chilis, and leaves.

loans.name: Antawara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANTAWARAS”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanía, elaboración y venta de mantas y ponchos, venta de ganado vacuno, producción de papa, venta de chompas, venta de papa y chuño, venta de ganado porcino.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adela es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías en lana; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió gracias a la herencia en lanas que le dejo su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la atención en salud y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The Antawaras communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Patacamaya Focal Center.  It is comprised of eight members and is headed by a board with Adela as the president.  The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied.  Among them are handicrafts, making and selling blankets and ponchos, selling cattle, potato production, selling sweaters, selling regular and freeze-dried potatoes, and selling pigs.

The loan will benefit small business people such as Adele.  She says that this is her first time being a member of Pro Mujer.  She joined by invitation from a representative of the institution who visited Adele at her house.

She currently has a business of crafts made from wool.  She says that she undertook this business thanks to an inheritance of wool that her mother left her.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase capital (to buy wool).  She will get the wool at the fairs in the city of El Alto.  She will later make things, and she will sell them at the space where she sells.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible.  She is married and has six children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health services and the savings.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Donald

texts.en: Donalds lives in Buza area, on the outskirts of Dar es Salaam.He owns a vegetable and fruits stall where he sells different fruits and vegetables items.He fetch some of the fresh produce like tomatoes and spinaches from local farmers near his residence.Other farm produce like oranges,bananas and pineaples come from nearby regions.Donald need to expand his business to meet a risen demand from his clients by having enough stock.He is planning to have cages for produts hygiene and attractive display.He also planning to have a bicycle to help him fetch some locally produced produce from nearby areas. To fulfill these requirements he is in need of USD 750,to subsdize his capital.

loans.use: BUSINESS EXPANSION

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh Q. is a local small market owner in the town of Khachmaz located in the northeastern part of Azerbaijan. Saleh is married with three children and is looking for funding in order to expand the types of goods he offers. He wants to expand his customer base by increasing the variety and quality of the goods he sells.

loans.use: Purchase new and diversified inventory

loans.name: Moegau

texts.en:
Moegau is living on the far end of the island of Upolu, and she is running a different kind of business from all the other ladies at the Center.

Moegau owns thirty cows, and they are kept in a fence so that they won’t go out. These cows are for family "faalavelaves" (family events, such as weddings and funerals) and for special occasions.

This is the most expensive and most worthy animal in the "faasamoa" (a word that refers to the Samoan way of life). The cheapest price for a cow based on size is $500 for the small cow.

Moegau’s family is going to be one of the good families in the future if this business continues.

loans.use: To purchase nails, a hammer, copper wire, salt for the cattle and animal feed

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en: Sarin has been married since 1993 and has 1 daughter. She learnt to weave and started a silk production business almost 20 years ago. Her husband is a construction worker. Sarin has borrowed a loan from MAXIMA already before. Now she is asking for another loan of US$300 to purchase silk materials and sewing thread and to prepare thread on the loom. She is capable of repaying the loan.

loans.use: Purchase of silk materials, sewing thread, fees for selecting and preparing thread on the loom.

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es:
Felicita, 48, is married and has two children. She owns a small grocery store and, in addition to that, a business selling men’s and women’s clothing. Her husband is in charge of selling the clothes and goes out on his motorcycle to sell them in the towns around Caacupe.

She has had her store for more than 15 years and some years sales have been good and in others, not, but she considers herself a fighter and an entrepreneur because she always looks for ways to improve and sell what her customers need. In recent months, she invested much of her savings in clothes for sale. In her store, she sells basic commodities like oil, milk, eggs, cheese, vegetables, etc. Her main customers are workers such as the neighborhood bakers.

She would like to continue stocking her store because there’s been a rise in demand for her products, so she’s asking for $1,000 to invest in the purchase of sugar, milk, meat, wine, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer.

Felicita, tiene 48 años, está casada y tiene dos hijos, ella posee una despensa, y como actividad adicional también se dedica a la venta de ropas para caballero y para damas, en éste negocio el encargado de vender es su marido quién con su motocicleta sale a vender por las ciudades aledañas a Caacupé.

Su despensa lo tiene ya hace más de 15 años en algunos casos con buenas ventas y en otras con bajas, pero no obstante se considera una luchadora y emprendedora ya que siempre busca innovar y vender lo que la gente necesita. En estos ultimos meses invirtió gran parte de sus ahorros en la compra de ropas. En su despensa vende productos de primera neceidad como aceite, leche, huevos, queso, verduras, etc. Sus principales clientes son los obreros, como así también los panaderos de la zona.

Ella desea seguir surtiendo su despensa ya que registra un alza en la demanda de sus productos, por lo que solicita la suma de $ 1000 que los invertirá en la compra de , azúcar, leche, carne, vino, etc.

loans.use: Buy merchandise for sale.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: 'I started this business  in 1984 and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safeguard  my capital to ensure continuity in business' - all these are words of Mrs. Felicia O. who sells garri, plantain, pepper and bush meat. She is married with 7 children, 48 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State. She has been in LAPO for 6 years. She needs the loan amount of $400 to buy more garri, pepper, brush meat and melon for sale.

loans.use: To buy more melon, pepper, and garri & bush meat

loans.name: Pulau Menjangan Group

texts.id:
“Pulau Menjangan” is an island in West Bali which is a tourist area for diving and snorkeling. A group of housewives in Karangsari village (West Bali) used the island’s name as its group name. Menjangan group is a group of village housewives who meet every week in the village hall for money saving and loaning activities or conduct cleaning activities in the neighborhood. This group is lead by Ni Nengah Suarniti with Ni Ketut Suwitri as the secretary and Ni Luh Warni as the treasurer. This group has 15 members. Besides the money saving and loaning activity, this group also runs pig farming business at their own houses. This business was not coordinated well so that they had not earned maximum profit. The livestock had not been treated and fed well due to lack of knowledge in pig farming. After getting consultations and counseling about group management and good ways of pig farming from Dinari, Menjangan group plans to raise high quality piglets and to buy good quality pig’s food so that they can produce pigs with quality that meets the market’s standard. Each person needs a fund of Rp. 1,400,000 (about $148) which will be used to buy 4 piglets that cost Rp. 250,000 (about $26) each and Rp. 400,000 (about $42) for the food expense. After raising the pigs for 5 months, the Menjangan group will sell the pigs at the same time. The marketing will be coordinated by Dinari so that the group will have good selling price and on-time payment. With better group management and knowledge, they feel quite optimistic that the business will go well and they can still run the money saving and loaning activities since the part of the profit is kept in the group savings.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

” Pulau Menjangan” adalah sebuah pulau di Bali barat yang merupakan kawasan wisata untuk diving dan snorkle. Oleh sekelompok ibu – ibu didesa Karangsari, Bali barat, nama itu kemudian dipakai untuk nama kelompok. Kelompok Menjangan adalah perkumpulan ibu – ibu didesa yang kegiatannya adalah melakukan pertemuan setiap minggu di balai desa untuk simpan pinjam atau untuk mengadakan kegiatan bersih –bersih dilingkungannya. Kelompok ini diketuai oleh Ni Nengah Suarniti, Sekretaris oleh Ni Ketut Suwitri dan Bendahara oleh Ni Luh Warni. Kelompok ini beranggotakan 15 orang. Selain kegiatan simpan pinjam, kelompok ini juga mengelola ternak babi dirumah masing – masing. Kegiatan ini belum terkoordinir dengan baik, sehingga mereka tidak mendapatkan hasil yang maksimal. Ternak mereka belum mendapat perawatan dan pakan yang memadai karena kurangnya akan pengetahuan yang baik akan beternak babi yang benar. Setelah mendapat pembinaan dan pelatihan tentang manajemen kelompok dan pemeliharaan babi yang baik dari Yayasan Dinari, kelompok Menjangan berencana untuk memelihara bibit babi jenis unggul dan membeli pakan yang berkwalitas sehingga akan menghasilkan babi yang sesuai dengan standar pasaran. Masing – masing orang membutuhkan dana Rp. 1.400.000.- dengan perincian, membeli 4 ekor bibit babi @ Rp. 250.000.- dan Rp. 400.000.- untuk biaya pakan. Setelah 5 bulan masa pemeliharaan, kelompok Menjangan akan menjual babinya secara bersamaan dengan dikoordinir Yayasan Dinari untuk pemasaran sehingga kelompok akan mendapat harga yang terbaik dan pembayaran bisa dilakukan tepat waktu. Dengan manajemen kelompok dan pengetahuan yang lebih baik, mereka optimis usaha mereka berjalan dengan baik dan kelompok bisa tetap berjalan dengan simpan pinjamnya karena sebagian dari keuntungan penjualan digunakan untuk pengembangan kas di kelompok.

loans.use: To purchase high quality piglets and pig's food

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto is a man who started working with his uncle and father in the taco-selling business when he was very young. This called his attention, and after his father died, he decided to become independent and start his own business to be able to make money to support his mother. Soon after he got married, he had to work more to be able to afford his family's expenses, and most importantly, the costs of his children's education.

Currently, Gilberto is requesting a credit to buy a structure to be able to grow his business. Right now he only has a taco cart, and it doesn't look very presentable. The credit that Gilberto is requesting is $575, to be repaid in 6 months. With this money, Gilberto will be able to buy merchandise to make his products as well as a structure to give a larger presence to his location. With your help, Gilberto will be able to take good care of his kids and to pay for their education so they can be good men.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Gilberto es un hombre que desde pequeño con la ayuda de un tío y su padre se ingresó en el negocio de la venta de tacos. Le llamó mucho la atención y después de que murió su padre el decidió independizarse y poner su propio negocio para poder sacar dinero para apoyar a su madre y poco después se casó, por lo tanto tuvo que trabajar más para poder sacar para los gastos de su familia y principalmente para los que tienen sus hijos de la escuela.

Actualmente Gilberto está solicitando un crédito para comprar una armazón para poder crecer su negocio. Puesto que actualmente solo tiene un carrito de tacos y ya no se encuentra muy presentable. El crédito que Gilberto solicita es de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Gilberto podrá comprar mercancía para poder hacer sus productos además de comprar una armazón para darle mayor presencia a su local. Con tu ayuda Gilberto podrá sacar adelante a sus hijos y pagarles sus estudios para que sean hombres de bien.

loans.use: To buy a structure for his taco cart

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo is 38 years old, finished her studies only to the first grade, and lives in the La Esperanza district of Trujillo province.

Thirteen years ago she started a business in the Union market in Trujillo, where she sold dry goods such as raisins, pecans, tuna and dairy products. Currently, she sells the same types of products from the Victoria Market having changed locations because it was closer to her home. In the afternoons, at around 5 pm, she sets up a grill outside her house and sells prepared foods.

She belongs to the collective bank “Mujeres en Acción” (“Women in Action”) from which she received her first loan of 300 soles (Peruvian currency). With these funds she purchased merchandise brought in from Cajamarca, such as cheeses and butter.

With the loan of 1,000 soles (approximately $350USD), to be repaid over four months, she will buy tuna, pecans, raisins, etc.

She dreams of having her own location in the market and to add another business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Consuelo tiene 38 años de edad, estudió sólo el primer grado de primaria, vive en el distrito de La Esperanza, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad. Hace trece años comenzó un negocio en el mercado “Unión” del distrito de Trujillo donde vendía frutas secas como pasas, pecanas, aceituna y productos lácteos. Actualmente se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de los mismos productos en el Mercado Victoria. Se cambió porque este mercado está más cerca de su domicilio. Por las tardes a partir de las 5 p.m. coloca una parrilla afuera de su casa y prepara y vende anticuchos de corazón, molleja, cuellitos y patitas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres en Acción”, aquí recibió un primer crédito de S/. 300.00, con el cual compró mercadería que le traen desde Cajamarca como quesos, mantequilla y manjarblanco. Con el préstamo de S/. 1000, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará 50 kilogramos de aceituna, 5 kilogramos de pecanas, pasas y guindones. La señora Consuelo sueña con tener un puesto propio en el mercado y en poner otro negocio en su casa.

loans.use: Purchase food products such as tuna, pecans, raisins, etc.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with one child. She lives in Zaporozhye and works in the local city market called “Angolenko”. Yelena owns a small business selling household items, kitchen supplies, electric appliances, plastic dishes and other small items. Yelena has been in this business for six years. She has been expanding her trade during those years. Currently, Yelena has two vending locations and is hoping to expand her business even more in the future. Yelena has about $3000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $300.

Yelena has requested a loan of $800 that will allow her to continue developing her business. It will help her open a new vending facility and purchase necessary supplies for her day-to-day business operations. Financial assistance will give her additional capital so that she can further promote her work and increase her business knowledge.

loans.use: To open a new household item store

loans.name: Asma's Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Asma is 29 years old and is a single woman with one 2 year old child. Asma has been a business and trading woman since 2003. She works every day from 8 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more commodities for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Hadija, who has a business dealing in food vending.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for her business.

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru:
Jumagul Z. and her family live in the Khuroson region. She is married and has 3 children. She has a high school education. For the past three years she has been sewing traditional women's gowns. It is a profitable business in rural areas, where all women dress in traditional gowns. Currently Jumagul would like to purchase fabric that is in fashion this season. She needs a little more money to be able to do so and would like to take a loan. She plans to repay the loan within a 12 months period. Her business helps providing the local population with an easily accessible source of clothing.

Translated from Russian, Kiva volunteer

Забирова Джумагуль живет в районе Хуросон со своей семьей. Она замужем и имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Уже три года занимается пошивом национальных женских платьев . Этот бизнес является прибыльным в сельской местности , где все женщины носят национальную одежду. Сейчас Джумагуль хочет закупить материал , который модный в новом сезоне и отшивать платья для продажи.Ей не хватает немного денег , поэтому она решила получить кредит. Погасить его она планирует в течение 12 месяцев.Кроме того это поможет населению беспроблемно покупать одежду.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Karen Viviana

texts.es:
Karen is 25 years old and has completed her secondary education. She lives in Pueblo Joven in the Aurora Díaz neighborhood of Puerto Salaverry. She is unmarried and has been working for several years. Karen sells underwear for men, women and children, along with blouses, polo shirts, and baby clothing, to her neighbors and coworkers.

Karen is a member of the Rumbo Al Éxito (“Heading for the exit”) interim group, part of the Manuela Ramos organization. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian Soles ($100), which she invested in purchasing a selection of clothing for men, women, children, and infants. She is very pleased with her business because it has helped her a great deal.

Karen will use this loan of 500 Soles ($200) to purchase more clothing for her business; the loan will be repaid in 4 months.

Karen dreams of becoming a great businesswoman in this field, for then she will be able to help her relatives and improve her own quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Chris Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

Karen tiene 25 años estudió secundaria completa y vive en el Pueblo Joven Aurora Díaz P. Salaverry, es soltera, muy amigable y trabajadora desde hace varios años. Se dedica a la venta de ropa interior de damas, caballeros y niños, así como blusas, polos, ropa de bebe, a sus vecinos, compañeras y compañeros de trabajo.

Es socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “Rumbo Al Éxito”, del Movimiento Manuela Ramos, recibiendo un primer préstamo de S/.300, el cual lo invertio en la compra de mercadería surtida tanto para damas, caballeros, niños, y bebé, ella esta muy contenta con este negocio porque le ha ayudado mucho personalmente.

Con el préstamo de S/. 500. el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio

Karen sueña con llegar a ser una gran empresaria en este rubro, y así poder ayudar a sus familiares y poder también ella mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Purchasing more clothing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in raw materials and to repair a freezer in order to keep producing ice cream.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Andrea has more than 10 years on the hammock business, she learned how to elaborate them since she was a kid thanks to her mother. Now she takes advantage of what she learned and creates her own hammocks and then sells them, so she can help her husband with the home expenses.

She needs a loan for $250 that she will pay in 3 months to buy threads and be able to finish a large request she received from clients. With your help she will be able to make it.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

Andrea tiene mas de 10 años dedicándose al negocio de las hamacas, ella desde muy pequeña aprendió a elaborarlas gracias a las enseñanzas de su madre, por lo que ahora aprovecha de lo aprendido para elaborar sus hamacas y luego venderlas y así poder apoyar con el gasto familiar a su esposo.

Ella necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses para comprar hilos y poder terminar un pedido grande que le hicieron. Con tu ayuda ella saldra delante.

loans.use: To buy thread / comprar hilos

loans.name: Roeurn

texts.en: This is the second time Mrs. Roeurn S. has asked for a loan to improve her living conditions. She lives in Dounvong Village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Roeurn S. and her husband, Mr. Phal Pros, are employed in a garment factory. Since their workplace is too far from home, Mrs. Roeurn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for transportation to work, and she hopes to reduce the family expenses in this way. Mrs. Roeurn S. is 31 years old and the mother of three children who are all too young to work or attend school because they are four, two years old and six months.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation to work.

loans.name: Débora

texts.fr: Débora A.  est née le 22 décembre 1980  à Lomé. Elles est mariée et a un  (01) enfant plus quatre (04) personne à charges. Son mari ne  travaille pas et n’a pas de qualification professionnelle. Elle est seule à faire face aux besoins du ménage. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour améliorer  ouvrir une boutique d’alimentations générales et passer une commande des articles qu’elle vend.
texts.en:
Débora A. was born on December 22, 1980 in Lomé. She is married and has one child plus four other persons for whom she is responsible. Her husband is not working and has no professional qualifications. She is the only breadwinner for the family. She is requesting this loan to open a general store and order the inventory for it.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to open a general store

loans.name: Ashuqullah

texts.en:
Ashuqullah is a young man aged 25 years old. He has studied up to ninth class and is currently studying English classes. In his spare time, he started a small business selling medicines. He opened a drugstore in his village in Jalalabad city, Nangarhar province. Ashuqullah lives with his two sisters and his old mother in a small house in the village. His father is dead.

Ashuqullah plans to make a small clinic in his village in the future. He has contacted Kiva for a 50000 (AF) individual loan for 18 months to buy some different medicines and syrups for his drugstore. He also has his own capital of 8000 (AF) ($160) which he has invested into the shop. He thanks Kiva and Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy medicines and syrups

loans.name: Dashgin

texts.en: Dashgin is a blacksmith. He has been in this business for 6 years. This man is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Kalbadjar region, and he settled in the Khirdalan settlement. He is married and has 2 children. Now he needs a loan of 970 AZN to buy the necessary things for improving his business

loans.use: Buy the necessary things for improving his business

loans.name: Bacilia

texts.es: Bacilia tiene 38 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos que estudian, dos de ellos el nivel primario y el mayor se está estudiando para postular a la universidad. En su pueblo, todos sin excepción se dedican a la agricultura, a ella le gustaba dedicarse a la venta de ropa, pero su realidad cambió, ahora que tiene hijos y su esposo es agricultor, él siembra papa y demás productos, a ella no le gustaba sembrar papa porque se requería de mucha inversión y el precio en el mercado no era gratificante. Pero nos dice que en esta temporada, al menos, ha bajado el precio de los fertilizantes de 215 a 185 soles, y espera que se mantengan a ese precio, para que  recompense su inversión. Esta familia tiene dificultad en la siembra de sus chacras por falta de dinero, ya que no pudieron abonar su otra chacra y no va a producir como se esperaba. Es su 7mo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, nos comenta con sinceridad que sólo en una oportunidad se retrazó con un pago, pero generalmente, luego de varios prestamos, han puesto la confianza en ella, y no ha defraudado a su IMF. Ahora comprará fertilizantes para que pueda abonar sus chacras de papa, con la ilusión de que en la campaña de mayo puedan cosechar satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Bacilia is 38 years old with three children--two are in primary school and the eldest is studying to get into university. In her town, everyone works in agriculture. She wanted to sell clothing, but her circumstances have changed, now that she has children and a husband who's a farmer. He plants potatoes and other produce, but she didn't want to plant potatoes because it requires such a large investment and the market price is not satisfactory. But this season, at least, the price of fertilizers has fallen from 215 to 185 soles, and she hopes the price will hold steady so she can recoup her investment. The family has faced difficulties planting their fields because they didn't have enough money to fertilize both of them, so one is not as productive as they'd hoped. This is Bacilia's seventh loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and she tells us with sincerity that she has only delayed in making one payment, but after various loans the microfinance institution has regained its confidence in her, and she has not let them down. Now she will buy fertilizer that will enable her to fertilize the potato field, with the hope that May will bring a satisfactory harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for crops

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. is 35 years old and is married with 6 children. Elizabeth sells clothes, shoes, and bags. She has been in this business for a long time. 

She needs a loan of N50, 000 to purchase more clothes, shoes, and bags to sell. She says "thank you" to everyone who has made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bags, shoes, and clothes to sell

loans.name: Julie Amen

texts.en: Julie O. is 32 years old and married with 4 children. She sells cooked foods to support her family and she plans to increase her sales by increasing her stock. She is requesting the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Hol

texts.ru: Давлатов Хол житель города Яван. Имеет высшее образование. Работает учителем в средней школе. Женат но детей не имеет. Кроме работы в школе , он как и многие жители сельской местности занимается земледелием. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает пшеницей и другими видами злаковых культур. Сейчас он должен закупить семена пшеницы  и удобрения , поэтому решил получить кредит . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Hol N. is a resident of Yavan. He has a university diploma and works as a teacher in secondary school. He is married with no children. In addition to his work at school, like many rural residents, Hol is involved in agriculture. He has his own plot of land where he grows wheat and other grains. Now Hol must buy wheat seeds and fertilizers, and he is applying for a loan that he would be able to pay off within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: María Nicolaza

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León la señora María Nicolaza G. se dedica a su actividad de pulpería la cual es atendida por ella misma todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Hoy en día con mucho esfuerzo la señora Nicolaza busca la manera de como salir adelante y lo hace por medio del apoyo de Ceprodel ya que ha acudido a este para ser beneficiada en el otorgamiento de un crédito para la compra de los productos para ofertarlos. Por este motivo es que ella espera muy confiadamente y una vez que se le otorgue dicho crédito lo primero que hará será comprar los productos para surtir su pulpería.
texts.en:
In the city of León, María Nicolaza G. dedicates herself to her general store business, which she tends to herself every day from very early in the morning. Today, with much effort, Nicolaza looks for a way to get ahead and she does it by means of support through Ceprodel. She has turned to them to be granted a loan for the purchase of more merchandise to offer for sale. For this reason, she waits confidently and, once she receives said loan, the first thing she will do is buy products with which to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah L. owns a small parcel of land. She grows rice on her farm and sells some of her harvest in her village. She is 20 years old and has 2 small children. She invests much in farming because she believes that her family has a bright future in this kind of endeavor. Her husband, Renante L., is also a farmer. Together they work hard under the heat of the sun to support their children's needs.

She is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers to enrich the soil on her farm. The loan will help her whole family achieve a better harvest. In that way, she could earn much of what she needs to supply their needs.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people, especially the poor, start and have their own businesses and livelihoods. CEVI provides credit assistance, training, and insurance coverage to support its clients achieve business growth.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina tiene 51 años, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos que aun viven en su casa. Desde hace 5 años trabaja como personal de limpieza en un hotel de su barrio, esta actividad le dio el bienestar económico a su hogar estos años. Rufina inicia sus labores a las 7.00am hasta 2.00pm, regresa a su casa por las tardes para descansar porque a las 8.00pm regresa al hotel, pero ya no para limpiar, sino hacer los trabajos de recepcionista hasta las 7.00am del siguiente día. Lo bueno es que su salario es satisfactorio, pero a Rufina lo que más le gusta es realizar los trabajos agrícolas, por ello, los fines de semana y sus días libres acude a sus chacras para apoyar a su esposo y a uno de sus hijos que está dedicado a sus cultivos. Sus planes a futuro son de comprarse otros terrenos de cultivo, para que puedan sembrar alternadamente y duplicar sus ganancias, para sí no tener la necesidad de trabajar en el hotel. Rufina ingresa por primera en un grupo solidario, y está muy contenta de trabajar con los demás integrantes, además se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada una de las cuotas programadas por su asesora de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para los cultivos que viene realizando su esposo.
texts.en:
Rufina is 51 years old. She is a single mother. She has 5 children who still live in her house. For the last 5 years she has been working as a cleaning lady in a hotel in her neighborhood. This activity has provided for the financial well-being of her home for these years. Rufina begins working from 7:00am until 2:00pm, then returns home in the afternoons to rest because at 8:00pm she returns to the hotel, but this time not to clean, rather to work as a receptionist until 7:00am the following day. The good thing is that her salary is satisfactory, but the thing Rufina likes the most is to do agricultural work. For this reason on weekends and her days off she goes to her small farms to support her husband and one of her children who is dedicated to its cultivation. Her future plans are to purchase other fields, so that they can plant in rotation and double their profit, for herself to no longer need to work in the hotel. Rufina is joining a solidarity group, and is very happy to work with the other members, and likewise commits to pay punctually each of the installments scheduled by her credit adviser. The money that she is requesting is to purchase fertilizers for her husband's crops.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret B. is fifty-four years old. She is widowed and has three children, two sons and one daughter. She says one of her daughters has completed senior high school and is yet to continue. Her sons are currently in junior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a busy fishing/commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast in the Central region of Ghana.

She works very hard to provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She sells kenkey. She prepares it in her house and hawks to sell. Margaret procures bags of maize and other ingredients from the local market. She has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize in bulk. Margaret is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Immaculada Concepcion Village Bank and lives in the Peruvian jungle town of Pilcopata. Julia is 52 years old and is married with six children, all of whom are now adults. Two of her children are married and have families of their own, while four are still single. Julia has a small neighborhood grocery store in the town of Pilcopata; she opened the store four years ago with her first loan from Asociacion Arariwa. She also has a second business selling lumber, which she cuts from her own land with the help of several workers. 

Julia is requesting a loan of 3000 soles, which she will use for two different purposes. She plans to put half of the money into her wood-cutting business to pay her workers and transport the wood from her land to the town of Pilcopata on a truck. She will use the rest of the money to buy a variety of basic grocery items to restock her neighborhood store. 

Julia enjoys being a member of her village bank, and plans to continue working with the group for the foreseeable future. Her goal for the future is to continue to expand both of her businesses.

loans.use: Pay workers and transport wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making chapatis and buns

loans.name: Judith Adhiambo

texts.en:
Judith sells freshly-made breakfast items at her kiosk along the busy road in Kisumu’s Nyamasaria neigborhood. Her chapattis and mandazis are a hit with the customers, and she has built up quite a few regulars over her four years of business. She has found that throughout the month, her business rises and falls, with most of her business coming at the end of the month when her customers have disposable income.

At times, it has been difficult for Judith to provide lunch and transportation for her children to go to school. With her loan, Judith would like to buy a bigger inventory of ingredients so that she never has to run out of breakfast items when she has paying customers who want them.

loans.use: Ingredients for Baked Goods

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
E. Marhabo has a business selling women’s underclothes and dressing gowns. She has a good, busy location for her business with many people passing by, but she is concerned with the cost of rent and may move to another location. Marhabo has been in business for three years. Her husband has been struggling with illness, which is a real concern for Marhabo. She does her best to help him, and would like to see him recover completely. Marhabo has requested a loan of 3000 TJS to help her purchase more inventory. Periodically, she has the opportunity to attend trade shows and display her products. She’d like to have some additional inventory to take with her to the shows so that she can work on improving her sales and increasing her income.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La señora Nancy Márquez vive en casa propia, en la zona  de San Pedro, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo.
La señora Nancy es Profesora de primaria, en una unidad fiscal de esta ciudad, con cuyos ingresos  mantiene a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es para la construcción de garaje en su vivienda para alquilarla y así mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nancy M. lives in her own home with her son, in the San Pedro area, west of the city of La Paz. Mrs. Nancy is a grammar school teacher for one of the city’s school districts. With her income, she supports her family. The requested loan is for the construction of a garage in her current home. This will allow her to rent it, thereby increasing her household income. This is the first time that she has requested a loan. The socioeconomic research indicates that she is qualified and may access credit.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica Martino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The construction of a garage in her home in order to rent it and be able to improve her income

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
This is Fatmata K., Fatmata Bangura, and Isatu K.. They are local entrepreneurs in Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. They call their group Together As One. 

Fatmata K. (right) is the leader of the group. She was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili district, in northern Sierra Leone. She is age 40, married to a goldsmith and they have three children. Two are in secondary school and one is in primary school. Fatmata has been a businesswoman since childhood. She sells market food – rice, tomatoes, pepper, groundnuts, etc.

This will be the fourth loan Together As One has received from SMT/Kiva. SMT/Kiva loans have made massive contributions toward the well-being and development of these entrepreneurs. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they now request a loan for each to further strengthen their businesses.

loans.use: Invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth or Ely as she was fondly called by her friends is residing in San Nicolas, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is now 54 years old and married to Armando, a farmer.  The couple were gifted with seven children. Some of them finished a course in college while her youngest child is still studying

Ely is operating her simple store in the village.  She sells different commodities such as soft drinks and vegetables. She used to purchase her products in the public market of Bayombong and sell in retail price in her store.  For the continuous improvement of her business, she is now asking to borrow a loan of PHP5,000 from KIVA lenders.  She hopes that her business will grow more and become a good source of income to meet the immediate needs of their family.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es: El señor Teodoro M. de 67 años de edad, casado con cuatro hijos que su esposa le tiene, mayores e independiente, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte, su negocio es la venta de tomate, chiltoma, cebolla y otros productos, tiene doce años en estas ventas, las dificultades que se le presenta es cuando se escasea o se eleva el precio de los productos perecedero las ventas son bajas y hasta pierde los productos, es por eso los préstamo que ha hecho en Afodenic han venido a fortalecer sus ventas y agrandar mas su venta de verduras, con este préstamo comprara bastante tomate, cebolla, chiltoma para vender mas y obtener mejores ganancias. El tiene una camioneta donde hace las compra o hace también hace  acarreo para ayudarse en su economía. Agradece a la institución  por el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Teodoro M. is 67 years old, is married and has four children with his wife, all of whom are grown and independent. He lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood. His business is selling tomatoes, bell peppers, onions, and other products. He has been in this business for twelve years. The difficulty that he has is when perishable products are scarce and the price goes up, sales are low and he can suffer product loss. The loans he has obtained from Afodenic have strengthened and expanded his sales of vegetables. With this loan he will buy a large quantity of tomatoes and bell peppers to increase his sales and improve his income. He has a pick-up truck that he uses to buy his products, and he also uses it for transport for extra income. He thanks the institution for the financing.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, onions, and bell peppers in large quantities to improve his sales

loans.name: Emprendedora Group

texts.es: El grupo “Emprendedora” esta representada por la señora Tatiana y conformadas por 12 miembros de personas muy alegres y sus edades varían desde 23 hasta 60 años que en su mayoría son personas responsables con criterio formados así como también  son madres de familia. La presidenta se dedica a la venta de comida y el resto del grupo se dedica a actividades como venta de ropa, venta de abarrote en tiendas de barrio, cerveza, venta de pastillas y empanadas al paso. Existe mucha competencia en varias actividades como en la  venta de comida pero las socias tienen la ventaja de su experiencia y su sazón, aveces esto no es suficiente ya que la competencia siempre cuenta con mas capital de trabajo y con mejor servicio es por esta razón que las socias requieren el préstamo para hacerle frente a la competencia con productos de mejor calidad y mas atractivos para su venta. La experiencia de los miembros del grupo es escasa pero son gente responsable y con ganas de trabajar para sacar adelante a sus familias.

loans.use: Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty F. is from the village of Mialem. She is 32 years old. Betty is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Betty raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Betty has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Betty joined PMPC in order to gain access to financial services that could help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Betty has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Betty is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Betty from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding her business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. C. manages a general store. She is 56 years old and married to Domingo D. C.. The couple is blessed with five children, and four of them are college graduate and have their own jobs. The couple strives hard to send their children to a higher level of education. They are thankful because, through the business they manage, they are able to support their children during their school days.

Fe would like to continue improving her store for their financial security as they grow older. In this regard, she would like to ask for additional capital from the Kiva lenders amounting to PHP5,000 for expansion and buying additional groceries for her store. She would be glad if this amount is given.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy groceries for her store

loans.name: Mr. Chan Koem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people who all live in Trapeang Chaeng village in Takeo province make up the village bank loan. Mr. Chan K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. They all will use the loan for different purposes.  He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. He is also a pig breeder. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets and pig food for breeding. His wife, Mrs. Chaet MU., is a palm sugar seller. Mr. Chan K. is a 46-year-old father of three children. Two of the children are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig food

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 37-year-old man who lives in Bint Jbeil, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children.

Hussein has been working as a home painter since 1992. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties excepting making himself known to the public. He decided on doing his business because of his experience.

Hussein requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase paint and painting tools for his work. This is his second loan and he has always repaid on time.

Hussein is special in his work because he does it well and is aware of the new painting fashions; he does his best to have the newest tools in order to improve his performance. His clients are people from his region. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase paint and painting tools for his work

loans.name: Oreoluwa

texts.en:
Oreoluwa sells sarongs and has been in business for 15 years.  She is a member of LAPO and is a faithful client.  Oreoluwa goes to market once every two weeks to buy new stock in large quantity at a discount. 

Oreoluwa is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase goods in bulk.  This will enable her to meet demand during the festive season.  Oreoluwa is 35 years old and has a three children, ages are 14,10  and seven.   She says thank you to lenders as her previous loan enabled her to sell more goods to customers. She promises to pay back this new loan promptly.

loans.use: Purchase more sarongs to sell.

loans.name: Cecille

texts.en:
Cecille C. is a 30-year-old mother of an only son, Razzel C.. She is married to Randy, a 37 year-old driver and a construction worker and lives in Talim Island, Rizal Province in the Philippines. Cecille is strong and full of courage to lift her family out of poverty.

Cecille operates a passenger tricycle (a motorcycle with sidecar) and tends to a business making peanut butter at the same time. She started these businesses only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to acquire a loan. The businesses are a big help for her family in covering their expenses and in being able to set aside savings for the future.

Cecille is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 to fully pay the balance remaining on her tricycle. She hopes that her business will become successful someday.

Cecille also hopes that, with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can reach her dreams in life: sending her only son to school until he finds a job, expanding her business, and even plans to have fishing business someday. Now, she said, my dreams are almost within reach.

loans.use: To fully pay the balance remaining on her tricycle

loans.name: Son's Group

texts.en:
Sơn Thị Đỗ is 38 years old. (id: 010114070030). She lives in Co Cuong Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She was married and has two children. She is the leader of a 5 member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

She has been raising chickens for seven years. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 VND.  She has been with SEDA for 3 years and has repaid loans on time. This time, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (or 270 USD) to buy food for her chickens.

About the other borrowers in her group: 

Xuan T. T. is 52 years old. (id: 010114070026). She has a store. She sells everything and has income per day. She wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND (or 295 USD) to invest in her store.

Ha T. T. is 34 years old. (id: 010114070028). She wants to borrow 4,142,000 VND (or 225 USD) to buy paper to make votives.

Nhung T. D. is 49 years old. (id: 010114070029). She sells clothes in the market. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (or 270 USD) to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy food for chickens

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia, es una mujer muy honesta, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 51 años, es madre de ocho hijos y 4 todavía dependen de ella. Lilia se dedica a la costura, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como estibador. Lilia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las activas”, desde hace nueve años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de telas y materiales para su negocio, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, que será invertido en la compra de telas y en la implementación de su taller de costura.
La meta de Lilia es construir una casa para hacer cuartos y ponerlos en alquiler.
texts.en:
Lilia is a very honest woman. She lives in the Calleria district in the Ucalayi region. She is 51 and has eight children. Four of the children are still dependent upon her. Lilia is a seamstress, and she works at home. She has her husband’s support. He works as a longshoreman. Lilia has been part of the Las Activas Communal Bank for nine years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy fabric and materials for her business. She now needs a loan for 2,000 PEN. She will use it to buy fabric and to set up her seamstress shop. Lilia’s goal is to build a house, make rooms, and rent them out.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and to set up her seamstress shop

loans.name: Los Alegres Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Los Alegres” esta representado por las señora Tatiana y esta conformado por 16 miembros donD. todos se conocen y se apoyan entre todos, pero también se garantizan. La señora Tatiana trabaja desD. muy temprano en la mañana realizando sus compras D. víveres para preparar la comida para medio día y luego empezar a preparar la cena para sus pensionados la socia tiene su domicilio propio con una pequeña sala para atender a sus clientes por lo que requiere el crédito para ampliar su negocio y poder compra mesas mejorando así sus ingresos para poder darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus tres niños que son su razón para seguir adelante su esposo trabaja para una empresa repartidora D. gaseosas y en su tiempo libre ayuda en la pensión D. sus esposa.  El resto D. los socios cuentan con negocios propios algunos en sus domicilios como otros en el mercado, en venta D. empanadas y refrescos, venta D. abarrote, también trabajan D. empleados pero son promotoras.  En realidad la competencia existe en todo lugar pero como grupo ellos tratan siempre D. apoyarse en especial en las ventas D. cosméticos porque ambulan vendiendo sus productos. El crédito lo destinaran para poder surtir sus tiendas y comprar más productos y ofrecer mejores servicios a sus clientes para que a futuro tengan sus negocios con mayores ingresos y una mejor situación económica. Como es un grupo nuevo se les ha dado una capacitación que están satisfechas y contentas D. ser clientes D. Agrocapital  pero algunas D. las socias ya poseen experiencia gracias a créditos similares en otras entidades
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Los Alegres' is represented by Tatiana and is maD. up of 16 members, who all know and support each other, but also guarantee each other. Tatiana works from very early in the morning buying supplies to prepare lunch and later prepares dinner for her guests. Tatiana has her own home with a small dining room where she attends to her customers. She requires a loan to expand her business and to be able to buy tables, improving her earnings in this way and giving a better quality of life to her 3 children, who are her reason for moving forward. Her husband works for a softdrink delivery company and in his spare time he helps his wife with her restaurant. The rest of the members have their own businesses, some in their homes and some in the market, including empanada and drink sales, grocery sales, and some also work as employees (but they are the promoters). In reality competention exists everywhere but as a group they always try to support each other, especially in cosmetic sales, as they sell them door to door. The loan destined for these members is so they can stock their shops and buy more products and offer better services to their customers, so that their businesses have a future with better earnings and they have an improved economic situation. As it is a new group the bank has given them the capacity to be satisfied and content to be Agrocapital clients, but some of the members already possess experience thanks to similar loans from other entities.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 3/8 and 1/4 inch iron rods, cement blocks, sand, cement, sugar, beans, rice and chicken.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife T. is from the village of Punong, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Marife is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns & operates a buying & selling business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fish and dried fish in the local community. Marife has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marife has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products and as working capital. Marife is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marife from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 35-year-old woman living in a small town called Masindi, Uganda. Jane is married to a pump attendant and together they have five children. Looking after five children in an economy like Uganda’s means she and her husband have to work hard to make ends meet for the family. Jane operates a hardware shop in which she sells cement and iron sheets among other items. She has been in the business for five years and she says it’s a good business with hardships faced during the rainy season when construction is halted, thus affecting her sales. This is her first loan from HOFOKAM, intended to enable her to buy iron sheets and cement for resale in her shop.

loans.use: buying iron sheets and cement for resale in her shop.

loans.name: Noélie Chantal

texts.fr: Née en 1975, A. Noélie Chantal vit au quartier Gbèdjromédé à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Noélie Chantal a deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais Noélie Chantal n’est pas mariée. Noélie Chantal vit donc seule avec ses deux enfants à Gbèdjromédé, et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Noélie Chantal a arrêté l’école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite la coiffure. Noélie Chantal exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d’année. Parallèlement, Noélie Chantal vend des mèches, des produits de beauté et aussi des tissus dans son atelier situé dans son quartier. Noélie Chantal achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C’est la première fois que Noélie Chantal sollicite un prêt de ALIDé, en vue d’agrandir son atelier et de mieux répondre à sa clientèle ; ce qui lui permettra de se faire plus de revenus.
texts.en:
Noélie Chantal A. was born in 1975 in the Gbèdjromédé quarter of Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She has two children who attend school. She is not married, but lives with her children in Gbèdjromédé, seeing to their needs by herself. She left school at secondary level, and learned to become a hairdresser, a field that she has now been involved in for over ten years. She also sells hair pieces, beauty products and fabric in her studio which is located in her local quarter; she sources her goods from Dantokpa, Benin's international market. It is her first time seeking a loan from ALIDé, and she intends to use it to increase her studio and better satisfy her customers' demands, thereby generating more revenue.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase boxes of hair pieces, hair products and fabric

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en: Luzminda T. is from the village of Dolipos Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 58 years old. Luzminda is widowed and has two adult children. To make a living, Luzminda operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing transportation services to the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Luzminda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Luzminda from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. About GDMPC GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda G., 52, is committed to ensuring that her family has enough provisions to meet its daily needs. She and her husband, Eduardo G., are blessed with three children. Eduardo works as a driver, and Wilfreda helps him in his work while also running a small store as a way to ensure that they make enough money to give their family a better life. 

Wlfreda has been a member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year. She attends weekly fellowship meetings and pays her dues consistently. Because of her good repayment record with previous loans, she has been able to take out quite a few loans from CCT’s Cooperative.  She has used the money to expand and improve her business, and has a solid record of paying bills on time.     

To ensure the success of her small company, she is applying for a loan for PHP 14,000. She will use this loan to continue to expand her business, and to buy more items to sell to her customers.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can buy her own house and land in a prominent and comfortable subdivision.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kakuuto Twetunguure Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
K. Robert is very hardworking and ambitious towards owning a big agricultural farm in his home area of Kakuuto, Ibanda. He is in very narrow circumstances that may make him seem like a wishful thinker. This means he faces long odds in achieving that mission.

Robert has, however, built at length a strong attribute of determination that has played into his hands. With strong hardworking skills up his sleeve, he has gotten a dependable niche for his banana business. He has banked on this business for the last ten years. His family of ten children has also enjoyed the good graces that have come with doing that business. Monthly profits to the tune of 240,000 Ugandan shillings is what he has been getting of late.

With this loan, Robert hopes to purchase mulches and fertilizers to help improve his farm and also buy pesticides as pests like banana weevils have always affected the plantation, hence reducing his yields. This loan will improve his yields, hence his sales revenue, and he will be able to live a more satisfying life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and mulches for his farm

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
Lucresia T. is from the village of Talinga, Leon B. Postigo. She is 58 years old, married and has two adult children. Lucresia owns and operates a  general store. Lucresia has been engaged in her business for 18 years and earns approximately 5000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2007, Lucresia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Lucresia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lucresia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lucresia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: expanding store inventory

location.town: Sindangan-Talinga, Leon B. Postigo, Zamboanga del

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
El Sr. Anibal posee 63 años esta casado con la señora Maria del Carmen Gaona que es jubilada, cuentan con tres hijos todos mayores de edad.
El señor fue sastre durante mucho tiempo, con los ahorros de el y el sueldo de su señora decidieron comprar su primer vehículo, actualmente cuenta con 6 transporte escolar con una buena cantidad de clientes, sus hijos también se dedican a lo mismo. 
Le gustaría más adelante dedicarse al engorde de ganado. 
Solicitó el prestamo para el pago por mantenimiento de vehículo.
texts.en:
Sr. Anibal is 63 years old and married to Sra. Maria del Carmen Gaona, who is retired. They have three adult children.

Anibal worked as a tailor of a long time, but he then bought his first vehicle using his savings and his wife’s salary. He currently owns six school buses and has a large number of customers. His children help with running the business.

Anibal would also like to have livestock for fattening in order to get ahead. He is requesting a loan in order to pay for vehicle maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
