Jamil A. is a young guy who likes to make his own way. He has run a clothing business for more than 2 years, which is how Jamil supports his family. Little by little and with hard work, his business has expanded. Still, Jamil wants his business to grow even more.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1,500 AZN which he will spend to buy more merchandise. This way he will have new products to offer to his customers. He already has one loan from AqroInvest which was successfully completed and Jamil is recommended as a trustworthy client.

loans.use: purchase more inventory for the store

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia tiene 48 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos a su cargo, vive junto a su familia en el caserío El Taymi, una zona rural del distrito de Illimo. Distrito agrícola perteneciente a la provincia de Lambayeque. Se encuentra situado aproximadamente a hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, especialmente aves de corral, ella adquiere aves a sus vecinos y las engorda para luego venderlas en el mercado Moshoqueque, el mercado mayorista de la región. Esta actividad le permite agenciarse de algunos ingresos los cuales utiliza en ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con los gastos familiares.

Eulalia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas aves de corral asimismo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para asegurarse un buen desarrollo de las mismas y una venta a buen precio. Para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Eulalia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Todos sus esfuerzos tienen un solo objetivo: sacar adelante a su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una mujer amable que siempre está dispuesta a ayudar a los que la necesitan.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 48 years old. She is married and has three children whom she cares for. She lives with her family in the El Taymi hamlet, a rural zone in the Illimo district. This agricultural district is a part of the Lambayeque province, located about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. She raises and sells small animals, especially corral birds. She acquires birds from her neighbors, fattens them up and then sells them at the Moshoqueque market, the largest in the region. This allows her to bring in some income, some of which she uses to help her husband, who is a farmer, with the family expenses. Eulalia wants to expand her business by buying more birds and nutritionally balanced feed so that they develop well and she can sell them for a good price. In order to do this, she has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN ($550) through Edpyme Alternativa. Eulalia is a hard working entrepreneurial woman. All of her efforts have one objective; to move her family ahead. Her neighbors and acquaintances from the zone where she lives, all consider her to be a very friendly persons who is always ready to help anyone who needs it.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corral birds and feed

loans.name: Julia Cecilia

texts.es: Julia Cecilia G. D. G. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en casa propia junto a su esposo quien es empleado D. una empresa privada, ambos residen en el municipio D. Soyapango. Julia trabaja desD. su casa D. habitación en donD. posee un comedor en el cual se dedica a elaborar desayunos y almuerzos, así mismo comercializa medicina natural. Julia es una persona muy dedicada a su trabajo quien siempre cuenta con una actitud muy positiva. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima necesaria para invertir en su negocio y D. esta forma elaborar más comida la cual es muy necesario debido a que su casa esta cerca D. una planta D. energía eléctrica por lo que muchos D. los trabajadores D. este lugar visitan el negocio D. Julia, por lo que ella dese mejorar su servicio en la mayor medida D. lo posible para obtener muchos más clientes.
texts.en:
Julia Cecilia G. D. G., 45, lives in her own home with her husband who is employed by a private firm. They live in Soyapango. Julia works from home where she has installed an eatery where she makes breakfasts and lunches. She also sells natural remedies. Julia is very dedicated to her work and always has a very positive attituD.. She is asking for funds to buy all the raw materials she needs to put into her business thus making more food. This is very necessary because her house is located near an electric plant and many of its employees are customers of her eatery. Julia, therefore, wants to improve service to the greatest extent possible in order to win over many more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food preparation.

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en:
Dancille was born in 1976. She is married with four children and she takes care of one dependent. Dancille is a busineswoman and her husband is a farmer. Even though they have different occupations, they work hard for the profits for their family. Dancille owns a small business selling various products such as juice, biscuits, cosmetic products and so on. Dancille has been in this field since 2008. The hours of her daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 6 in the evening every day.

Dancille is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to expand her business by purchasing more products to sell in her store. This expansion will make her more effective, more efficient and more successful.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 45 años, está separada de su esposo hace ya 11 años y como madre luchadora y tenaz cuida de sus 2 hijos; Noe de 18 y Brigit de 15 años, a los que cuida y cría en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad de Las Palmas). Hace más de 2 años que cuida de Yeraldine de tan solo 3 años de edad; ya que su madre murió producto de una enfermedad, ahora sola y con muchas responsabilidades Teodosia pudo salir adelante. Cada día agradece a Dios; ya que en los últimos meses adquirió una pequeño local donde pueda vender los ricos platos de comida que cocina; está actividad le resulta rentable a ella; los pobladores conocen de su exquisito sabor, pues antes vendía en una esquina de la plaza principal de su comunidad. Ahora con el apoyo de su banco comunal, desea conseguir materiales para su nuevo restaurante; su mayor anhelo es establecerse y triunfar con lo que más le gusta que es cocinar. Este es el primer crédito con MFP y agradece a su banco comunal por apoyarla y confiar en ella, y asegura que no los defraudará. Con el crédito que obtendrá, podrá comprar sacos de arroz y azúcar para abastecer los insumos que requiere para la preparación de sus platos de comida.
texts.en: Teodosia is 45 and has been separated from her husband for 11 years now.  She is a persistent and tenacious mother and cares for her 2 children.  Noe is 18 and Brigit is 15.  She cares for them and raises them in her own house, which is located in the Peruvian desert (in the Las Palmas community).  She has also cared for Yeraldine, who is only 3, for 2 years.  Her mother died from an illness, so she was left alone.  With all of her responsibilities, Teodosia was able to get ahead.  Every day she thanks God.  In recent months, she acquired a small location where she can sell delcious dishes of food that she cooks.  This activity is profitable for her.  The townspeople know her delicious flavors because she used to sell her food on a corner of the main plaza in the community.  Now with the support of her communal bank, she hopes to obtain materials for her new restaurant.  Her biggest dream is to establish herself and triumph with what she likes to do most:  cooking.  This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she is thankful to her communal bank for supporting and trusting her.  She knows that she will not disappoint them.  With the credit that she will receive, she will buy sacks of rice and sugar since she needs them as supplies to make her dishes.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and other products to continue preparing food.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane B. is from the town of Banga. She is 43 years old. Jane is married and has four school-aged children. Like most of the people in her town, she earns a living through farming. She plants and harvests rice crops that she sells to the market. She says farming is very challenging. She herself has experienced failures, but Jane is a positive person and thinks that someday, she will have a stable business.

Jane joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Jane is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Đặng
loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris L. lives in the town of Talibon Bohol. She is 34 years old and has been engaged in a food retailing business since 2000. She sells "puto" (rice cake) and other delicacies. She has four children. She works very hard to earn enough income for her family's basic needs.

Funding from CEVI will help her to realize her plan of expanding her business. She would like to apply for a loan of 6,000 PHP. She will use it to buy ingredients for making delicacies.

The income from her business will also help her buy adequate supplies of food and fulfill other basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making delicacies

loans.name: Sou

texts.en:
Sou S. is a 62-year-old man, married to Some Sou, age 58. This older couple live with three children and earn a living by planting various crops on their own farmland. Sou S. currently plants various vegetables, which he will harvest and sell when they are mature. 

Recently, his crop is not growing well because it is ravaged by insect and weeds. Because of that obstacle, Sou S. has decided to seek a loan to buy insecticide, which he will use to protect his vegetables, and farm supplies to use on his field.

loans.use: To buy insecticide, which he will use to protect his vegetables, other farm supplies to use on his field

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline A. is currently in the business of selling daga fish and other types of fish and is requesting a loan to stock more fish to sell. Jackline is 30 years old, divorced, and has 3 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a motor bike which will be used to operate a boda boda business to generate more money.

loans.use: To stock more fish to sell.

loans.name: Tan

texts.en:
Mrs. Tan Y. is 48 years old, married to Mr. Vark Vith (pictured in the photo) and has six children: one is a laborer, one is a farmer and one is a rice seller, while the other three are attending the local school. She lives in Kbal Kaoh village in Kandal province.

Tan and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land upon which they cultivate rice, corn and peanuts to sell. She also sells rice and food in the market, while her husband is also a fisherman.

Tan and her husband find they don’t have enough money to properly grow their crops, so Tan would like to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, bean seeds and fertilizers. With the rest of the loan she would like to buy a fishing boat for her husband.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, bean seeds, fertilizers and a fishing boat

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick M. is a married man. They have one child who is 3 months old. His business is located at Mukuru Kwa Njenga in Nairobi and he is served by the Kitengela branch of Kiva partner SMEP. 

He has two businesses; his main business is the barber shop and the other one is a video shop well-known as the Pink Lee movie house. He provides barber services to the local people. He also sells CDs, radio cassettes, VCDs and DVDs. He has been in this business for the last two years and has managed to employ one person. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is that there are so many people doing the same kind of business as his in the area and so customers are not loyal as they are spoiled for choice. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. 

He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to renovate his business premises. He hopes to grow his business to be able to improve the living standards of his family. He describes himself as an ambitious and very creative man.

loans.use: Renovating his business premises

loans.name: Yaka

texts.fr:
Yaka D. est une femme veuve. Elle vit avec ses 10 enfants et a aussi la charge d'un petit fils. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SANGHE DOUKA depuis son inauguration le 03 mai 1997. Elle fait partie des membre du comité de gestion dudit Banc Villageois. 

Elle développe un petit commerce de niébé, d'arachide et de lait caillé. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus de 10 ans. 

Son crédit lui permet de renforcer son activité en augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement.

Avec ses bénéfices elle parvient à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Par exemple à payer la nourriture, à payer les soins médicaux, à payer les fournitures scolaires etc.
texts.en:
Yaka D. is a widow. She lives with her ten children, and also has a grandson in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of SANGHE DOUKA since its inauguration on May 3, 1997. She is also a member of its management committee. 

She has been selling niebe, groundnuts, and milk curd for over ten years.

Her loan will allow her to strengthen her business by increasing her stocks. With the profits, she will provide for her family with food, medical care, school supplies, etc.

loans.use: Buying groundnuts, niebe and milk curd for resale

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 39 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent avec leurs époux et enfants  dans des familles nucléaires dans le quartier Faraba à BOUGOUNI (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  leurs activités qui est le commerce de Boissons, de chaussure, de médicaments et de condiments alimentaires avec  Bintou T.. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et augmenter la taille de leur entreprise, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt  et le premier prêt a été bien soldé.
Avec ce nouveau prêt Bintou T., compte acheter, 2 sacs de 50 kg d’Oignons, 10 paquets de cube maggi  et 1 bidon de 20 litres d’huile.
Elle s’approvisionne au niveau des grossistes sur place au grand marché de BOUGOUNI et effectue sa vente a la maison, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée généralement de femmes.
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The women of the BENKADI group are married, have an average age of 39 years and 5 children. They live with their husbands and children in nuclear families in the Faraba neighborhood of BOUGOUNI (third largest administrative region of the republic of Mali). They met through their businesses of selling drinks, shoes, medicine and other products, including the sale of food condiments for Bintou T.. 

In order to satisfy their customers and increase the size of their business, they have decided to join the loan program offered by microfinance organization Soro Yiriwaso. They are currently on their second loan, the first having been reimbursed in a timely manner. With this new loan, Bintou T. plans to purchase two bags of 50 kilos of onions, 10 packs of maggi bouillon cubes and 1 20 liter bottle of oil. She stocks up from the wholesalers at the main market in BOUGOUNI and then sells the products from her home for both cash and credit to a customer base mostly comprised of women. With this loan she hopes to earn a monthly profit of 10,000 FCF [approximately 21 USD], a part of which will be reinvested in her business and the other part will be used to pay back her loan.

loans.use: Purchasing condiments

loans.name: Germania Felicita

texts.es:
Germania Felicita P. M. tiene 38 años, vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con los hijos vive en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.
	
Los miembros de la V.R.C.  JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Matilde Esther  pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, arroz, maracayá en pocas cantidades y a la cría de animales como chanchos y gallinas.

Germania se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Mata de Cacao cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz además para insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terrenos para los hijos.

Le gusta tejer y salir con la familia.
texts.en:
Germania Felicita P. M. is 38, and lives with her common-law husband and children in Chillanes Canton in Bolívar Province. She has 3 children.
	
The JUNTOS PROGRESAMOS [Together We Make Progress] Communal Bank is located in Recinto Matilde Esther in Chillanes Canton. This communal bank's 12 members do short-cycle agricultural work, planting corn, rice, and passionfruit in small quantities and raising animals such as pigs and hens.

Germania works farming corn and rice. She buys her products in Mata de Cacao at the end of each month and sells them in the market in Chillanes on Sundays.

She requests the loan to plant corn and rice, and also to purchase supplies. The support of this loan will help her financially meet her needs, and face challenges such as insect infestations, illnesses, and the vagaries of the weather. Her dream is to buy lands for her children. 

She enjoys weaving and going out with her family.

loans.use: to plant corn and rice, and also to purchase supplies

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel, de 36 años, es un joven noble y muy trabajador. Vive en casa de sus padres y lo que mas desea es ser un gran empresario. Desde su infancia Miguel, se ha dedicado a la costura, por ser oficio de sus padres. En la actualidad trabaja en sociedad con su madre y su hermana, quienes confeccionan mandiles de usos domésticos. Por ello, todos los días, desde las 3 de la madrugada, producen 300 mandiles en dos mañanas, a pedido de sus clientes de los diversos mercados informales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que lo realiza dentro de su casa, y eso le favorece en ahorrar y no gastar en el alquiler de un taller. Con sus ahorros y con tu ayuda pudo comprarse una maquina apropiada, que ahora su madre y su hermana realizan trabajos adicionales, como confeccionar las tiras de los mandiles; por ser muy trabajoso este detalle. Por el momento,  le hacen falta más telas, para abastecer sus pedidos y en adelante quiere poner una puerta principal para tener seguridad. Este es su 12avo crédito que tiene MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, considerando éste crédito muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más telas delgadas, para abastecer los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 36, is a very honest and hard-working young man.  He lives in his parents’ house, and what he wants most of all is to be a great businessman.  Ever since his childhood Miguel has been sewing, as this is his parents’ occupation.

He currently works with his mother and his sister making aprons for home use.  He works every day starting at three in the morning.  They produce 300 aprons in two mornings.  These are customer orders from different informal markets.  What he likes the most about his work is that he does it in his house.  This helps him to save and not spend money on renting a shop.

With his savings and your help, he was able to buy a suitable machine.  Now his mother and his sister do extra work like making the straps for the aprons.  This detail is very laborious work.

They now need more fabric in order to fill their orders.  Later, he wants to install a main door for safety.

This is his 12th loan with MFP.  He pledges to make all of his payments on time.  This loan is very useful to the progress of his business.  He will use the requested loan to buy more thin fabric to fill the pending orders that he has.

loans.use: to buy more fabric

loans.name: Jose Marcial

texts.es:
Don José, tiene 51 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, es transportista y vende medicina, su familia está conformada por su esposa y una hija de 2 años de edad, su esposa le acompaña en la venta de medicamentos, el transporte es en vehículo, del cual recibe un salario diario, este sería su segundo ingreso después de la venta de medicinas.
El solicita un préstamo para la venta de medicina, la compra le permitirá salvaguardar los productos para que este en óptimas condiciones para vender.
Su aspiración es ser mayorista de medicamentos, manejar el préstamo  de la mejor manera, así como también ofrecer una condición digna de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Don José is 51 years old and lives in El Transito in the department of San Miguel.  He works as a driver for which he receives a daily salary and he also sells medicine. His job as a driver provides a second income after his medicine sales.   His family is made up of his wife and his 2 year old daughter.  His wife accompanies him when he sells his medicines.  

He is requesting a loan for his medicine sales business. The purchase will allow him to protect his products so that they are in optimal condition to sell.  His aim is to be a drug wholesaler, to manage his loan in the best way possible and to provide a decent standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase medicines to sell.

loans.name: Francisca Merchora

texts.es:
Francisca de 49 años es una mujer muy influyente con su familia que salió adelante para darle lo mejor a su hijo que decidió dejar la empresa donde trabajaba para dedicarle más tiempo y entrar en la venta de productos de belleza.

Ella labora sola en todo el día haciendo sus pedidos para sus clientes. Le dificulta en su trabajo la de competencia ya que hay varias personas por el sector que tienen los mismos productos en ventas. Con el préstamo desea comprar más productos de bellezas y así aumentar sus ingresos económicos para darle bienestar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Francisca is 49 years old.  She is a very influential woman.  She got ahead in life so that she could provide her son with the best.  She decided to leave the company where she used to work in order to spend more time with him and start selling beauty products.

Francisca works on her own all day making orders for her customers.  She faces difficulty in her work from the competition as there are several people in the area who sell the same products as she does.  She would like to use her loan to buy more beauty products and thereby increase her income so that she can provide for her son.

loans.use: to buy beauty products

loans.name: Nanu Juboo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité NANU JUBOO est créé le 26 Mai 2001. Il est composé de 09 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce

Madame Fatou Mané à gauche de la photo et levant la main est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de huit enfant.  

Elle fait un petit commerce d'huile de palme et de balais. Et comme activité parallèle elle fait la vente de crème et de glace.

Le prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et d'augmenter afin d'augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement

Son objectif est de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et à prendre en charge ses enfants
texts.en:
The solidarity group NANU JUBOO was created on May 26, 2001. It is composed of nine women who all live in the same village. Their principal work is in small-scale commerce.

Ms. Fatou Mané (at the left in the photo with her hand raised) is the head of the group. She is 49 years old, a widow, and the mother of eight children. She has a small-scale business involving palm oil and brooms. As a side business, she sells cream and ice. 

The loan will enable her to bolster her capital, so as to increase her supply volume. Her goal is to meet her personal needs and to support her children.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and some brooms

loans.name: Neni Angelica

texts.es:
La Sra.Neni Angelica , pertenece al Banco Comunal “Luz y Esperanza”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Soltera, tiene una niña de 10 años esta en el nivel primario .

 Se inicia en la venta de productos de salchipapa lo deja por problemas de salud para luego dedicarce a la venta de cosmeticos y calzados con un capital de S / 500.00 nuevos soles, actividad que en la actualidad le da la oportunidad de generar sus propios ingresos y aportar así a la economía del hogar, y como mujer sentirse realizada.  

 Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes  y colonias para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos, locion de cuerpo, desodorantes  lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo zapatos y sandalias .

Neni , mujer  Trabajadora  se siente muy contenta y quiere continuar trabajando para la realización de sus ideas y está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Neni Angélica is a member of the "Luz y Esperanza" (Light and Hope) community bank which is located in Tarapoto district, in San Martin province, in San Martin department.  She is single and has a 10 year-old daughter who is in elementary school.

Neni started out selling salchipapa (a traditional fast food).  She left this business as a result of health problems and then started selling cosmetics and footwear with a capital of 500 Peruvian soles.  This business currently gives her the opportunity to make her own income and contribute to her household finances.  It also helps her to feel fulfilled as a woman.

With this loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles, Neni will buy beauty products to keep in stock such as ladies' and men's perfumes and colognes, creams, foundation, talcum powder, body lotion, deodorants, lipsticks, nail polish and also shoes and sandals.

Neni is a hard-working woman.  She feels happy and would like to continue working to achieve her goals.  She is very grateful to Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping women such as herself to benefit from these opportunities to make progress.

loans.use: to buy beauty products such as ladies' and men's perfumes and colognes, creams, foundation, talcum powder, body lotion, deodorants, lipsticks, nail polish and also shoes and sandals

loans.name: Lisbeth Yurico

texts.es:
Lisbeth es socia del Banco Comunal los Claveles, tiene 23 años, es conviviente, con un hijo de 3 años.
Lisbeth tiene una fabrica de ladrillos. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de terreno para la elaboración de ladrillos. Aprendió de éste negocio desde niña pues sus padres se dedican a esto, cuando se junto con su esposo decidieron independizarse. Le iba todo bien hasta que en éste año con las constantes lluvias se malograron sus ladrillos y tuvo perdidas, pero se está recuperando. Le gusta las reuniones de su Banco comunal en FINCA Perú, por la ayuda en los créditos se trabaja a base de confianza, aprende mucho de las capacitaciones que recibe de su promotora, les enseñan a trabajar su dinero, a no rendirse frente a los obstáculos que se les puedan presentar. Su meta es construir su casa propia y que su negocio siga creciendo.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a member of the communal bank "Los Claveles". She is 23 years old, married common-law, and she has a 3-year old child.

Lisbeth has a brick production business. The loan which she requests will be invested in the purchase of land where to make bricks. She learned this business when she was a girl from her parents, who had this occupation. When she married they decided to become independent. Everything was going well until this year when the bricks were all malformed from the constant rain and they experienced losses. But they are recovering. She appreciates the communal bank meetings at Finca Peru (Kiva Field Partner) for the loans which are granted on trustworthiness. She learns a great deal from the training sessions that they receive from their representative. They learn how to work with their money and how to not give up when faced with adversities. Her goal is to build a house of her own and to keep her business growing.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farm land.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is married with two grown children. She lives and works in her home town of Melitopol. Tamara runs a women's clothing sales business in a local marketplace called ‘Rizhskyi'. She started her venture 15 years ago. Presently, Tamara has about 20,000 grivnyas in working capital. Her profit amounts to 7,000 grivnyas. 

Tamara is seeking a 15,000 grivnya loan to re-stock her seasonal merchandise and add a variety of light and trendy blouses and tees to her selection of women's outer clothing. 

Tamara is an experienced entrepreneur who is always diligent in her work and payments. Tamara is planning to use the generated income for personal needs: she is hoping to purchase new home electronic appliances for the family.

loans.use: to add seasonal merchandise to her inventory

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a thirty-two-year-old married man with four children, and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in a tailoring business for thirteen years, which he started with 300,000 UGX and now has 2,500,000 UGX as his working capital. His hardship is bad debtors, and his vision is owning a tailoring school. John needs the money to buy suit materials for sewing.

loans.use: To buy suit materials for sewing.

loans.name: Angel Misael

texts.es:
Angel Misael tiene 28 años, es casado vive con la esposa y los hijos de 10 y 3 años, vive en el Recinto El Progreso Perteneciente al Cantón Chillanes.

Los miembros de la V.R.C EL PROGRESO, está ubicada a 15 minutos de la oficina en Chillanes, esta constituida por 13 socios es el tercer crédito que solicitan a la cooperativa, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura siembran cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca.

Angel se dedica a la agricultura siembra cacao, maiz, platano, soya y yuca. Las compras las realiza en Chillanes y San Pablo y las vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

El crédito le ayudará en la compra de insumos, fertilizantes y abonos para los cultivos, el crédito le apoyado de manera que han incrementado la producción de los cultivos. Ha enfrentado desafíos como enfermedades de los trabajadores y las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir trabajando y educar a los hijos.

En los tiempos libres le gusta palir de paseo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Angel Misael, 28, is married and lives with his wife and children, aged 10 and 3.  He lives in the Recinto El Progreso, which belongs to the Chillanes canton.  

There are 13 members of the rural communal bank "El Progreso," which is located 15 minutes from the office in Chillanes.  This is the third loan that they have requested.  The members of this group are farmers who specialize in short cycle agriculture cultivating cocoa, corn, bananas, soybeans and cassava.

Angel is a farmer who cultivates cocoa, corn, bananas, soybeans and cassava.  He makes his purchases in Chillanes and San Pablo, and he sells his produce in the Sunday market in Chillanes.

This loan will help him to buy supplies for his crops such as fertilizers and manure, which will help him to increase the productivity of his croplands.  He has confronted challenges such as diseases and pests that affect his crops and illnesses that affect his workers.  His dream is to have good health so that he can continue to work and education his children.

In his free time he enjoys going for walks with his children.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 56-year-old rice farmer who lives in the town of Banga, South Cotabato with her family. She is married and has three children aged 17, 22 and 24. Edna’s husband is also a farmer.

Edna dreams of having better living conditions for her family. She also desires to see her children have bright futures. Edna works hard to achieve her dreams for her family. She helps her husband till their land and grow rice crops. She also applied for a loan to buy the farm supplies they need. She will buy additional seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. Edna is hopeful that this loan will help improve their harvest.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is married with two children. Veronica is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Veronica is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 25,000 to purchase materials needed in her farm:  inputs or fertilizers.
 
Veronica has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in her farm: inputs or fertilizers.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a 25-year-old young man. He is single and lives in Rafah city in Gaza Strip located in Palestine. Abdullah has a souvenir and accessories store that is the only source of income for him. Abdullah wants to purchase more souvenirs and accessories for his store to prepare for the coming Muslims Eid, but the amount of money Abdullah has isn't enough to pay for all of it, so he is in need of a loan for $1,200 from FATEN. When Abdullah gets the FATEN loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to purchase more goods and have a collection of various souvenirs and accessories, which will lead him to sell more and increase his income. Abdullah is photographed inside his store.

loans.use: To purchase more souvenirs and accessories to sell

loans.name: Uprising Group

texts.en:
Siphati is 31 years old, married and has two children, aged 2 and 11. One is going to school. She also looks after four dependents. 

Siphati has been involved in irrigation farming for three years and she produces fruits and vegetables for sale. The challenges she faces include the expensive water bills and lack of working capital. 

Sithati has requested USD 400 to buy a hose, fence and fertilizers. With the extra income gained from the loan, she will be able to pay school fees for her child and buy food for the dependents that she is taking care of. 

In future, Siphati wants to buy a farm and employ farm workers.

loans.use: To buy hose, fence and fertilizers.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 51 years old and is married. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Hanh's husband earns money as a bricklayer. 
Hanh earns an income to support her family by running a general store from her house. She intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of foods to sell such as eggs, milk and confectionery. She hope that her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of foods to sell such as eggs, milk and confectionery.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.ru: Гулнора проживает в районе Дангара. Она замужем. Ей 26 лет. У нее трое детей. Ее дети маленькие. Гулнора имеет среднее образование. Она уже два года как занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Кредит берет для покупки тканей. Она намерена сшить платья для продажи.
texts.en: Gulnora lives in the Dangara district.  She is 26 years old, married and has three children.  Her children are small.  Gulnora has a secondary education.  She has been involved in sewing national dresses for two years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabrics.  She intends to sew dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Fiatagata

texts.en:
Fiatagata, 52, is married and she has two children.

Fiatagata owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business.

Fiatagata needs a loan of WST $2,000 to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 320 WST or US $133 per week) to financially support the immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Fiatagata joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Fiatagata's third loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 1 to 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the overall social metric score. For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is a 32-year-old business woman who lives in Juba. She is widowed and has four children between the ages of 3 and 15. All of them go to school. 

Vicky runs a food store and has been in business for six years. She has no employees. She heard about Finance Sudan through fellow clients and friends. She is taking a loan of 1000 SDG to buy food items like fish, onions, peanut butter, and tomatoes.  Other than her business, she does not have any other source of income.

In five years, Vicky would like to see an increase in her business in terms of goods for sale. 

Her major challenges include low income and costliness of the goods in the market.

Vicky says that she appreciates the work of Finance Sudan in supporting the poor.

loans.use: to buy food items like fish, onions, peanut butter, and tomatoes

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josphine is 23 years old and single. She runs a retail shop so as to earn a living. She has been in the business for 5 years. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Josphine has improved her business because she has been trained in business management skills. Josphine hopes to own a supermarket in 5 years. She wants to start a business of selling gas cylinders. Hence, she has requested a loan of 100,000 KES to buy gas cylinders.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three schoolgoing children. Her husband, who is employed, also contributes to providing the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mariam has operated a retail shop for the past 10 years; her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major lack of capital to expand her business. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase more stock of rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Bega Kwa Bega Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Bega kwa Bega Group in Western Kenya! Abdalla is the facilitator of the Bega kwa Bega group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 Abdalla is a father of two children. He joined One Acre Fund due to the firm's best prices offered and in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure quality harvest. In the recent 2011 season, Abdalla had a good maize yield, harvesting 10 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Abdalla was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Abdalla and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Abdalla will save for future use and ensure food security for his family. 

In 2012, the members of Bega kwa Bega group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize. 

Abdalla is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Vuyanzi Farmers Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is the facilitator of the Vuyanzi Farmers group. Rosemary and her group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Rosemary and her group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. Rosemary takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. With the income from maize sales, Rosemary will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing and business as savings for future use. 

In 2012, the members of Vuyanzi Farmers group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. She is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
A hardworking and very patient woman, Amelita is a 53-year-old widow with three grown children. She lives in the village of Marannao in the province of Isabela. She has managed her farm for 35 years with the help of her children. She earns approximately 16,000 PHP for every harvest. 

Amelita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase a sack of seed corn and fertilizer for her farm. Amelita hopes that she can provide for the needs of her family so they can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy seed corn and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Baptiste

texts.en:
Baptiste is 27 years old and married with two children between 2 and 4 years old.  Baptiste has six years of experience selling various goods such as cosmetics, cotex, sugar, biscuits, etc. The hours of his business are from 6am to 10pm.

Baptiste has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more cosmetics, cotex, sugar, biscuits, etc to sell. With any profits, Baptiste would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, cotex, sugar, biscuits, etc to sell.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en: Titus is taking another Kiva loan of 60,000 KES to boost his motorcycle business. With the loan, he wants to purchase another motorcycle. Titus dreams of owning a fleet of motorcycles in the future. Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for funding his loan to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Marvin Jose

texts.es: Marvin José es un empresario que su actividad a la que se dedica es a una farmacia que la tiene ubicada en su lugar de domicilio, ya tiene años de experiencia y la calidad de productos que le ofrece a sus clientes es bueno por tanto lo visitan. El ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, lo cual ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y con espíritu emprendedor perseverante. Actualmente está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de de medicamento en general que sus clientes más le buscan en su farmacia.
texts.en:
Marvin José is a businessman who has a pharmacy located in his home.  He has years of experience, and the quality of products he offers his customers is good, which is why they visit him so much.  He already has had a loan with Fundación León 2000 and showed himself to be a responsible person with a persevering entrepreneurial spirit.

Currently he is requesting a loan to invest in the business by buying medicine in general that his customers most look for in his pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy medicine in general.

loans.name: Jose Alejandro

texts.es:
Don Alejandro (a la derecha de la fotografía)tiene una hija de nombre Alexandra (a la izquierda de la fotografía) de 18 años de edad, quien está cursando su tercer año de la carrera de odontología, ellos son originarios de la ciudad de Boaco, ciudad con muchas carencias y poco desarrollo social, sobre todo en el tema de salud.

Desde pequeña y a lo largo de sus estudios secundarios Alexandra aprendió a conocer y detectar los problemas que más aquejan a la comunidad donde ha crecido especialmente los problemas de salud bucal en los niños y adolescentes por el bajo nivel de ingresos de las familias. Considera que con su formación profesional puede intervenir en esa situación trabajando en equipo, siendo una persona disciplinada y con empatía para ayudar las personas más necesitadas.

Alexandra, tiene una beca completa por excelencia académica en la universidad donde estudia su carrera de Odontología  ganándose la misma después de competir a nivel nacional con más de trescientos estudiantes del país y tiene como meta  graduarse con honores. Otra de sus metas es ser una profesional exitosa en su campo laboral a partir de la creación de su propia clínica social donde podrá ayudar a mejorar la salud bucal de las personas que no pueden pagar un tratamiento en clínicas privadas y buscar alianzas para financiar proyectos como campañas de salud bucal que tengan un impacto positivo en niños y adolescentes especializándose en odontopediatría atendiendo las zonas rurales de Boaco, a la vez usar esos conocimientos para contribuir al desarrollo de iniciativas sociales en conjunto con Operación Sonrisa y otros proyectos cuyo objetivo principal sea mejorar la salud de niños y adolescentes de escasos recursos.

Alexandra considera que los profesionales de hoy deben pensar en el bienestar del prójimo antes que en el bienestar propio y que éstos estén en igualdad de condiciones para desarrollarse y tener una vida plena, además que muchos de los problemas de nuestro país pueden ser superados con soluciones creativas, innovadoras y que fomenten el espíritu emprendedor que existe en cada una de las personas.

Para don Alejandro, su hija es su mayor orgullo y la razón por la cual cualquier sacrificio es pequeño para lograr los objetivos, el éxito y concretizar los sueños que ella se ha propuesto, por lo que el crédito solicitado es para la compra de materiales odontológicos de su hija y que ella pueda realizar sus prácticas ya que esto no lo cubre la beca que ella tiene en la universidad.

loans.use: Compra de materiales para realizar prácticas odontológicas en los estudios de su hija.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia is a young housewife who is 25 years old and has 3 children. When she was younger she lived in a convent called "Casa de Jesus" and part of her education was obtained there. The nuns taught her how to seam, how to handmake articles, and to paint and cook. After this experience she finally ends her studies at the school and she has no more education. Claudia started to work by herself doing table cloths, napkins, and all type of handmade textile articles which are very much appreciated in the Christmas season and at children's parties as well. As all of her work is handmade and she does not have any employees who help her, she needs to be ready for the Christmas season, so she needs to start to work overtime. This is so she can purchase materials this month. Claudia is a very entrepreneurial woman because she does not only do home products, but she also works selling shoes by cataloge during the year because her handmade product earnings are only good until November and December.

loans.use: Purchase material for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To set up a food kiosk

loans.name: Piliopo

texts.en:
Piliopo is about forty years of age, and she makes and sells German Buns and chips. Piliopo’s husband is a carpenter. When he is available, he carries his fishing net to the sea to catch some fish to sell.

Piliopo works four days of the week with the help of her daughters. Piliopo sells her buns at the Primary School. This treat is one of the children’s favorites; that’s why Piliopo decided to sell it at the school. It's one dollar for a German Bun and the same price for the chips. She will use the loan to purchase ingredients for the buns.

loans.use: To purchase flour, dripping, sugar

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
My name is Carlos Alberto, I’m a street salesman. I sell plastic products in the different communities; I have been doing this for the past 2 years. It generates an income to cover my family’s expenses. I have a good clientele, but now there is a bigger demand and I don’t have the capital to satisfy the growing demand.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Carlos Alberto, soy comerciante mi actividad principal es la venta de productos plasticos de manera ambulante en las diferentes comunidades, tengo 2 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingreso para cubrir los gastos de mi familia, cuento con buena clientela, pero actualmente tengo un problema porque la demanda a crecido y no cuento con el capital para satisfacer la demanda existente.

loans.use: Buy plastic buckets, sippy cups, aluminum, glass and plastic glasses, etc

loans.name: Ibrahim B.

texts.en: Ibrahim is married with three children.  At thirty-one years of age, he is a trader selling clothing in the town of Magburaka in Northern Sierra Leone.  Because of his hard work and advice to other traders, he was named the Executive Member of the Magburak Traders' Union.  His previous loan improved his business greatly, Ibrahim says, and so he is requesting another loan to further build up his business capital.

loans.use: Increase capital for his clothing business

loans.name: Sallamatu

texts.en:
Sallamatu started her business three years ago. Although she owns a market stall in Kabala town, she goes from village to village on market days. At thirty-two years old, she is married with four children.

With the profit from her business, Sallamatu is able to meet her children's education expenses and other needs. She would like to expand her stock and is requesting a loan of $275 to accomplish this.

loans.use: expand her business by providing additional food items for sale

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana Y. owns a general store in the Elmina market. She has been at this market for eight years but has been in the business for over 20 years now. Her store is special because she draws many customers with the palm oil that she sells. Palm oil is a red and flavorful oil that is a key ingredient in many traditional Ghanaian dishes.

With her loan, Nana Y. hopes to purchase more palm oil as well as expand her stock of onions, tin tomatoes, and groundnuts. She will use the profits to support her three children who are all in school. Two are in middle school and one is in preschool.

Nana Y. is a member of the lending group, Nyame Beba of Elmina. The group members guarantee loans through a group repayment pledge. Peer supports provide the incentive to repay; if one person in the group defaults, the group members make up the payment amount. The members of this group have known each other for many years, and they all work in the market.

loans.use: With the loan, Nana would buy more stock of the red palm oil she sells and add vegetables and groundnuts.

loans.name: Sevda

texts.en:
Sevda has been in animal sales for seven years. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region in Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs.

Sevda is 41 years old and married with three children. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy two calves to fatten for sale.

loans.use: to buy two calves

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa is 63 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters. She has seven children, but the majority are grown up and have their own families. Tomasa’s husband is handicapped and has to stay home all the time.

Tomasa earns her livelihood selling deep-fried chicken, spicy pork sausage and natural juices. She started the business five months ago with a loan she borrowed from FSMA. Tomasa used the funds wisely and says that she can repay the loan on time. Until now, she has run the business within her house, but she plans on renting a small local for that activity after a short time.

Fortunately, competition in her zone is not very strong. So, she has received a lot of customers that visit her house every day to buy her delicious fried food.

Tomasa will invest her second loan in the purchase of meat and other goods to continue that activity which is the main source of income of her family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and other goods for a small fried food activity.

loans.name: Enyonam

texts.fr:
Enyonam K. (the woman standing and dressed in a print boubou) is 28 years old, married, and is the mother of three. She has been the owner of a hair salon named Enyonam for five years. She manages her salon with professionalism and is thinking of bolstering her salon by acquiring a hair dryer. She is also thinking of creating a more welcoming environment by buying armchairs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Madame Enyonam K. (femme débout et habillée en boubou de tissu imprimé), âgée de 28 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants est propriétaire d’un salon de coiffure dénommée coiffure Enyonam) depuis 05 ans. Elle gère son salon avec professionnalisme et pense renforcer la capacité de son salon par l’acquisition d’un séchoir et améliorer le cadre d’accueil par l’achat des fauteuils.

loans.use: To acquire a hair dryer and to upgrade her hair salon

loans.name: Rehban's Group

texts.en: I am a group leader Rahban G.. I am married and a mother of four: three boys and one girl. All my kids are married except the youngest boy. My husband is a butcher and sells meat my youngest son also help him in the business. They also at times trade livestock. Few other women who have joined me in my group are: Zainab B. will use her share of loan to expand their sugarcane business; Nasira S. intends to increase their butchery business. Farzana B. is borrowing for their grocery store.

loans.use: Expand butcher shop

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
E. Kofi is a carpenter and also sells plywood. He is married and has 3 children. Business is very good and he wishes to improve his carpentry service and increase his wood sales.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy carpentry tools and materials.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy carpentry tools and materials.

loans.name: Qubra's Group

texts.en:
Qubra, the wife of Mr. I. is the mother of four sons and three daughters. Her husband hasa business making wooden baskets. Due to adverse circumstances her sons couldn’t get education. Qubra's first daughter is married. Her first son drives a rickshaw, the second one works in a paint shop and the last two are learning skills about lathe work. Qubra is sweeper by profession. She successfully completed a loan from Asasah, a microfinance institution in Pakistan. She has now applied for a loan to buy three wheel vehicles called auto-rickshaws.

Shabana wants a loan to start a meat business. Anwar B. and Shamim B. want loans to buy rickshaws, and Rashida B. wants a loan to start her gas slender shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: These women would like to improve their financial conditions.

loans.name: Prem

texts.en: Prem S., 55, is a good housewife who stays at home to look after the children and cook food for the whole family. Her husband is the head of the family and works as a motor-taxi driver. He normally stations himself around the hotel, and his regular customers are foreigners who visit Cambodia. On average, he makes $9 each day. This couple has three children and all of them are married. There is only one child who still lives with the parents. They have some free land, so they want to build some rooms to rent to the garment workers. This will help the family earn an extra income. (Prem's husband is pictured with his motorcycle.)

loans.use: Build rooms to rent.

loans.name: Vidal Felix

texts.es:
Felix es una gran persona que por su optimismo y resistencia al trabajo a sabido dejar de lado las malas experiencias y seguir adelante. Hace un tiempo cuando terminaba de curar y fumigar sus chacras, fue a almorzar, al ingerir sus alimentos se intoxicó porque los medicamentos para la cura de sus cultivos se mezclaron con sus alimentos, lo que lo llevó hasta la cama de un hospital, estuvo una semana internado por intoxicación.Ahora es más cuidadoso con los insumos que utiliza. El desempeño de su chacra muy buena, pero la falta de fertilizantes y abonos puede perjudicar su producción, por ese motivo solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono para su chacra, espera que puedan prestarle ese monto.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva volunteer.

Felix is a very optimist person who is resilient to work and knows how to put the bad experiences behind him and move forward. Unfortunately once after he had finished spraying his fields he went for lunch and as he was eating, the food and the toxins he sprayed the fields became mixed as he was ingesting the food; this caused him to spend a week in the hospital for poisoning. Now he is much more careful with the instruments that he uses. The performance of his fields is very successful but he lacks some fertilizers and without them his production could be diminished, thus he is asking for a loan for the purchase of fertilizers for his land; he hopes that you may be able to loan him that amount.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for his fields.

loans.name: Asante's Usawa Group

texts.en:
Asante is 35 years old. She is married with 4 children aged 11, 8, 6, and 1. She has been a soft drinks and clothes seller since 2003. Every day, she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 185 from her sales.

Asante now hopes for a loan to buy more soft drinks items (juice) and clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing with cassava and fish sales, clothing sales, charcoal and firewood sales,chicken sales, and shop ownership.

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks (juice) items  and clothes for her business

loans.name: Margarida

texts.pt:
Margarida M. nasceu em Chibuto província de Gaza ao sul de Moçambique, tem 49 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 28, 27, 22 e 21 anos respectivamente, todos ainda estudantes. Os dois primeiros empregados e vive nas sua própria casas. Para alem dos seus filhos sustenta a sua mãe enviando produtos alimentícios quando poder. Neste momento vive numa casa própria. 

Margarida cresceu junto dos pais e mudou se da província de Gaza para Maputo para continuar com os estudos seguindo a carreira de medicina geral e assim quando chega na cidade de Maputo foi obrigada a incorporar se no serviço militar obrigatório tendo ido a Tanzânia no centro de preparação militar e assim nunca conseguiu continuar com os estudos tendo termina com a 10ªclasse.

Margarida é secretaria do Director da escola Militar da marinha de Guerra funcionaria permanente desde  1978. tem um horário das 7:30 as 15:30h, tem um salário mensal de 3624,00mt e consegue poupar 1000,00mt por mes.

Para margarida este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, pretende com este valor comprar material de construção para melhorar a sua casa, e conheceu a Hluvuku através de conversas com os colegas que ja eram clientes e tem como planos futuros melhorar a sua cozinha em mobiliário.
texts.en:
Margarida M. was born in Chibuto in the province of Gaza, in southern Mozambique. She is 49 years old, married, and mother of 4 children aged 28, 27, 22, and 21 respectively. All of them are students. The first two are employed and live in their own homes. Besides her children, Margarida supports her mother by sending her food supplies when she can. She currently lives in her own house.

Margarida grew up with her parents, and moved from the province of Gaza to Maputo in order to continue her studies for a career in general medicine. However, when she arrived in the city of Maputo she was forced to join the mandatory military service, and went to the military preparation center in Tanzania. She, therefore, wasn't able to continue her studies after 10th grade.

Margarida is the secretary to the Director of the Military school of the War marines. She has been a permanent employee since 1978. She works from 7:30 a.m. to 3:30 pm. Her monthly salary is 3,624.00 mt, and she is able to save 1,000.00 mt each month.

This is Margarida's first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. She intends to purchase construction material to improve her home with this money. She found out about Hluvuku through conversations with co-workers that were already clients. Her future plans are to improve her kitchen furniture.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Kodjo Eric

texts.fr: Né le 22 novembre 1982 à Vogan, Monsieur A. Kodjo Eric est un jeune très dévoué qui réside aujourd’hui à Amégnran. Chauffeur de profession, il n’a pas encore une voiture à sa disposition. Ne pouvant pas rester les bras croisés, il s’est donné à la conduite de moto taxi. Il se débrouille avec le revenu qu’il tire de cette activité pour subvenir à ses besoins les plus élémentaires. Pour accroître son revenu, il veut s’acheter une moto qu’il mettra en circulation pour le transport des passagers.
texts.en:
Born on November 22, 1982 in Vogan, Mr. Kodjo Eric A. is a very devoted young man who today resides in Amégnran. A chauffeur by profession, he still lacks a car for his use. Unable to sit idly by, he has dedicated himself to driving a motorbike taxi. He manages to do OK on his own with the income derived from his work for meeting his most elementary needs. To grow his revenues, he wants to purchase a motorbike that he will put into use to transport travelers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a moto taxi

loans.name: Abrahan Antonio

texts.es: El señor Abrahán O. tiene la edad de 27 años habita en el sector de los madrigales, junto a su esposa e hijo, la señora le ayuda con los gastos de la casa ya que ella trabaja como dependienta, los sueños de don Abrahán es llegar a tener su propia casa ya terminada, el tiene su terreno pero actualmente vive en un pequeños cuarto ubicado en mismo terreno. Lo cual el solicita el apoyo de Afodenic para aumentar poco a poco su vivienda. Solicita un monto de C$ 6,000.00 córdobas para comprar materiales de construcción y poder comenzar hacer las mejoras para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Abrahan O. is 27 years old and he lives in the region of Los Madrigales, together with his wife and son. His wife helps him with the household expenses working as an employee. The dreams of Abrahan is to one day have his own home, fully finished. He has a plot of land but they live in a small room located on the land. He is requesting support from Afodenic to slowly improve his home. He requests a loan in the amount of 6000 cordobas to purchase construction materials so that he can start making improvements to their home.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase building materials to build his home.

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married with a three-year-old son. He used to work as a welder. However, working conditions we horrible and Mykola decided to try his luck with his own business instead. This is how he launched his startup and became a taxi driver. Today he owns a van and provides transportation services throughout Ukraine. Moreover, he owns a car which he leases. The business is the only source of income for his family of three. Mykola works very hard, sometimes without days off or vacation, in order to bring in enough income. He uses a walkie-talkie to help him facilitate his work and get right to a pick-up a lot faster.

Mykola has been in this business for 3 years. His determination and strong will to succeed have helped him keep his business stable and sustainable and have promoted its expansion. Mykola has received and paid back all loans from “Nadiya Ukraine”. Currently, his daily income is about 250-280 Grivnas. Mukola would like to get a loan for 5,000 Grivnas to do some repair work on the body of his vehicle. One of his long-term plans is to eventually pay back the loan for his second vehicle. We are confident that the modesty, diligence and responsibility that have helped Mykola develop his venture and gain a good reputation among other taxi drivers will help him promptly repay this loan and allow him to succeed in his business endeavors.

loans.use: To do car repairs

loans.name: Rosario Maria

texts.es:
Rosario es socia del Bancomunal Niño Divino
Rosario es conviviente, tiene 41 años es enfermería técnica tiene una hija de 15 años  esta en colegio estatal Cesar Vallejo.
Rosario se dedica hace tres años a las ventas empezó vendiendo ropa y también  vende por catalogo de productos de belleza como Unique, Avon, Esika 
El préstamo que solicita es de 400 soles que los va invertir en comprar productos de belleza por catalogo.
Lo que ella a aprendido desde que esta en Finca es ser responsable en el préstamo,  ha ahorra y tener capital para invertir.
Le gustaría tener una boutique y también ejercer su carrera y viajar fuera del país
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the “Niño Divino” (Divine Child) Community Bank. She is 41 years old, a nurse, and lives with her partner. She has a 15-year-old daughter who attends Cesar Vallejo High School.

For three years, Rosario has been in sales. She began by selling clothing and expanded her business to include the sale of beauty products, including Avon, Unique, and Esika. She will invest her loan of 400 Peruvian nuevos soles (US $150) in the purchase of beauty products from catalogs.

From her association with Kiva's partner FINCA, Rosario has learned to be responsible about loans and how to save in order to have capital to invest. While she would like to continue nursing, one day she would like to have a boutique. She would also like to travel outside of Peru.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products from catalogs

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is forty-four years old. She is married and has five children. Two of her children are in training college, one is a nurse, and the last two are in primary school. She lives with her family in Bawjiase community, near Accra, the capital city of Ghana, in a family house. She works very hard to help her husband take care of the family.

Comfort is a tomato seller. Comfort says she purchases tomatoes from the local tomato farmers in their farms and transports them to her location. This strategy helps her to avoid middlemen who buy from the farmers and distribute to merchants at profit.

Comfort sells her tomatoes to food vendors and other consumers in and around her locality. She wants to increase her working capital so that she can purchase tomatoes in bulk on a trip. She believes she can achieve more progress and make increased profit and conveniently support her family and pay for her kids’ education. She also believes in education and matters of her kids’ education are of utmost concern to her. She is a member of group called “Maranatha” Trust Bank in her community. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide assistance to one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes in bulk

loans.name: Kokadie Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Kokadiè sont tous des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et  5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies  dans le village de Tinimbougou, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro république du Mali.  
Unies par des relations professionnelles, elles font l’achat et la  vente  du charbon de bois. 
Dans le souci d’avoir assez de charbon de bois en stock et de mieux servir les clients, elles ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro  Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Ces femmes comptent acheter, 4 tonnes de charbon de bois auprès des producteurs charbonniers du village de Tinimbougou et environnants pour ensuite les revendre au comptant sur place dans le même village aux grossistes venant de Dioïla.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune avec ce prêt, 11 000 FCFA de bénéfice qui servira à développer leur commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Kokadiè group are all married women who average 30 years of age and 5 children. They live in extended traditional families in the village of Tinimbougou, Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region in the Republic of Mali. Linked by professional bonds, their businesses consist in buying and reselling charcoal. Anxious to have enough charcoal in stock to better serve their customers, they decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, from which they are seeking their third solidarity loan (group loan). All previous loans were repaid without problems.

These women intend to buy 4 tons of charcoal from producers in Tinimbougou and in the surrounding villages, to resell it for cash or on credit in the same village to wholesalers coming from Dioïla. They foresee turning a profit of XOF 11'000 (ca US$ 22), to be used to bolster their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell charcoal

loans.name: Faustina Clelia,

texts.es:
A sus 44 años Faustina ya lleva más de 20 años con su tiendita de abarrotes, gaseosas y licores. Cuando empezó fue para brindar apoyo económico al hogar, que solo estaba sustentado por los ingresos de su esposo, que trabaja en la posta de salud de Matucana.
Ahora que ya 2 de sus 3 hijos son mayores de edad y más independientes económicamente, Faustina puede reinvertir las ganancias de su negocio en el mismo, ya que su esposo logra cubrir con sus ingresos los gastos del hogar y parte de los estudios de sus hijos.
Hace 3 años Faustina empezó a sacar préstamos por EDAPROSPO, y a sus 44 años planea seguir invirtiendo en su tienda para estabilizarla  y poder mantenerse por los ingresos de ella.
texts.en:
At her 44 years Faustina already has more 20 years owning her shop of groceries, sodas, and liquors. When it began she was being offered economic support from the income of her husband, who works in a health store of Matucana. Now that 2 of her 3 children are of legal age and more independent economically, Fuastina can reinvest the profits of her business into her business, since her husband can cover the expense of the home and the part of the studies of their children with his income. Three years ago Faustina began to take out loans with EDAPROSPO, an affiliate of Kiva, and at 44 years old plans to continue investing in her store to stabilize it, and to be able to be self sufficient.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for her grocery store, particularly in liquor to sell for parties.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas A. is 35 years old and married with 4 children. Dorcas sells cosmetics such as hair cream, body cream etc. She is requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent O. is forty–six years old. She is widowed and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says that two of her children attend university, one attends senior high school, and the youngest primary school. Millicent lives with her children in a family house in a farming/commercial town named Achiase, which is near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. Her brother helps her to take care of the children. 

Millicent is a trader. She runs a provision store by the roadside. Millicent procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda.
She has been in this business for two years and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to procure provisions

loans.name: Claber Jasinta

texts.es:
La señora Claber Jasinta C. D. R. tiene 57 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen vive en la calle Alfonso Ugarte del sector Cochaya caserío D. Salpo, D. la provincia D. Otuzco departamento D. La Libertad Perú.
Estudió hasta cuarto grado D. educación primaria, pero no continuo estudiando porque no tenía apoyo D. sus padres.
Se caso a los 19 años y tiene 5 hijos, D. los cuales dependen D. ella 3.
Su actividad económica consiste en la cria D. animales, fabricación D. queso y quesillo.
El primer crédito recibido fue D. 300 soles los que canceló en 4 cuotas, recuerda con mucha alegría que con el primer préstamo compró queso, carne D. cerdo y carnero, los que volvió a vender a muy buen precio.
Con este crédito D. 500 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas, invertirá en medicina (fertilizantes) para la chacra.
Claber sueña con tener un buen capital para poder invertir en negocios diversos.
texts.en:
Señora Claber Jasinta C. D. R., 57, belongs to Banco Comunal Virgen del Carmen and lives on Alfonso Ugarte Street, Cochaya area, Salpo district, Otuzco Province, La Libertad Department, Perú. She studied to fourth graD. primary school, but did not continue studying because she did not have her parents' support. She married at 19 and has 5 children, 3 still dependent on her. Her business is raising animals and making cheeses. She remembers her first loan of $105, repaid in 4 installments, happily because she was able to buy cheese, pork, and mutton, which she brought back and sold at a very good profit. With this loan of $175, which will be repaid in 6 installments, she will invest in fertilizers for the land. Claber dreams of having capital to invest in various businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for her fields

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot  es socia del Bancomunal Inmaculada Concepción.
Margot es conviviente, tiene 34 años, dos hijos de 16 y 8 años que están estudiando en al escuela estatal. 
Margot empezó trabajando en un taller de costura como principiante, después de unos años  junto su dinero y se independizo, hoy en día tiene su taller que funciona hace cuatro años, ella confecciona buzos, polos.
Margot  necesita  un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de telas para la  confección de  polos, también van a compra  hilos, y materiales a Fines.
Desde que Margot esta en Finca, su negocio ha crecido, aprendió a distribuir su dinero, hacer balance.   
 El sueño de Margot es crecer más en el negocio y construir su casa.
texts.en:
Margot is a member of the “Inmaculada Concepción” Communal Bank. Margot has a live-in partner, is 34 years old, has two children ages 16 and 8 who study in public school. Margot began working in a seamstress shop as a novice seamstress, then after a few years she saved her money and began to work independently. She has now had her own shop for 4 years; she makes track suits and polo shirts. Margot needs a loan for 1200 soles to buy fabric to make her polo shirts, and also to buy thread and finishing materials. Since working with Finca, Margot’s business has grown, she learned how to distribute her money and accounting. Margot dreams of growing her business and building a house.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, and finishing supplies.

loans.name: Danialou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un tailleur, il vend aussi des bazins et confectionne aussi avec ses bazins des habits qu’il vend à ses clients, il fait cette activité depuis 2005, il est célibataire et c’est avec le revenu de son activité qu’il subvient à ses charges et aide financièrement certains de ses frères et sœurs. La demande de ses clients dépasse ce qu’il peut offrir. Pour pouvoir les satisfaire convenablement il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des tissus bazins. Il est célibataire et subvient à ses charges grâce aux revenus de son activité.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a tailor, but he also sells "bazin" (a sort of damask cloth) and sews clothes out of his "bazins" that he sells to his clients. He has been in this sector since 2005; he is single and it is with the income from this business that he supports himself, as well as helping out some of his brothers and sisters financially. The demand from his clientele is greater than he can keep up with, so to satisfy their needs appropriately, he is asking WAGES for a loan that will allow him to buy "bazin" cloth. He is single and supports himself thanks to the income from this business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "bazin" cloth

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine A. is a 29 year old business woman.  She has been a seamstress for seven years.  Catherine is married with two children. Both kids are in school. 

Catherine sews all forms of female wear with various styles that suit the taste of her customers; like “kaba” and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes etc.  She also sells jeans, skirts, tops and other clothing materials.  She wants to use a loan to  increase her supply of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to boost her output and efficiency. Catherine hopes to double her savings to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: Buy sewing accessories.

loans.name: Agatha
