texts.en: Agatha is the mother of 4 children. In 2001, she started selling vegetables in an open air market in a small town. In 2002, she opened a kiosk where she sold only vegetables. Last year, she got a loan of Kshs. 20,000 from SMEP, which she used to buy second-hand clothes. She is now requesting for a loan of Kshs. 30,000 to increase her stock of second-hand clothes, because the demand has increased.

loans.use: Increase stock/ expand business

loans.name: Lesbia De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Lesbia de los Ángeles tiene la edad de 28 años de edad, reside en un barrio de la capital de Managua Villa Reconciliación, tiene dos hijos que estudian, su esposo se desempeña como electricista, desde hace cinco años administra un comedor que su mama dejo, el cual ha podido mantener y sacar adelante gracias a los prestamos que Afodenic ha dado,  no solo en su negocio, también ha logrado construir su casa, el cual se siente muy sastifecha. Con este crédito es su octavo ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción,  como: perlinez y zinc para ponerle el techo y puertas para poder pasarse a su casa. A futuro es hacer mejora al negocio para poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lesbia de los Ángeles is 28 years old and lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She has two children that are students and a husband who works as an electrician. Lesbia has been running a restaurant for five years that her mother left to her. She has been able to keep it going thanks to the loans that Afodenic has given her, not only to help her business but also to help her build a house, which she feels very satisfied with. With this loan, which is her eighth, she is going to invest in construction materials like beams and corrugated iron in order to put up the roof as well as doors to be able to get into her house. In the future she would like to make improvements to her business in order to be able to give good service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corrugated iron and beams to be able to put a roof on her house

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El comité “8 de Diciembre” se formó con la unión varias vecinas del barrio  8 de Diciembre, de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo  muy unido y capaz de realizar actividades en forma conjunta, ya que la mayoría de sus integrantes se dedican a la venta, siendo así la mayoría de ellas, colegas entre si.
Todas las integrantes del comité son madres que se dedican a dichas actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa y desarrollar sus emprendimientos de manera sustentable. 
Las integrantes de este grupo se dedican a las siguientes actividades:
Patricia Bernarda González	Venta de Quiniela
Claudia M. C.	Venta de Ropas
María Ynocencia R.	Venta de de Ropas
Maximina Escurra	Repostera
Ángela Báez de Cuevas	Venta de Cosméticos
Ramona Raquel A.	Venta de Quiniela
Dominga Epifanía C.	Venta de Quiniela
Myriam Graciela Solís	Venta de Bebidas
Gabriela G. de Román	Copetín
Cirila M.	Despensa
Victoriana E.	Repostera
Celia B.	Venta de Ropas
Silvia María T.	Venta de comidas
Elida G.	Despensa
Percida M.	Venta de Frutas
Liz Mariela C.	Venta de carteras 
Lucia A. de Valdez	Venta de Quiniela
Dolores Florentín A.	Venta de comidas
texts.en:
The 8 de Diciembre group formed with the union of several members of the 8 de Diciembre neighborhood in the city of Villa Elisa. All of the group members work at independent activities like sales. The members form a very united group that is capable of doing activities in a joint manner. The majority of the members work in sales and they are colleagues. The members of this group are engaged in the following activities: Patricia Bernarda González Sells Sports Lottery Tickets Claudia M. C. Sells Clothes María Ynocencia R. Sells Clothes Maximina Escurra Makes Pastry Ángela Báez de Cuevas Sells Cosmetics Ramona Raquel A. Sells Sports Lottery Tickets Dominga Epifanía C. Sells Sports Lottery Tickets Myriam Graciela Solís Sells Drinks Gabriela G. de Román Snack Bar Cirila M. Small Grocery Store Victoriana E. Makes Pastry Celia B. Sells Clothes Silvia María T. Sells Food Elida G. Small Grocery Store Percida M. Sells Fruit Liz Mariela C. Sells Purses Lucia A. de Valdez Sells Sports Lottery Tickets Dolores Florentín A. Sells Food

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various merchandise like food, clothes,lottery tickets, purses, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Juhudi Group

texts.en:
Merry is a member of the Juhudi borrower group in  Mwanjelwa, Mbeya. She is 40  year old woman, she is married and a mother of 4 children. Her children are 20,17,15, and 10 years old.

Merry has owned a cafe business for 8 years. She works 10 hours day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 100,000 Tanzanian shillings.


This is merry first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more rice,  cooking oil  for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of thins loan, Merry hopes to save more money and expand  her business.

Rehema is  member of the same borrower group, she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more ricr, cooking oil for her busienss

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
Adelaida de ocupación comerciante de frutas tiene su puesto de venta en su misma zona, su esposo trabaja en la Embajada de España como chofer, tiene 4 hijos, si bien viven en casa propia la misma es de adobe y ladrillo ubicada en la zona Tahuantinsuyo de la Ciudad de El Alto la cual está en proceso de refacción no la terminaron por falta de material.
 
El crédito lo destinara para la compra de material de construcción y así poder terminar la refacción de su hogar para una mejor comodidad familiar.
 
Es el tercer crédito, sus créditos anteriores fueron cancelados puntualmente,
La evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Adelaida.

loans.use: Refaccion

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward M. is married and has four children. He has received a junior high school education.  Edward is a seamstress and also sells sewing materials such as thread, needles, linings and so on at Castle near Yamoransah, which he has been doing since 2000. His wife is a trader.  Edward uses his income to pay school fees and to settle the utility bills.  Edward will use the loan to buy more sewing materials to sell and also for use in his sewing. Edward plans to invest his new profits back into his business.

loans.use: To buy more sewing materials for his business.

loans.name: Damiana

texts.en:
Damiana P. is from the village of Tawi-tawi. She is 65 years old, married and has nine children. To make a living, Damiana owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Damiana has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Damiana joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Damiana is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie B. is from the town of Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Rosie owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. In 2008, Rosie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. Rosie is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig feed and other needed supplies. This loan will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy feed for her piglets and other needed supplies

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en: Analisa, 39, is a farmer living in Surallah, South Cotabato. Her main source of income is rice farming. She is a mother of a 6-year-old child. She wants to improve her business and have a better future for her family. She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. on 2008 to avail financial assistance for her business. She's now requesting a loan of 15,000 Php to buy pesticides and supplies for the farm.

loans.use: Farm supplies

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth C. is a 35 years old and married with three children. Her children are excelling in school. Elizabeth sells plantains and melons. She is requesting for a loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more plantains and melons to sell. Melon is used in Nigeria in the preparation of egusi soup. The demands for her melons are high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. Elizabeth says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more plantains and melons to sell

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina N. is married and has one child. She received a high-school education and makes a living selling stationary in a new market near Elmina on the Cape Coast. She has been working in this field since 1997, and her husband is a trader. They use their income to pay for many things, including school fees and utility bills. Ernestina has applied for a loan to buy more stationary to sell. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more stationary to sell.

loans.name: Zarela

texts.es:
La Sra. Zarela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Lameñas”, Distrito de Lamas, Provincia de Lamas, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 54 años y es madre de 07 hijos, todos ya independientes.

Su carácter y anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de verduras como: (papa, yuca, plátano, maíz molido), se encuentra ubicada en el Mercado Central de su Distrito, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, para atender a sus clientes fijos, que ya conocen del trabajo que realiza. 

Zarela, hasta la fecha ha ido ganando clientes que acuden a su puesto diariamente a comprar, porque en ella  encuentran todas las verduras que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará verduras como: racimos de plátanos, sacos de yucas, fréjoles en diferentes variedades, kilos de maíz. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en la compra de bolsas mercaderas, así satisfacer a sus clientes.

Zarela, se siente con muchas fuerzas aun, para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven
texts.en:
Zarela, 54, is a member of the “Las Lameñas” communal bank, which is in Lamas district, Lamas province, San Martín department. She lives with her life partner and is the mother of 7 adult children. Her desire and will to make her dreams come true motivated her to start her own vegetable sales business. She sells such things as: potato, yucca, banana, ground corn in her district's central market from a well-adapted space where she can care for her regular customers, who are well-aware of the work she does. Zarela has acquired many regular customers to date who come to her stall every day to buy because they find with her all the vegetables that a housewife would need and because she, herself, takes care of them with her characteristic charisma. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy vegetables like: bunches of bananas, sacks of yucca, various varieties of kidney beans, kilograms of corn. She will also use part of the funds to buy shopping bags for her customers. Zarela feels strong still to continue working and is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have opportunities for development in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Kathy

texts.en:
Kathy is a 41-year-old widow with two children in school. She does cloth embroidery and makes lampshades.

Kathy hopes to grow her business so as to afford quality education for her children. As a result, she requested Kes 30,000 through Faulu Kenya so as to purchase a sewing machine and to increase her stock.

Kathy is committed to her business and dreams of establishing catering services in the future.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and add to her stock of fabric

loans.name: Bosangani Plus Group

texts.en:
René A. is the leader of a Community bank named “Bosangani Plus”, which is composed of 26 micro entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses.
René is 56 years old and the father of six children aged 6 to 38. Six of them attend school. René runs a cell phone booth and sells lamp oil. He has been a micro entrepreneur since 2006. He is working hard because his ambition is to become a lamp oil provider in his area. The loan he’ll obtain next will be used to buy 20 liters of lamp oil to resell with the aim of increasing his profits.
As he wants to develop and diversify his business, he decided to join one of Hope’s groups in August 2009. He makes a profit of about $150 per month. René has succeeded with good strategies to build permanent customers. He always talks with his customers, he knows them well by their names, and he never runs out of stock.

loans.use: To purchase 20 liters of lamp oil to resell

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es: El Sr. José Francisco es originario de la comarca San Ramón del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como conserje en la Alcaldía Municipal de El Sauce donde tiene dos años de laborar para dicha Institución. Este señor ha recibido dos créditos de Ceprodel los cuales le han servido de mucho para asumir gastos personales de su familia, este último crédito lo solicitó para invertirlo en compra de medicinas para la recuperación de su esposa.
texts.en:
Mr. José Francisco comes from the region of San Ramón, municipality of El Sauce. He has worked at El Sauce's City Hall as a building caretaker for two years. José has received two loans from Kiva partner CEPRODEL, which he has used for personal and family expenses; this loan he will use to buy medicine for his wife.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying medicine

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Oyun-Erdene is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Tosontsengel soum (district) of Zavhan Province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a "ger," which is a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. They have been living in their current home for 2 years. 

Oyun-Erdene makes traditional Mongolian shoes. Oyun-Erdene sells her shoes to customers in in her home soum and neighbour's soum. She sells her shoes for 60,000–100,000 tugrugs, depending on its decoration. Her monthly profit is 80,000- 150,000 tugrugs (~ $55 - $105 USD). 

Oyun-Erdene makes 4-6 pairs of shoes each month. She is a very hard-working and supportive person. The most important thing to her is being able to provide for her children's education. Oyun-Erdene is saving money for her daughter's education. She is requesting a 700,000 tugrug ($500 USD) loan to purchase necessary materials, such as leather, to make traditional Mongolian shoes.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make shoes

loans.name: Nienes

texts.en:
Nienes G. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old. Nienes is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Nienes owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Nienes has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 11,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nienes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nienes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Nienes is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Nienes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support education of children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent N. C. is a farmer in Nambale, Busia district. He plants twice a year and runs a couple of year-round kitchen gardens. Most of these he started in the year 2008. He is also a preacher, he says.

He would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 which he will put into the expansion of his business. His main concern is to ensure education for his children. Vincent is 50 years old, married and blessed with 10 children and 8 grandchildren, who are all dependent on him currently.

loans.use: expand farming business

loans.name: Kotognogotala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kotognogotala de l’association Benkadi est composé de femmes mariées de la ville de San, région de Ségou (quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali). Les membres du groupe Kotognogotala vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 39 ans et au moins 5 enfants. Elles se sont connues à travers le voisinage et exercent les activités de petit commerce depuis plusieurs années avec la vente de diverses marchandises : condiments alimentaires, beignets et les arachide grillés. 
Elles sont à leur première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso c'est-à-dire le premier prêt solidaire.
La présidente du groupe en la personne de Kadia Traoré est beaucoup sollicitée par sa  clientèle pour la qualité de  ses beignets. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter, 2kg de riz, 3kg de petit, 50FCFA de levure et  2 litres d’huile alimentaire. 
Après avoir pilé le mil elle le mélange avec du riz pour ensuite l’amener au moulin. La poudre obtenue, elle pétri avec de l’eau, du sel de cuisine et de la levure la nuit. La pâte obtenue est frite le matin pour avoir du beignet, sa clientèle est composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 12000FCFA par mois pendant que les autres membres du groupe envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 11000 FCFA. 
Ce bénéfice sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt subvenir aux  subvenir et réinvestir  dans les activités.
texts.en:
The group Kotognogotala of the association Benkadi is composed of married women of the city of San, Region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members live in large traditional families and average 39 years of age and have at least five children.  They know one another through ties of community and have been running small-scale businesses for several years selling a variety of merchandise:  condiments, beignets, and roasted peanuts.  The group members are now on their first experience with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is their first solidarity loan.  The president of the group, Kadia Traoré, is in high demand by her customers for the quality of her beignets.  She plans on using her loan for buying 2 kg of rice, 3 kg of pearl millet, 50 francs of leavening, and 2 liters of vegetable oil.  After pounding the millet, Kadia mixes it with rice and then takes it to the mill.  With the resulting powder, she kneads it with water, table salt, and leavening at night.  The resulting dough is fried in the morning to obtain the beignets.  Her customer base is composed of women and men.  Kadia plans on a month profit of 12,000 francs CFA, while the other group members envision making a monthly profit of 11,000 francs.  This profit will be used for repaying the loan, providing for the family, and reinvesting in the businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for making doughnuts

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum M., 26, is married and lives with her husband and young child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is employed at a local garment factory for an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a mechanic, earning an income of USD 6 per day.

M. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work in the city. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work in the city

loans.name: Malalai Hangama Group

texts.en:
Malalai, the daughter of M. S., is the leader of the Malalai Hangama group. She lives in the 12th District in Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married and lives in a family of three members. She is a good tailor and all the family members benefit from the income she generates. Malalai has 6 years of experience in this business and she is confident that she can work harder.

Malalai has requested a loan to expand her business and buy two new sewing machines. She hopes to increase her business as soon as possible and bring in some new changes. She wants to say that Kiva is a really effective loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to expand her business and buy two new sewing machines

loans.name: Ndeye Bineta

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye  Bineta B.  habite dans la localité de Ouakam. Elle est âgée de 30 ans. Elle est sociétaire  de la caisse depuis 2 ans et a déjà  bénéficié  de 2 prêts  antérieurs. Elle est mariée, mère de 3 enfants et s’active depuis 7 ans dans la vente de petit déjeuner  et d’amuse gueule. Elle a choisi cette activité  pour éviter  le chômage. Elle sollicite un crédit  de 100 000 frs dans le but de développer  son commerce et satisfaire sa clientèle  qui augmente de jour en jour( sur la photo on peut constater  des clients qui attendent d'etre servis). Le prêt qui lui sera octroyé  pourra lui permettre d’accroitre ses bénéfices  et d’assurer une meilleure prise en charge des besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye Bineta B. lives in the locality of Ouakam. She is 30-years old. She has been a member of the credit institution for two years and has previously been granted two loans. She is married with three children and for the past seven years, she has been selling breakfast and finger food. She chose this activity to avoid unemployment. She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to expand her business and satisfy her customers whose number is increasing every day (the photo shows customers waiting to be served). The loan will enable her to boost her profits and better provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase funding

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Mrs. Phal A. is 38 years old and is a resident of Kompong Cham Province, where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops and raises pigs, which she is able to do twice a year. Phal A. is a married woman and is the mother of two children who attend school or work as laborers, while her husband (in the photo) works on the farm with her. Phal A. is a hard-working woman who never wastes time when she could be earning money to ensure that her family has an adequate standard of living. She is applying for a loan to use as capital towards building a place where she will distill wine to sell to raise extra revenue.

loans.use: To build a place to distill wine to sell to raise extra revenue.

loans.name: Sara Josefina

texts.es: Sara Josefina C. D. V. D. 44 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. Usulután, lugar en el cual comparte su hogar junto a su esposo, quien se dedica a trabajar y junto a sus dos hijos D. 12 y 1 año D. edad. Sara posee una venta D. tortillas, las cuales están hechas a base D. maíz, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa, en donD. las personas llegan a comprarlas. DesD. hace 4 años que ella trabaja elaborando este alimento el cual es muy necesario en la dieta D. las personas salvadoreñas, ya que se comen a diario hasta dos o tres veces al día, por lo que este es un negocio bastante estable. Sara desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, debido a que las ganancias generadas D. este negocio, le permiten brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y el D. sus hijo, los cuales son la razón principal para querer mejorar y poder brindarles lo mejor a ellos. Es por esto que Sara solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el dinero necesario para comprar maíz por mayor y D. esta manera atender a más personas y así  obtener más ganancias las cuales beneficien a su familia.
texts.en:
Sara Josefina C. D. V. is 44. She lives in the department of Usulután, a place where she shares her home together with her husband, who works, and with her two children who are 12 and 1. Sara sells tortillas, which are maD. from a base of corn. Her business is located in her home,where people come to buy them. She has worked for 4 years making this food which is very necessary in the diet of Salvadorean people, as they eat it daily up to two or three times per day, therefore it is a very stable business. Sara really wishes to be able to improve her business, owing to the fact that the profits generated from this business, allow her to offer all the help needed to her husband for the household expenses and for her children,who are the main reason for wanting to improve and be able to offer the best for them. This is why Sara is asking for a loan so she has the money necessary to buy corn wholesale and in this way serve more people and so earn more profits which will benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn wholesale for selling tortillas.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac M. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Ntugamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children — all of them in school. Isaac has a business of mixed farming and timber cutting, which he has had for 8 years. To help expand his business, Isaac has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to purchase more trees to plant for timber and manure and fertilizers for the banana plantation.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Isaac hopes to generate greater profits and educate his children up to university. In the future, Isaac hopes to become a successful business man.

loans.use: to buy more trees for to plant for timber and manure

loans.name: Azamat

texts.en:
Azamat T. is 23 years old and lives with his wife and his parents in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. He lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. His parents have been operating a fruits and vegetables selling business for many years. After graduating from secondary school in 2006, he began to be involved in his parents' business. Now his business working capital is 500,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). He is a very mannered and hardworking person who says, "I would like to expand my business and hope to one day own my own workspace." 

He is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en: Batmunh N. is 31 years old and lives with his wife and ten year old son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in the Huvsgul province of Mongolia. His son attends a local secondary school. Batmunh operates a raw material retail business in his town with the help of his wife. He has been engaged in this business since 1996 and has built his business to a consistent level. After many years of successful operation, he has gained much experience as a businessman. Batmunh is a very modest and hardworking person. Today, he stores his raw materials in a small wooden pavilion. He plans to enlarge his storage capacity for raw materials. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of raw materials in order to grow his working capital.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of raw materials

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en: Virgina A. is a 61-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a general store, a food vending business and charcoal sales. She lives in Prk. Orchids, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her various business activities, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Virgina is borrowing 16,000 PHP in this loan cycle so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 16,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Virgina hopes to improve her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Jose Eleodoro

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 61 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el distrito de Pacasmayo, capital de la provincia del mismo nombre, se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace veinticinco años a la venta de telas en un puesto ambulante situado en una de las calles del distrito donde reside. Eventualmente las vende en una feria situada en el distrito de San Pedro de Lloc, aledaño al lugar en donde vive. Durante todos estos años ha podido hacerse conocido en el rubro y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles.

José desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los que piensa adquirir más telas para lograr su objetivo.

José es una persona trabajadora y bastante responsable. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
José is a 61 year old father who resides with his wife and children in the District of Pacasmayo, the capital of Pacasmayo Province. This community is located in the region of La Libertad, which is more than two hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past 21 years, José has been selling fabrics from a vending post situated on one of the streets in the district where he lives. Eventually he began selling at a fair in the District of San Pedro de Lloc, which is near the place where he lives. During all these years, José has been known in this field and currently has a group of loyal customers.

He wants to expand his business by acquiring more merchandise. Therefore, José is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN so that he can acquire more fabrics to accomplish his goal.

José is a hardworking and responsible person. He has previously worked with Edpyme Alternativa and has demonstrated that he is prompt and responsible when submitting his payments.

loans.use: Acquire more fabrics

loans.name: Kalungi Saving And Credit, Mubende Group

texts.en: Lawano B. is a  member of the Kalungi Saving and Credit, Mubende Group. He is a determined and hard working married father of 5 children who has been plying all his energy into running a salon business from the Mpara trading centre  for over 6 years. Lawano earns 300,000 Ugandan shillings on a monthly basis as he has daily customers from the people in the same locality. He is also involved in produce buying and selling and his main intention in asking for this loan is to help him buy food stock for starting up a produce store business in the area.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a produce business

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert O. is 23 years old and married to Pamela, who sells vegetables to support her family. They have two children, Patrick four years and Justa two years old.

Robert is in the transport business and owns a motorbike that he has been using for the past three years. His business has developed a large clientele, partly due to the fact that the area has transportation problems. Robert is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD in order to buy another motorbike and also employ one person to help him in the business.

His desire is to buy a Nissan minibus for his enterprise.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es: José Francisco G. S. de 57 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Sonsonate, en donde posee su propio negocio y así mismo reside junto a su esposa quien trabaja vendiendo tortillas, así también vive junto a tres nietos de: 12, 8 y 5 años de edad. Él es un señor muy emprendedor, quien posee su propio negocio el cual es una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación y es el que le permite contar con todo lo necesario para vivir de una forma estable junto a su familia. José solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de productos como: bebidas, pan, golosinas, desinfectantes, detergentes, pan, cereales y todos los productos que más son solicitados por sus clientes. El mayor deseo de José es el de poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que son estas las que le permiten, junto al trabajo que realiza su esposa, sostener  su hogar.
texts.en:
José Francisco S. is 21 years old.  He lives in Sonsonate department where he has his own business.  He lives with his wife, who works making tortillas, and three grandchildren aged 12, 8 and 5.  He is a very enterprising man who has his own business, a sotre in which he sells perishables and convenience store items.  His business is located in his home and it allows him to have everything he needs to live a stable life together with his family.

José is requesting a loan to buy more products such as drinks, bread, candies, disinfectants, detergents, cereals and all the other products which are most requested by his customers.  José's greatest wish is to be able to improve his sales since they are what allows him, together with the work his wife does, to support him household.

loans.use: To buy perishables to invest in his store

loans.name: Badriddin

texts.en:
Badriddin R. is 35 years old. He is married with three children. Badriddin has been a farmer for the last 15 years. Farming is a passion for him. He practices both dairy farming and mixed crop farming. Badriddin says he has chosen farming as a career because the produce reaped from his farm has a ready market. His challenge at the moment is that he is not fully utilizing all his land.  This is because he used up all his proceeds form the last harvest to pay his children's school fees and was not able to buy the seeds and fertilizers needed to plant all of his land. Badriddin is requesting a loan of 10 000 Somoni to be able to purchase the resources needed for the next planting season. He will purchase assorted seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.   
  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: Chantal est née en 1979 à Dangbo, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Claude, Chantal est mère de trois enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Il y a environs deux ans que Chantal et sa famille se sont installées à Sèkandji dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. Chantal n’a pas été à l’école. Depuis trois ans, Chantal mène comme activité la vente de divers (pâtes alimentaires, savons, sardine, conserves, etc.) et également de l’eau glacée de façon ambulante. Chantal achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Chantal avait obtenu auprès de ALIDé quatre crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a amélioré son niveau de vie. Dans le but d’agrandir davantage son activité et de se faire plus de revenu, Chantal sollicite encore une fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.
texts.en: Chantal was born in 1979 in Dangbo, in the Ouémé department. Married to Claude, a driver, Chantal is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school. About two years ago, Chantal and her family moved to Sèkandji, in the community of Sèmè-Podji. The spouses jointly take care of household expenses. Chantal did not go to school. For three years, Chantal has been selling general merchandise (pasta, soap, sardines, canned food etc) as well as iced water, as a street vendor. Chantal stocks up in Dantokpa, at the international market of Benin. She had four prior loans from ALIDé, all well repaid, which helped her improve her quality of life. In order to continue growing her business and increase her revenues, Chantal is once again seeking financing from ALIDé.

loans.use: Purchasing miscellaneous products (canned food, pasta, soap, etc.)

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en:
In Chey Otdam village in Kandal province, there are four members who have formed a  loan group. This loan group selected Mrs. Oun T., 54 years old, as the group leader. The members of this group will use their portions of the loan to support for different purpose. 

Mrs. Oun T. and her husband, Mr. Lot Larch, are farmers who own a plot of land that they use to cultivate chili  to meet their family needs. With this farming they face a challange of insufficient money to cultivate chili. So in order to support this farming, Mrs. Oun T. would like to ask for a loan to buy chili plants and pay for the hiring of farm laborers for cultivating chili. This couple has a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy chili plants and pay for hire farming laborers for cultivating chili.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 femmes du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des  familles nucléaires, à Ouelessebougou ville, préfecture de Kati, relevant de Koulikoro (2ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de cosmétiques, de fournitures scolaires, d’hatits à l’image de AMINATA D. etc.
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, trois douzaines de parfums,  deux douzaines de pommades, crèmes et des vernis pour les ongles. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Ouelessebougou et  effectue sa vente, au  marché de Ouelessebougou, en ambulant dans les quartiers et structures professionnelles et à domicile à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en détail, au comptant et à crédit. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The four women of the Danaya group average 38 years of age with four children each, and they all live in nuclear families in Ouelessebougou town, in the prefecture of Kati, linked to Koulikoro (Mali's second administrative region). 

They are on their first loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, with an aim of satisfying their customers' needs. This group of ladies trades in cosmetics, school materials, clothes, as is the case for Aminata D., etc. With her loan she is planning on buying three dozen perfumes, two dozen ointments, creams and nail varnish. She gets her supplies at the large market in Ouelessbougou and sells them at the same market, but also walking around the various districts and professional establishments and at home, to a customer base made up of men and women, on a retail basis, for cash and on credit. She is planning to make an average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, of which part will be used to help her husband with the daily expenses and the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Theresah

texts.en: Theresah K. moves from one area to another to sell jewelry at Abbrem Agona near Abura, Cape Coast. She is divorced and has two children. Theresah has been selling jewelry for two years. She is responsible for the well-being of her home. Her loan will be used to acquire other varieties of jewelry for resale. She anticipates using the new profit to establish a jewelry shop.

loans.use: To acquire other varieties of jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Minda

texts.en:
Minda A. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 48 years old. Minda is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Minda owns & operates a  business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Minda also grows pigs in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

Minda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Minda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Minda is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pig feed.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pig feed

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is a member of the "Alondras" communal bank at FINCA Peru in Ayacucho. She is 47 years old, married, and has five children who are all studying. She has a "salchipolleria" business selling prepared sausage and chicken from her house in the afternoons. She also has a separate business transporting and then selling grains from the countrysiD.. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for two years and likes that she is able to save. She would like to expand her business and open a restaurant one day.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies for preparation in her salchipolleria

loans.name: Aída

texts.es:
Aída forma parte del Banco comunal “Compartiendo Esfuerzo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de La Cisterna.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio desde hace 4 años y vende artículos de aseo, específicamente; shampoo, jabón, confort, detergente, paños de cocina, esponjas, escobillas, cloro, desodorante ambiental en aerosol, líquido para limpiar piso y fósforos, entre otros.  
Aída trabaja junto a su esposo, quién se encarga de trasladar la mercadería en un vehículo particular que tienen ambos. Sus artículos los vende en diferentes ferias libres, cuatro veces a la semana (los días miércoles, jueves, sábados y domingos). Aída tiene mucha clientela, entre ellos  vecinos y conocidos incluso van a su casa a comprar sus artículos. 
Con el préstamo comprará artículos de aseo al por mayor y en grandes cantidades. 
Su sueño es agrandar su negocio, de manera de abastecer su bodega y poder trabajar seis días a la semana. 
Aída vive con su marido y su hijo de 14 años, quien estudia en la educación media. Además tiene una hija que está separada y tiene 3 hijos (sus nietos), a quienes ayuda en la manutención alimenticia de ellos. Por lo que sus motivaciones de continuar en el negocio son proveer a su familia de alimentación y brindarles un mejor bienestar, además de entregarles una mejor calidad en la educación.
Aída está muy contenta del préstamo de Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha sido un apoyo fundamental para su negocio, respecto a las reuniones que sostiene con su grupo, ella ha logrado generar lazos de amistad. Y con las capacitaciones ha aprendido a distribuir y organizar de mejor manera sus ingresos generados por su negocio. 
La Cisterna es una comuna ubicada en el sector centro-sur de la región Metropolitana. Es una comuna esencialmente residencial y comercial. En sus inicios era un sector rural, de grandes parcelas, sin embargo debido al crecimiento de su población y la llegada de servicios pasó a ser un sector 100% urbano.
texts.en:
Aída is a member of the “Compartiendo Esfuerzo” (Sharing Effort) community bank which is located in the town of La Cisterna.  She has been a saleswoman for 4 years and sells toiletries and cleaning products, specifically shampoo, soap, fabric softener, detergents, teatowels, sponges, brushes, bleach, air fresheners (aerosols), floor cleaner, matches, etc.

Aida works together with her husband who transports her merchandise in a private vehicle that they both own.  Aída sells her goods in different open air markets four times a week (Wednesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays).  She has a lot of customers, including neighbors and acquaintances.  Some even come to her home to buy her goods.

Aída will use her loan to buy toiletries and cleaning products wholesale and in large quantities.  Her dream is to expand her business in order to stock her store and be able to work six days a week. 

Aída lives with her husband and her 14 year-old son who is in middle school.  She also has a daughter who lives independently and has 3 children (Aída's grandchildren) who she helps to feed.  Aída's motivation to continue in her business is the need to provide her family with food and provide them with a better well-being.  She would also like to provide them with a better quality education.

Aída is very happy with Fondo Esperanza's loans since they have been a key support for her business.  She has also managed to make friendships through her group meetings.  The training sessions have taught her how to better distribute and organize her business income.

La Cisterna is a town which is located in the central-south sector of Metropolitana region, in Chile.  It is an essentially residential and commercial town.  Originally it was a rural area made up of large plots of land.  However, owing to its population growth and the arrival of services, it has become a 100% urban area.

loans.use: to buy toiletries and cleaning products

loans.name: Reina Idalia

texts.es:
Reina, es una joven de 21 años de edad, reside en Santa Elena, departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 8, 5 y 3 años de edad; ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, de este negocio tiene experiencia ya que lleva varios años dedicándose a él, para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Ella necesita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos pequeños, esta compra es para ampliar la granja que posee de la cual vende los cerdos que están gordos.
El objetivo de la compra es tener más cerdos y así mismo más oportunidad de crecimiento, dándole una mejor condición como comerciante y para su familia tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Reina is a young woman of 21 years of age who lives in Santa Elena, in the Department of Usulutan. She lives with her husband and three children ages 8, 5, and 3.  She raises pigs for a living and has done this for a long time so she can help her husband with the household expenses. She needs a loan to buy small pigs to increase the size of the farm she sells the fat pigs from.  She is buying pigs so she can grow her business, giving her a better stance as a businesswoman and so her family will earn more.

loans.use: To purchase small pigs.

loans.name: Freddy Antonio

texts.es: Freddy  hombre trabajador, vive con su pareja de vida e hijos, familia humilde. Emprendedores en el campo de la panadería teniendo su micro empresa. Con muchos esfuerzos y deseo de superar han encontrado la manera de obtener el sustento diario. Iniciaron con fondos propios desde hace un tiempo. Sus proyecciones a corto plazo es continuar incrementando su producción y utilidades. El préstamo será requerido para la compra de materia prima siendo utilizado para mejorar el bienestar financiero del cliente. Comprar harina, levadura, azúcar, manteca, aceite, gas butano, entre otros materias para la elaboración de su producto.
texts.en:
Freddy is a hard-working man who lives with his life partner and children.  They are a humble family.  Freddy is an entrepreneur who has a small bakery business.  With a lot of effort and a desire to improve himself, he has found a way of earning a living.  Freddy started his business with his own funds some time ago.  His short-term plan is to continue increasing his production and profits.

Freddy needs this loan to buy raw materials.  He will buy flour, yeast, sugar, butter, oil, butane gas and other materials for making his products.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ SEÑOR DE COYLLURITTI DE CCORAO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Ccorao - Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia de Calca, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Valeriana, ella tiene 48 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 17 y 15 los menores y el hijo mayor es independiente; la socia vende cereales en el mercado  ella vende quinua, tarwi, trigo, y productos remojados, la socia vende una parte en el mercado de Huancaro en Cusco; la socia compra todos los productos de los proveedores mayoristas y los vende al por menor, la socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This community bank is called “SEÑOR DE COYLLURITTI DE CCORAO” and is located in the village of Ccorao-Pisac, in Calca province, in Cusco department.

Valeriana is 48 years old, married, and has three children.  Her eldest is 17 and her youngest are 15.  Her eldest son lives independently.  Valeriana sells cereals in the market.  She sells quinoa, tarwi (lupin), wheat and reconstituted ('soaked') products.  She sells her products in Huancaro market, in Cusco.  She buys all her products from wholesalers and sells them retail.  She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise wholesale.

Valeriana is grateful for this loan and would like to make it known that she will make her loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Nazakat

texts.en:
Nazakat  is the mother of three children. Ever since she was a young girl, she has learned the honest work of raising cattle. She has passed down this knowledge to her own children, who have also managed to improve their quality of life. 

Nazakat and her husband started their livestock business with only one cow. After a number of sacrifices they were able to increase little by little the quantity of calves. At the moment, with the support of their children, they have started to produce milk. They sell it to the vendors from local milk factory. 

Currently Nazakat wants to expand her business and to purchase more cattle. She has applied for a loan of 1,300 AZN with the desire of using the increased earnings to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald, tiene la edad de 43  años, esta casado, el  vive con sus 3 hijos y su esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. El pretende con el crédito realizar compra de fertilizantes para su café. El pretende realizar una buena asistencia de su cultivo para poder mejorar la cosecha. El quiere generarle ganancias y mejorar la producción y así poderle ofrecer a su familia un mejor bienestar familiar. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ronald is 43 years old, married living with his three children and his wife who are his greatest priority in life.  He intends to use the loan to buy fertilizer for his coffee crops.  He intends to provide good care to his crops in order to improve his harvest.  He wants to generate profits and improve production to provide his family with better family wellbeing.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.  He has had no previous loans with state banks.  FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Caacupe Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirian es la Coordinadora del Comité de Mujeres denominado Caacupe, ella es casada con tres hijos, trabaja como vendedora de comidas en la terminal de ómnibus del distrito de María Auxiliadora, desde las 06:00 Hs., hasta las 20:00 Hs. Con los fondos de la fundación, ella quiere invertir en insumos para producir más alimentos para vender y aumentar sus ingresos.
El comité Caacupe de la ciudad de Encarnación ha surgido por promociones realizadas en la zona, el mismo cuenta con 11 integrantes y la mayoría de las integrantes se dedica a actividades productivas. Otra integrante, la sra. Carmen, es tesorera del comité y una señora muy conocida en la comunidad por ser muy trabajadora y sacrificada, ella se dedica a la producción de comidas para la venta al igual que Mirian, con el fondo que solicita a la fundación la señora desea comprar bebidas para vender en coleman en la terminal junto con su compañera.
texts.en:
Sr. Mirian is the coordinator of the Caacupe women's cooperative.  She is married and has three children.  She operates a business selling prepared meals at the bus station in the Maria Auxiliadora neighborhood.  She works from 6:00am to 8:00pm.  She wants to use this loan to buy supplies so that she can increase her production and, in turn, increase her earnings.  
The Caacupe cooperative, in the city of Encarnacion, has grown on the back of a neighborhood advertising campaign.  There are 11 members now, most of whom operate some kind of business.  Another member, Sra. Carmen, is the group's treasurer.  She is a generous, hard-working woman, well known in the neighborhood.  Like Mirian, she operates a prepared meals business.  She is applying for a loan so that she can buy a drinks cooler for her business which she operates at the same bus terminal as her friend.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food sales business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 31 years old and is married with four children. She earns a living by selling charcoal. This is her second successful year in business. She operates her business, which is well-organized, from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. She employs five people to help her.

Alice has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by buying more charcoal to sell. By adding more sacks of charcoal and more workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With the profit, she will save for her family in order to pay school fees for her children and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres San Juan se encuentran en el tercer ciclo, son muy conocidas en el barrio por su cooperación, coordinación y solidaridad las unas con las otras.
Se definen como mujeres trabajadoras, jefas de familia que luchan día a día por el pan de sus hijos. Se unieron con un fin en común que es la obtención de mayores ingresos para paliar los gastos del hogar.
La Sra Fidelina es peluquera, es muy conocida en el barrio por su excelente forma de tratar a los clientes, es muy trabajadora y luchadora. Comenta que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por el bien de su familia. Le encantaría algún día poder ampliar su negocio.
Solicita el credito para la compra de gel, tintes, y demás instrumentos para el ejercicio de su profesión. Ella sabe que el credito le sera de mucha ayuda, desde ya agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad.
texts.en:
The San Juan Committee of Women is participating in its third loan cycle. They are well-known in the neighborhood for working together with cooperation, coordination, and solidarity. The members define themselves as working women and heads of households who strive each day to provide for their children. They have joined together for the common purpose of obtaining more income to offset their household expenses.

Sra. Fidelina is a beautician who is well-known in her neighborhood for the excellent way she treats her customers. She is a hard worker and a fighter. Fidelina says that all of her efforts are aimed toward providing for the welfare of her family. Someday she would like to expand her business.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy gel, dyes, and other supplies needed to perform her job. Fidelina knows that the loan will be a great help and expresses her appreciation to Fundación Paraguaya for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase gel, dyes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Lontar Indah Group

texts.en: Sri is married and has four children. She is 46 years old. Her business is selling electronic goods according to orders. She wants to borrow 2,000,000 Indonesian Rupiah because she wants to add clothing to her merchandise. With her business she can help financial problems in her family. She hopes she can continue this business on a larger scale and help her family to improve their financial condition.

loans.use: to pay for clothes for resale.

loans.name: Judicar

texts.en:
Judicar is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Judicar has a retail shop that sells canned goods, beverages, noodles & snacks. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Judicar is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Judicar hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Charo

texts.es: Charo es una mujer trabajadora de 29 años, que está casada con Santiago, su esposo, ambos viven junto a sus 3 hijos Sergio, Jack  y Jean Pool, en su casa propia ubicada en la ciudad de San Ramón (selva central peruana). Para solventar los gastos domésticos ella se dedica al negocio de compra y venta de productos oriundos de la selva peruana como café, cacao, maíz, fréjol y Achiote, con la ayuda de su esposo, asimismo gracias a las buenas ganancias que obtienen de este negocio lograron adquirir dos terrenos productivos amplios donde plantaron café, que les produjo una buen grano en esta temporada de cosecha. También pudieron conseguir artefactos necesarios dentro de una vivienda, por lo que Charo considera que vive cómodamente sin apuro alguno, sin embargo le preocupa el asma que sufre el menor de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su labor diaria desde hace dos años es visitar las chacras y poder decidir si compra o no los frutos de acuerdo a la calidad que observa. Más adelante tiene planeado situar un puesto en el mercado más antiguo de la ciudad para que sea más fácil distribuir los productos que vende en grandes cantidades, asimismo asegura que sus ventas serán más rápidas porque cuenta con conocidos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Gotitas de rocío” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde promete ser puntual en sus pagos para no defraudar la confianza que están depositando en ella. Además agradece la oportunidad de progreso. Charo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la comprar de frutos para comercializarlos en cantidades considerables, y así obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Charo, age 29, is a hardworking woman who is married to her husband Santiago. They have three children: Sergio, Jack, and Jean Pool. Charo and her family live in their own home in the city of San Ramón, which is in the central Peruvian jungle. In order to cover the household expenses, she began selling products that are native to the Peruvian jungle such as coffee, cacao, corn, beans, and annatto. Charo has the help of her husband. Thanks to the good earnings she has obtained, Charo was able to acquire two plots of productive farmland for growing coffee. She has produced good coffee beans this season. As a result, Charo was able to acquire necessary appliances for her home, where she lives comfortably with few problems. However, she is worried about her youngest son’s asthma. What she enjoys most about the daily work she has performed the past two years is visiting the farms and deciding whether or not to buy the fruit based on its quality. Going forward, she plans to establish a post at the oldest market in the city so that she can sell her products more quickly and in larger quantities. Claro is confident that her sales will happen more rapidly because she has connections.

She is a member of the Communal Bank “Gotitas de Rocío” (Little Dewdrops) and this is her fourth loan with MFP. Charo promises to be punctual with her payments so that she does not disappoint those who have trusted her. In addition, she is grateful for the opportunity to make progress. Upon receiving this loan, Charo will invest the money she requested in the purchase of fruit to sell in considerable quantities so that she can generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fruit in bulk.

loans.name: Plawn Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 43-year-old Nomusa from Gweru. She is widowed with two children, ages 19 and 22, both attending school. She also cares for two dependents. 

Nomusa runs a clothing business selling a variety of clothes. The business has been in operation for 18 years. She says the main challenges faced are debtors not paying on time and working capital shortages. Nomusa has requested a loan of 400 USD to buy men's and women’s suits for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees. In the future, Nomusa plans to open a boutique and employ workers.

loans.use: to buy ladies' and men's suits for sale

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun, 54 years old, is married and has six children. 

She has been a mixed farmer and especially a rice farmer for many years. A registered client introduced her to HKL in her abode. This is her first loan, which she plans to use to purchase farm inputs such as, fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. 

Her dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate her children to higher levels. She is an industrious woman who will struggle to achieve if funded.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and chemicals.

loans.name: Nader

texts.en:
Nader, 21 years old, lives in the city of Rafah, located in Gaza in Palestine. Nader has a grocery store and he wants to purchase more varieties of groceries to offer for sale to increase his income and improve his living conditions; he is therefore requesting a loan, to be repaid on a monthly basis, from FATEN for that purpose. Nader is a conservative man, so his father was photographed in his place.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan.

For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to offer for sale.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina has the drive and attitude to succeed. She is 48 years old, married and has eight children. Four of them are grown up and the rest attend school. Her children's interest and willingness to learn motivates her to work hard and provide their needs for a good education. Her family lives near the public market so she established a small store selling food and daily use products such as soap, shampoo, instant noodles, sardines, oil and bread. Profits earned go to school fees and allowances for her children.

Marina would like to sell more grocery items including fruits and vegetables but she has insufficient funds and that is why she is now asking for loan of P10,000 to buy soft drinks, canned goods, fruits and vegetables to sell and boost her earnings.

In the future, she wants to establish a larger store and keep growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Maria, es casada; la socia tiene 50 años de edad; la socia tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bordados para los santos y virgenes,ella borda capas,estandartes y banderas,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de bordados,santos y estandares. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hilos,agujas y telas.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: María, 50, is married and has three children.  She makes embroidered items for statues of saints and virgins to sell.  She embroiders capes, pennants and flags.  She works from 9am until 6pm.  She wants to expand the saints’ items embroidery business and is asking for a loan to buy materials like thread, needles and fabric.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials for making her embroidered products to order.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is 32 years old, married and lives in Lebanon with his wife and three school-aged children. Since 1999, he has been the owner of an aluminum factory. His wife helps contribute to the family's income by working as a teacher. Mohamad is applying for a loan for $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameenl to upgrade his shop's electrical generator. In the future, he plans to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: to upgrade his shop's generator.

loans.name: Rehana Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Rehana Kosar is married and has five children. Her first two sons are auto mechanics by profession. Her other two sons are free and don’t do anything while her daughter has passed the 5th grade and now runs a sewing business from her home to supplement the income of her family. Her husband is also an auto mechanic.  

Rehana herself is a very hard working woman. She operates a business selling toys. She sells plastic and battery-operated toys to her customers and to toy shops for profit. She does this work to support her family financially.
 
Rehana has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for the expansion of her business selling toys. With the loan, she will buy the latest variety of toys in bulk to be able to increase sales and profits. She is hopeful that her business will bring better profits to her after the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy the latest variety of toys to sell.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.pt:
Nasceu Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, viuvo e pai de 7 filhos 3 dos quais frequentam a Escola.Fez a 4ª clase e parou por quando foi incorporado no serviço Militar em 1978. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais 2 netos que vivem com ele. 

É guarda na Bananalândia recepcionista no Partido Frelimo ha mais de 9 anos e tem um salario de 6.200.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca teve emprestimo noutros bancos,conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de uma amiga que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 11.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construção para dar continuidade a obra da sua casa(chapas, areia, barrotes, ferro, cimento, e outros.).Os primeiros emprestimos foram de: 5.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt, para habitação. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende concluir a obra da a sua casa e mobiliar, para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the district of Boane, province of Maputo, southern Mozambique. He is a widower and has seven children, three of which attend school. He completed 4th grade and stopped when he joined the military in 1978. He lives with his family in a house he owns and also supports two grandchildren who live with him.
He has been a security guard for Bananalândia and a receptionist for the Frelimo Party for over nine years. He earns a salary of 6.200mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a friend who is also a client of this institution. This is his third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 11.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (metal sheets, sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.). The other loans were for 5.000mt and 15.000mt, for personal housing.
He pledges to repay as scheduled. In the future he intends to finish building and furnishing his house. For that purpose he plans to request more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies in order to continue building his house (metal sheets, sand, rafters, iron, cement, etc.).

loans.name: Vuhika Group

texts.en:
Tom is the facilitator of the Vuhika group. Tom and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Tom and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

Tom takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Tom had a very good maize yield harvesting seven bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Tom was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With the income from maize sales, Tom will educate his children and save for future use. 

In 2012, the members of Vuhika group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

The photograph shows Tom with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sosefina

texts.en:
Sosefina is 54 years old and is married with 5 children. She owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro to sell. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Sosefina needs a loan of WST $2,000 to invest in expanding her business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 Talas or US $83 per week) to improve and expand her business.

Sosefina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Sosefina's 3rd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is married with four children and her family lives in a five room house in the city of Bamenda in northwest Cameroon. She has faced challenges in life which includes the death of family members, and the theft of her last loan.

Susana joined GHAPE in the year 2000 and has taken and repaid loans eleven times. Her previous loans were used for farming and to build a motorbike transportation business.  The profits from these businesses were used to buy medication for her family and to pay for her children's education.

Susana plans to use this loan to buy a new motorbike for her transportation business and strongly believes the business will succeed because she has competent drivers and she has also made progress in improving her profit margins. The community will benefit from her transportation service, especially as the roads are poor and motorbikes are better able to serve the area. Her bikes will  also be used to transport  produce to and from nearby markets and  farms.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike and fuel

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 24 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married with two children. Analyn used her last loan to purchase refreshments to sell. Her business has grown and become successful.  Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.  Analyn hopes to be able to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase new products to sell.

loans.name: Onardjon

texts.ru:
Онарджон родилась в селе Куркат в семье дехканина. Ей 58 лет. Она мать 5-детей, работает колхозницей в селе. Занимается прополкой и откормом скота. Семья также имеет свой участок земли, где они занимаются посевом и выращиванием сельхоз культур. У нее большой опыт в этой сфере. Так как с детства она занималась этой работой. Чтобы прокормить семью ее  отец Раджабали работал на поле и откармливал скот. И Онарджон все время по шагала своему отцу. Приучиная к кропотливой работе трудолюбивая Онарджон для своего семейного благосостояния работает не покладая рук. Самостоятельно свыше десяти лет семья Онарджон дома откармливает крупнорогатый скот, перпродает его . Этим занимается ее зять. 
Онарджон рано осталось вдовой. Но не смотря на трудности преподнесенные ей судьбой. Онарджон не сдалась . она самостоятельно вырастила своих девочек. Дала им образование. Выдала замуж. И все благодаря своей сильной женской воле и трудолюбие.
Младшая дочь с зятем живут вместе. Повелению судьбы зять заменил ей сына. Он тоже очень трудолюбивый. Он всегда поддерживает Онарджон и всеми своими силами помогает ей во всем. Посоветавщись  с зятем они решили взять кредит и этим увеличить поголовье крупнорогатого скота. В дальнейшем они планирует открыть ферму для расширение скотоводства.
texts.en:
Onardjon was born in Kurkat village into a family of farmers. She is 58 years old. She is the mother of 5 children, and works as a collective farmer in the village. She works in weeding and fattening cattle. Her family also has its own plot of land, where they work with sowing and cultivating crops. She has a lot of experience in this field, since she has done this sort of work from childhood.

In order to support their family, her father Radjabali worked in the field and fattened up cattle. Onardjon has always taken after her father. Being accustomed to painstaking work, the hardworking Onardjon works ceaselessly for the wellbeing of her family. For over ten years, Onardjon's family have independently fattened up cattle and resold them. Her son-in-law does this.
