The loan she is requesting will be used to buy additional food items to cook to bring variety into her business. She plans to reinvest her profit back into her business.

loans.use: To buy additional food items to cook to bring variety into her business.

loans.name: Chao

texts.en:
Chao C., 60, resides with his family in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. C. is a fisherman, earning an income of about $7 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $70 on food and $30 on the other necessary expenses. 

C. is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, he would like to use any additional income to repair his house. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for the family's use

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
En la localidad La Mocora de la parroquia Colon de la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar conocido por su gente trabajadora, dedicada a la agricultura y la ganadería cada quince días se reúnen los socios del Banco Comunal La Mocora.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora María, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijas, la mayor está comprometida y la menor de 18 años que estudia en Universidad y aun vive con ella. El marido es chofer.
 
Ella es una gran ama de casa que tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa, en la cual vende todo tipo de productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hija y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo, los productos los compra en Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que dan para generar negocios propios. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que este crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
Every fortnight, the members of the La Mocora community bank meet in the town of La Mocora, in Colon parish, in the city of Portoviejo.  This area is known for its hard-working people who farm and raise livestock.

Here we meet 50 year-old María.  María lives with her partner and has two daughters.  Her eldest daughter is engaged and her youngest, who is 18, is studying at University and still lives with her.  Her husband is a driver.

María is a great housewife who also has a grocery store in her home.  She sells all types of products such as rice, sugar, oils, detergents, etc.  She works every day from 7.00am to 10.00pm and sometimes until later.  Her daughter and husband help her in her work.  She buys some of her products in Portoviejo but most of them are delivered direct to her store.

María will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other essentials.  She has been a member of her community bank since the beginning and she likes it for the help that they give people to run their own businesses.  Her goals are to get ahead in her business and for it to grow every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other essentials

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 26 años; vive en concubinato con Erminio. Ambos tiene 2 hijos: Braham y Verenise; a los que cuidan y alimentan en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Bellavista Huaracayo. Su actividad económica es la agricultura. Ya tiene 7 años de experiencia en la siembra de arveja, habas, papa y maíz; los cuales se sitúan en el caserío de San Antonio, donde todas las mañanas sube muy contenta a cuidar de sus cultivos, con la ayuda de su esposo y de peones que le ayudan en tiempos de cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las temporadas donde los sembríos ya se encuentran maduros, púes ve concretado su esfuerzo en la venta de sus cosechas en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Su principal dificultad son los gastos que realiza en la educación de sus hijos; por ello se siente contenta con el trabajo que realiza en el banquito comunal. Que le ayuda en la inversión y mejora de sus cultivos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Muruhuay”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente satisfecha por el cargo de tesorera que ejerce. Después de su cosecha de papa y maíz está pensando sembrar arveja. Por ello con el crédito comprará 2 bolsas de semillas de arveja para comenzar su siembra.
texts.en: Luzmila is 26 years old. She lives with her partner Erminio. They have two children together: Braham and Verenise. They take care of the children and feed them in their own house located in the village of Bellavista Huaracayo. Luzmila works in agriculture. She now has seven years of experience farming peas, beans, potatoes and corn. The fields are located in the village of San Antonio. Every morning she is very happy to take of her crops. Her husband and other laborers help her during harvests times. What she likes most about her work are the periods of time when crops are ripe. Then she can actually see her efforts by selling her crops in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Her main difficulties are the expenses of her children's education. For this reason, Luzmila is happy about working with the communal bank. The bank helps with investments and improving her crops. She belongs to the “Señor de Muruhuay” communal bank. This is her second loan with MFP and she is satisfied with the position as treasurer. After the potato and corn harvests, she is thinking about planting peas. With this credit, she will buy two bags of pea seeds to start planting.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina forma parte del banco comunal “Barrio Alto”, perteneciente a la ciudad de San Fernando. Ella se dedica a vender abarrotes en un almacén que tiene ubicado en el patio de su casa, desde hace 5 años. Su mercadería la compra usualmente en supermercados mayoristas. 
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería para abastecer su negocio. 
Ella vive junto a su esposo, uno de sus hijos y una sobrina. Su marido la ayuda en el traslado de mercadería. 
Su sueño es poder ampliar su almacén y comprar una máquina hielera para conservar las bebidas en buen estado. 
Clementina está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito otorgado por Fondo esperanza. Ella disfruta de las reuniones, ya que comparte con las demás socias y se siente muy a gusto. 
San Fernando es una ciudad ubicada en la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins , zona centro de Chile. La actividad económica de la ciudad se basa principalmente en la agricultura (viñedos, cultivo de remolacha, frutales, tabaco, trigo y cultivo tradicional), la agroindustria (empresas exportadoras de frutas, conserveras, de lácteos, etc.) y el comercio.
texts.en:
Clementina is a member of the "Barrio Alto" communal bank in San Fernando.  She sells groceries from a small area that she has set aside on her patio, and has been doing this for five years.  She buys her merchandise from large grocery stores.

She will use the money from this loan to stock her business.  She lives with her husband, one of her children, and a niece.  Her husband helps her transport the merchandise.

Her dream is to be able to expand her store and buy an ice machine to keep the drinks cold.

Clementina is very happy and grateful with this loan through "Fondo Esperanza," and she enjoys the meetings because she shares with the other members and is very comfortable.

San Fernando is located in the "Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins" region of central Chile.  It's an agricultural area (vinyards,  beets, fruit, tobacco, wheat, and traditional crops), agro-industry  fruit exporters and milk processing), and business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Santa Celestina

texts.es:
Doña Santa Celestina S. C. D. O., es casada, tiene 48 años D. edad, tiene 5 hijos que no estan estudiando, se dedica a la artesanía, al tejido D. cortes típicos, lleva 25 años D. experiencia en este trabajo,  cuenta con el apoyo D. su esposo quien se dedica también a la artesanía, inició como operaria, y ahora quiere ampliar su capital D. trabajo.

AcuD. a ASDIR para solicitar un préstamo que invertirá para compra D. hilo, un telar y sus accesorios, ya que quiere que su negocio sea mas granD., y asi mejorar sus ingresos y su condición D. vida.
texts.en:
Doña Santa Celestina S. C. D. O. is married and is 48 years old; she has 5 children that are not in school. She is an artisan and weaves typical dresses, she has over 25 years of experience in her work and has the support of her husband who is also an artisan. She started as an operator and now wants to expand her working capital.

Mrs. Santa went to ASDIR for a loan that will be used to buy threads, and a loom as well as its accessories since she wants her business to be bigger so that she can improve her earnings and quality of life.

loans.use: buy threads and a loom.

loans.name: Bertha Justina

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “SEÑOR D. COYLLURITTI D. CCORAO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado D. Ccorao - Pisac, perteneciente a la Provincia D. Calca, Departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Bertha, la socia tiene 59 años D. edad, la socia es casada y tiene 5 hijos, ella vive con la menor D. sus hijos que tiene 17 años es mujer, la socia venD. comidas típicas D. forma independiente, la socia también le apoya a su hija con los estudios en la universidad, la socia venD. en la feria ella requiere el crédito para comprar insumos, la socia desea comprar aceite, fideos, arroz al por mayor para elaborar sus platos típicos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. insumos para la elaboración D. platos típicos y otra parte en el pago D. la universidad D. su hija.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá D. manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos D. sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Señor D. Coylluritti D. Ccorao” and it is located in the town of Ccorao – Pisac, which forms part of the Province of Calca and the Department of Cusco.

Bertha is 59 years old, married, and has five children. She lives with her youngest child, a 17-year-old daughter. She sells traditional foods independently at the market. She also helps pay for her daughter’s college education. Bertha needs the loan to buy supplies such as oil, pasta, and rice at wholesale in order to make her traditional dishes, and also to pay for her daughter’s university studies.

Bertha is grateful and wishes to state that she will be disciplined and make her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making traditional dishes and to pay for her daughter's university studies.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila tiene 46 años, es soltera vive con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO PUCARA se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad Pucara Parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 15 minutos de la oficina de la cooperativa, esta ventanilla integran 22 socios que se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales y a la comercialización de venta de legumbres.

Zoila se dedica a la agricultura tiene 10 cuadras de terreno, siembra maíz, mora, naranjilla tiene 10 cabezas de ganado vacuno. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos y alimentación de los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar terreno para seguir sembrando comprar mas ganado y dar el estudio a los hijos.

Le gusta salir al pueblo con los hijos.
texts.en:
Zoila is 46 years old, single and lives with her three children in the canton of Guaranda in the province of Bolivar. 

The members of the village bank Grupo Pucara meet in the community of Pucara in the parish of Guanjuo, Guaranda canton. It's about 15 minutes from the cooperative's office. There are 22 members that work in agriculture, animal husbandry and selling vegetables. 

Zoila is a farmer with 10 blocks of land. She plants corn, blackberries, oranges and has 10 head of cattle. She makes purchases in the Guaranda market and sells them in the wholesale market there.

She asks for this loan to buy inputs and feed for the animals. With the support of this loan it will help her financially to meet her needs and manage challenges like pests and disease and weather variations. Her dream is to buy land to keep planting and to buy more cattle and for her children to go to school. 

She likes to go into town with her kids.

loans.use: inputs and feed for the animals.

loans.name: Yorleni

texts.es: Yorleni, tiene la edad de 32 años, está casada y vive con su esposo y su hijo, que son su mayor prioridad. Ella pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los abonos y la cal para la asistencia de su cafetal para las próximas cosechas. Ella cuanta con la finca ya sembrada y en producción por lo cual lo que quiere es asistirla para realizarle mejorar para las que las próximas cosechas sean mejores y generen buena producción de café. Ella quiere llegar a ser una caficultora estable de la zona y así poder generar las ganancias para el bienestar de su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Yorleni is 32 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and son who are her main priorities in life.  She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers and lime to care for her coffee plantation during her upcoming harvests. She has land which is already sown and in production.  What she would like is to be able to care for it and improve it so that her next harvests are better and generate a good production of coffee.  She would like to become a stable coffee grower in his area and thereby be able to make enough profits to provide for her family's well-being.

This is the first loan that Yorleni has received from FUDECOSUR.  She has not received previous loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR have offered her this loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and lime

loans.name: Alba Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Alba Tiene la edad de 38 años, estudio hasta la preparatoria y esta casada con el señor luis, doña Alba y su esposo viven en una comunidad llamada tetela la cual se caracteriza por localizarse en una zona cañera a quiece minutos del ingenio azucarero don pablo machado en el estado de Oaxaca.

Doña Alba nos platica que hace algunos años asistio a unos cursos que impartieron en la agancia municipal de su localidad en los cuales enseñaron a las mujeres ha elaborar manualidades como son blusas, servilletas, vestidos pintados y bordados con liston, ella nos platica que como aprendio ha elaborar muy bien sus manualidades decidio iniciar a trabajar en su propio negocio y desde entonces vende sus manualidades con sus amigos y vecinos de la comunidad , ella nos dice que algunas veces trabaja por pedido pero que muchas otras elabora su ropa y sale a ofrecerla casa por casa. Doña Alba nos platica que gracias a Dios siempre tiene venta y que poco a poco quiere hacer crecer el negocio y tambien vender un poco de perfumeria y cosmeticos para ganar un poco de dinero extra y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de listones, telas, ahujas, pinceles, hilos para la elaboracion de sus manualidades. ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea que su negocio cresca un poco mas dia a dia.
texts.en:
Sra. Alba is 38 years old and has a preparatory school education. She is married to Sr. Luis. Doña Alba and her husband live in the community of Tetela, which is in the State of Oaxaca. This town is located in an area known for growing sugar cane and is 15 minutes away from the Don Pablo Machado sugar mill.

Doña Alba says that a few years ago she attended a some classes offered by a municipal agency in her town. These courses taught women how to produce handicrafts such as blouses, napkins, painted dresses, and embroideries made of ribbon. Since she did a good job of learning to make these crafts, Alba decided to start her own business and sell her products to friends and neighbors in the community. She says that she occasionally works from orders, but most of the time she sells the clothing she produces by going house to house. Doña Alba says she thanks God because she always has sales. Over time, she wants to grow her business and sell some perfumes and cosmetics to earn some extra money so that she can help her husband with the household expenses.

Alba needs this loan to invest in the purchase of ribbons, fabrics, needles, paintbrushes, and thread for making her crafts. She hopes that this investment will help her business prosper because she wants it to grow a little bit each day.

loans.use: to purchase ribbons, fabrics, needles, paintbrushes, and thread.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 33 years old and married with two children, ages six and five years old.  Moses runs a boutique in the Kibotany trading centre.  He earns a monthly income of about KES. 10,000 which he uses to take care of his family.

He has been loaned KES.5,000 from KADET Ltd.  This is his first loan from KADET.  He intends to use the entire loan to purchase more stock for his shop

He plans to use the anticipated profit to establish wholesale boutique shop.  In the future, he hopes to establish a supermarket in his home town.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is 56 years old. He sells household goods such as kettles, pales, basins, and many others, as well as food products, such as macaroni and candies.  He has been in this business for more than ten years. Because of his rich experience, Tahir is able to choose goods that meet the requirements of his clients, whose tastes differ. The business is quite successful and generates the stable income that allows Tahir to improve the living condition of his family. 

Today Tahir is requesting a 1000 AZN loan. He is planning to use the loan to purchase new household goods and food goods to sell, thus enlarging the range of goods. With your help, this will be possible. Tahir has a good client history and has already paid off his first loan from KIVA successfully.

loans.use: to purchase more household and food products.

loans.name: Adelfina

texts.en:
Adelfina, 25, is a single lady who graduated from senior high school eight years ago. She lives in her own house. Adelfina couldn’t continue her education to university level as her parents could not afford to support her. However, she has never given up because of the condition of her family; she has even been motivated to start a business.

Adelfina initiated a business selling rice when she graduated from high school. She purchases rice in large quantities from local farmers and resells it to retail customers at several traditional markets.

In order to assist her parents, Adelfina also sells solid palm sugar produced by her family. However, this depends on the season because the palm trees only produce liquid once a year, from April to November. 

Adelfina intends to increase her product quantity as rice is the staple food for the community in general. She would like to purchase one ton of rice from the supplier. Therefore, she is seeking a loan of 10,000,000 IDR. She is expecting TLM will assist her by providing a loan for the continuity of her business. She believes that she can earn more income to help her parents and to save some money for her future.

loans.use: to purchase one ton of rice.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 41 years old. She is a married woman with two children aged 20 and 14 years old. She and her husband are both farmers. According to Jenny, she has been growing rice and corn crops for 17 years. She earns about 7,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Jenny is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and herbicides. She hopes to be able to have her own farming equipment. She also hopes for her children to finish their studies and find jobs.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Maarif

texts.en:
Maarif, 58 years old, is married and has three children. He is a market vendor and farmer at the same time, having sold fruit for more than 10 years. During these years, Maarif has acquired the knowledge and skills required for the business. For instance, he knows how to store the fruits to keep their marketable conditions and not lose their taste and useful properties. 

Maarif sells fruit such as apples, peaches and pomegranates in the local central market, where he is known among people because of his attractive prices and characteristic friendliness. All this allows Maarif’s business to generate a considerable stable income for his family. 

Due to the current season, Maarif’s goods are in high demand. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 2,000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizers to increase his crop for next season. He wishes to save enough money from his retail sales and rebuild his house.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and fertilizers to increase crop production

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David de 27 años de edad, natural de la ciudad de San Francisco, convive con Mariluz de 24 años y fruto de esa relación concibieron 01 hija llamada Karol de 03 años y juntos habitan en su propio lecho construido a base de material rústico, madera y techo de calamina. Los campos de cultivo que con tanto esfuerzo logró comprarlo David, es el único sustento para los miembros de su familia, sus cultivos están trabajadas de manera tecnificada y por lo cual  son muy solicitados en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que su notoriedad de cosechar cacao, café y ajonjolíes, son de muy buena calidad y por lo cual sus productos son vendidos a buenos precios.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga de insectos, ya que estos asechan sin piedad las florecillas de cada producto. Lleva 05 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los pesados sacos de sus productos desde la chacra hasta los secaderos realizando un recorrido de una hora a caminata. David solicita el crédito para comprar sacos de abono y así mejorar sus tierras y posteriormente cosechar frutos de muy buena calidad y en abundancia. David posteriormente comprará mas espacios de terreno para sembrar más plantas de cacao, ya que es un producto perdurable. Este será su primer crédito con MFP y esta muy contento de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su proyecto planeado y por ende se compromete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas programadas. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará sacos de abono para fertilizar sus tierras.
texts.en:
27-year-old David is originally from the town of San Francisco.  He lives with 24-year-old Mariluz and the couple have one daughter called Karol who is 3 years old.  They live together in their own home which is built from rudimentary materials and wood, and has a roof made from metal sheets.  The farmland that David managed to buy through a lot of hard work is the only source of support for the members of his family.  He applies modern technology to growing his crops and, for this reason, they are very much in demand in the town of San Francisco.  He harvests very good quality cacao, coffee and sesame seeds, so his produce sells at good prices.

What David most enjoys about his work is protecting his crops from pests as the pests attack the flowers of each of his crops without mercy.  He has been in this line of work for five years and he considers the most difficult part to be transporting the heavy sacks of produce from his farm to the drying areas as this entails a one hour walk.

David is requesting this loan to buy sacks of manure so that he can improve his land and thereby later harvest very good quality fruit in abundance.  He will later buy more plots of land so that he can sow more cacao plants as this is a durable product.  This will be David's first loan from MFP and he is very happy to know that he will have financial support as this will make him feel safe in moving forward with his planned project.  He therefore pledges to make his repayments on time.  He will use the 3,000 soles to buy sacks of manure to fertilize his land.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is married with two children. She is 40 years old and lives in Maikay, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.
To earn a living, Annie has a beauty products retail business. She has run this business for three years. Each month, she earns approximately 5,000 PHP. Annie has been a member of Kiva partner, PMPC, for three years. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase beauty products such as face creams, lotions and soap.
In the future, Annie hopes to send her children to school and see them complete their college degrees.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products such as face creams, lotion and soap.

loans.name: Caroline Kadide

texts.en: Caroline is twenty nine years old, married and they have two children aged eleven years and two years old. She operates a beauty salon business at the busy Mwembe Tayari market in Mombasa,Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well known for its many many tourist attraction sites, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. She has been running her salon business for ten years now. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is there are so many people doing the same kind of business as hers in the area and so customers are spoilt for choice. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy hair relaxers, treatments, weaves and other hair additions. She hopes to grow her business and also educate her children to the university level in future. She describes herself as talkative, friendly and convenient.

loans.use: Hair relaxers, treatments, weaves and other hair additions

loans.name: Filipinas

texts.en:
Filipinas is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad transport.

Filipinas has been in this business for four years. Filipinas earns more income from food vending.

Filipinas has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her trisikad transport business

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene dos hijos de 4 y 1 años; vive con su familia en Otavalo en la provincia de Imbabura que está ubicado al Norte de Ecuador. Martha se describe como una persona de caracter fuerte y muy decidida, es también una mujer emprendedora que todos los días tiene el deseo de superación buscando el bienestar de su familia.

Martha trabaja sola en la elaboración y venta de helados en el terminal terrestre de Otavalo. Es el cuarto crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de un congelador ya que el actual está en malas condiciones lo que no permite que los helados estén a la temperatura optima. Esta inversión le ayudará a que sus helados estén a la temperatura optima y que sus helados se mantengan en buenas condiciones durante el día de ventas.

Su sueño es poder tener un local propio donde pueda contratar a personal que necesite de trabajo y así obtener buenos ingresos y poder sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Martha is 36, married, and has two children ages four and one.  She lives with her family in Otavalo in the province of Imbabura, which is located in  northern Ecuador. 

Martha describes herself as a person with a strong personality, and very determined. She is also an enterprising woman, who every day has the desire to improve herself for the well-being of her family. 

Martha works on her own, making and selling ice cream in Otavalo's bus terminal.  This is the fourth loan she is applying for at Fodemi.  She will invest it in the purchase of a freezer, since her current one is in poor condition, which doesn't allow the ice cream to be kept at optimal temperature. This investment will help her ensure that her ice cream is kept at optimal temperature, and is in good condition during the day of sale. 

Her dream is to have her own shop, where she can hire staff who need work, and in this way get good income, and help her family get ahead.

loans.use: To buy a new freezer for her business.

loans.name: Ndareti S.h.g Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Ndareti S.H Group in Western Kenya! Mary is the facilitator of the Ndareti S.H group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mary takes care of nine children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Mary had a good maize yield harvesting 6 bags on 0.5 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Mary was only able to harvest 1.5 bags of maize on 0.5 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mary and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Mary will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ndareti S.H group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Mary M.

texts.en: Salone Microfinance Trust, a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present to you Mary, a small scale businesswoman in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. The thirty-five-year-old Mary is married and has four children – two in secondary school and the others are not of school-going age. Mary has been a businesswoman for six years now. She sells plastic bowls, buckets, plates, trays, spoons, etc. With her loan, she is going to expand her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current ones.

loans.use: to buy plastic bowls, buckets, plates, trays, spoons, etc. in bulk to add to her current ones

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Imani Group in Western Kenya! Janepher is the facilitator of the Imani group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Janepher takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Janepher had a good maize yield harvesting 15 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Janepher was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janepher and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Janepher will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Imani group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Weumba Group

texts.en:
Stephen is the facilitator of the Weumba group. Stephen and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Stephen takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Stephen had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Stephen was only able to harvest 4 bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Stephen and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Stephen will invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Weumba group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Joker

texts.en: Joker is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. Joker is providing motorcycle (habal-habal) services. He has had this business for three years. He requested a loan of P10,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline. Joker has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Joker hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Juventino

texts.es:
El  Juventino se dedica  a la venta de tortillas es repartidor va en su moto a repartir tortillas en su comunidad y comunidades vecinas.
Es un joven trabajador humilde con deseos de superarse y formar una familia .
El pidió el préstamo para la compra de maíz para la elaboración de tortillas mexicanas de manos mexicanas.
Le da las gracias fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado  para seguir adelante y triunfar en la vida.
texts.en:
Juventino sells tortillas for a living, delivering them on his motorcycle.  He delivers tortillas in his community and in neighboring communities.

He is a humble young worker who wants to better himself and start a family.

He asked for this loan to buy corn to make Mexican tortillas with Mexican hands.

He thanks the Foundation for the support it has given him to get ahead and succeed in life.

loans.use: to buy corn to make tortillas

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Nestor provides "motorela" or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

Nestor has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Nestor hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the services.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.es: Oli como de cariño le dicen tiene 37 años de edad y está casada con el señor Santos el cual trabaja en la construcción en el país vecino, tiene dos niños los cuales estudian la primaria, dice que su esposo tuvo que  emigrar a otro país porque lo que ganaba en su localidad no le alcanzaba  entonces con los ahorros que él le manda ella empezó el negocio de la cría y venta de borregos para así darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus niños y así hacerles poco a poco una casa ya que antes vivían en una de madera y les entraba el frio y seguido se le enfermaban ya que abeces caen fuertes heladas en su localidad. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito para comprar un poco más de borregos ya que en el mes de diciembre y enero tienen mejores ventas de este tipo de animales por las fiestas navideñas, también quiere comprar alimento y vacunas para que  no se le enfermen los animales. La meta que tiene Olivia es tener un gran rebaño para cualquier emergencia que tenga pueda vender algún animalito y no estarse preocupando por conseguir dinero.
texts.en: Oli, as her friends call her, is 37 years old. Her husband Santos works in construction in a neighboring country. They have two children in elementary school. She said her husband had to immigrate to another country because what he could earn locally was not enough to provide for the family. The money he has sent home has allowed her to start a business raising and selling sheep. The business has allowed her to improve her children's lives. She has been building a house little by little; they used to have a wooden house, but the cold entered the house and they frequently got sick. She will use the loan to purchase sheep because the highest demand is in December and January during the Christmas season. She will also buy vaccines and animal feed for her animals. Olivia's goal is to have a large flock, so that if there is an emergency she can sell and animal instead of worrying about how to find the money.

loans.use: raise and sell sheep

loans.name: Kim Sreang

texts.en:
H. Kim Sreang currently sells cloth in a market near her home. She does not have a stall of her own, and she earns about $15 a day. She is applying for this loan of $1,000 so that she may purchase her own small stall at the market, which will allow her to increase her income.

H. Kim Sreang's husband repairs air conditioners and earns a monthly salary of $150 in addition to a $10 service fee each day. They have two children who are both currently enrolled in school. H. Kim Sreang is looking forward to the increased income that her own stall will bring to the family, and in the future she would like to be able to help provide her family with a new home.

loans.use: Purchase small stall in the market to sell cloth.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin K. lives and works in the Ulguc village in the region of Agsu. He is single and supports his mother and father. He opened up a small store one year ago and is hoping to expand his current store with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to build onto his current shop

loans.name: Jossie

texts.en:
Jossie from Vaimoso runs a shop in her own village. She used to sell BBQ before she joined SPBD in the beginning of 2006. She managed to get a first loan from SPBD to continue selling BBQ, and was successful enough at the same time to open a new grocery shop as her other small business.

Jossie is married with 1 kid and her husband is working, which greatly assists her in a time when both businesses are too slow. She earns ST$120 on a daily basis and her overall net profit for a week is ST$500 (USD$180).

Jossie continues to work hard on her small businesses and she is willing to extend her shop in the future. She has applied for another loan to upgrade her existing shop business.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for the village shop

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresita is 35 years old, is married, and has two daughters, who are 8 and 9 years old. When she was young she learned how to weave bed covers from her mother. After she married, with much sacrifice she was able to use her savings from her weavings to buy a milk cow so that she could feed her children well and sell the milk. Due to the difficult economic situation in which they live, her husband had to emigrate to the capital city, Asunción, where he works in a shoe store. Teresita now has three milk cows. She sells the milk and at the same time continues weaving blankets, which she sells to a store located in the center of the city. Thanks to these activities she has been able to support her children, who are in primary school.

Sales of milk generate a good income, which is why she plans to buy one more cow. This way there won’t be any periods during the year when there isn’t milk and her husband can return home to his wife and children and work at selling milk. .

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Teresita tiene 35 años es casada y tiene dos hijas de 8 y 9 años. Desde jovencita aprendió el oficio de tejer sobrecamas con la madre. Luego de casarse, con mucho sacrificio pudo comprar con los ahorros de su actividad una vaca lechera para alimentar correctamente a sus hijos y comercializar la leche Debido a la difícil situación económica que vive, el cónyuge tuvo que emigrar a la ciudad capital,Asunción, donde trabaja en una zapatería como empleado. Hoy día Teresita cuenta ya con tres vacas lecheras, ella se dedica a la venta de leche y a la vez sigue tejiendo sus colchas que los vende a una tienda ubicada en el centro de la ciudad. Gracias a estas actividades ha podido mantener a sus hijos que estan estudiando en la escuela primaria. La venta de leche genera buenos ingresos, por lo que planea comprar una vaca más, de esta forma no habrá temporadas que quede sin abastecimiento de leche y su marido podrá volver a la casa a dedicarse de lleno a la venta junto con su esposa e hijos.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia is an entrepreneurial and enthusiastic woman. She is married and has three children aged 21, 22, and 24. Her family has financial problems because of her husband's small salary. Given the necessity of an extra salary, for the past ten years Patricia dedicated herself to the production and sale of food, with which she has been able to cover several family debts and pay for the continued education of her children. Thanks to the good quality of the products she prepares, she now has many orders and has incresed the variety of foods she prepares.

So that she can increase her production to cover her demand, Patricia is asking for a loan of $750, which she will use to purchase kitchen hardware. She has promised to repay her loan in 6 months. With part of her profits, Patricia hopes to continue expanding her business and thanks you very much for the help you offer her.

Translated from Spanish by Eric Strader, Kiva Volunteer

Patricia es una mujer emprendedora y entusiasta, es casada y tiene tres hijos, de 21, 22 y 24 años de edad. Su familia tenia problemas económicos causados por el bajo salario que recibe su esposo, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, desde hace diez años, Patricia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas con lo que ha ayudado a cubrir algunas deudas y apoyar a que sus hijos continúen en la escuela. Gracias a la buena calidad de los productos que elabora, ahora tiene muchos pedidos y ha incrementado la variedad de alimentos que prepara.

Para poder incrementar su producción para cubrir su demanda, Patricia esta solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de utensilios de cocina, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Patricia, ella desea continuar creciendo con su negocio y agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen hardware

loans.name: Máxima Figueora

texts.en: Two years ago, this skilled entrepreneur started her business.  She purchases clothes wholesale in Dajabón and Elías Piña, where garments can be acquired at very low prices, and she sells the clothes in her community.  That way, Máxima, 40, helps her husband face the family’s needs and provides their three children with a good education.  The entrepreneur is requesting a loan because she wants to supply the business with more clothes so that she can increase her sales volume during the holiday season.  With profits from the business, she will also set aside money for possible disease issues of a member of the family.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of a large amount clothes in order to increase her sales volume during the holiday season.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is divorced and lives with her son in Zaporozhye, Ukraine. Mariya runs a clothing sales business in the Alexandrovskyi market selling men’s and women’s outer wear and footwear. Mariya has been in the shoe sale business for a while. She has an individual approach for each of her customers and has a fixed discount system too. Moreover, Mariya has a unique ability to choose the perfect new shoe models that always sells well because they are trendy.

Currently, Mariya has about $1800 in inventory and her net monthly profit is about $400. Mariya would like to get a loan of $600 to purchase new models of winter boots and shoes. This winter in Ukraine is expected to be cold and windy which is why Mariya is hoping to have good sales and profits as a result. We know this client is a very enterprising and determined lady which characterizes her as being capable of loan repayment.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Makhira

texts.en: Makhira is the mother of two children. She has been in the clothing sales business for five years. This 33-year-old woman is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from Armenian-occupied Fuzuli town in Azerbaijan and is settled in the Fuzuli region, in Bala Bakhmanli village, which was built for IDPs. Now Makhira needs a loan of $725 to buy clothes to help improve her business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Leyla

texts.es:
Leyla has her grocery store in a very appropriate location. She sells provisions (rice, milk, eggs, sugar, etc.) and has been doing it for a while. She is 35 years of age and the mother of four children, who are her inspiration to progress. Her husband, Felix, who also works in the grocery store, agrees with all her decisions and both have proposed to offer everything necessary to each member of their household for their complete personal and professional development. Leyla wishes to expand her business, and of course with time, set up a mini-market. To accomplish this goal, she needs a loan. With your help, she will accomplish her greatest goal in a very short time.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Leyla, tiene su bodega en un lugar muy apropiado, se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, leche, huevo, azúcar, etc), desde hace mucho tiempo, tiene 35 años de edad y es madre de cuatro hijos, quienes son su aspiración de progreso, su esposo el señor, Félix, quien también se dedica a la venta de abarrotes esta de acuerdo en todo lo que ella decide y ambos se han propuesto brindarles lo necesario a cada uno de los miembros de su hogar para su completo desarrollo personal y profesional.Leyla sólo quiere acrecentar su negocio y con el tiempo desde luego llegar a poner su minimarket, para cumplir este fin solicita un préstamo. Con tu ayuda logrará su sueño más anhelado en corto tiempo.

loans.use: Increase capital to expand her business and increase the amounts and varieties of the products she offers.

loans.name: Justa Sabina

texts.es:
Mrs. Justa S. C. is 54 years old. She studied until 3rd grade of elementary school. She has two children who are grown up and do not depend on her. She lives in the district of Mache, Otuzco province, La Libertad department in Peru.

The business she has is the sale of meat from pigs, piglets, and beef, which she kills after some time of having bought them and she distributes the meat to restaurants in the districts of Julcan and Trujillo.

Previously, she worked only to farming, planting potatoes, but she had to stop this activity because the price of potatoes is low and it was not profitable; for some time she lost the capital invested in her farm, because aside from the problem of low prices, there was a pest that attacked farms. This is why she decided to work in her current business.

She became part of the communal bank, "Women of Mache" in which she received a loan for S/. 300.00 and with this money she bought two pigs.

With the loan for S/.800.00, which she will pay in 4 months, she will buy 3 pigs and 4 sheep. Mrs. Justa dreams of setting up a general store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Justa Sánchez C. tiene 54 años de edad, estudió hasta el tercer grado de primaria. Tiene dos hijos que ya son mayores y ya no dependen de ella. Vive en el distrito de Mache provincia de Otuzco en el departamento La Libertad - Perú

El negocio que tiene es la venta de carne de cerdo, huachos y reses el cual los mata después de cierto tiempo de haberlos comprado y lo distribuye por los restaurantes de los distritos de Julcán y Trujillo.

Anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la chacra, sembraba papas pero tuvo que dejar esa actividad porque el precio de la papa es bajo y ya no le convenía; por una época perdió el capital invertido en estas siembras ya que aparte de ese problema hubo una plaga que atacó a las plantaciones. Por eso decide dedicarse a su actual negocio.

Ella integra el Banco Comunal “Mujeres de Mache” en el cual le dieron un préstamo de S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró dos chanchos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 800.00 que pagará en 4 meses comprará 3 cerdos y 4 carneros. La señora Justa sueña con poner una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio.

loans.use: Buying more animals for her business.

loans.name: Thi Chien's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs N. Thi Chien who is 30 years old and lives with her husband and her two children. While her two children are attending school, Mrs N. Thi Chien goes to the local recycling market to trade recycled irons and her husband is seeking work as a day laborer. Together, Mr and Mrs N. Thi Chien also maintain a family pig farm to earn additional income for the family. Mrs N. Thi Chien is asking for this loan in order to purchase livestock feed for her pigs. Mrs N. Thi Chien's loan group consists of 6 individuals and all plan to use this loan to expand their current businesses
-Mrs N. Thi Duyen: purchasing livestock feed for her pigs and chickens
-Mrs D. Thi Lan: purchasing ducklings to expand her duck flock
-Mrs D. Thi Lien: purchasing livestock feed for her pigs
-Mrs N. Thi Minh: expanding her metal recycling business
-Mrs N. Thi Nham: purchasing merchandise for her retail shop

Chị Nguyễn Thị Chiên, năm nay 30 tuổi. Chị có chồng và hai con đang đi học. Hàng ngày chị đi chợ sắt, anh đi làm thuê, ngoài ra anh chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn để thêm thu nhập cho gia đình. Chị vay vốn lần này để mua cám cho đàn lợn của gia đình. Trong nhóm chị còn có: Chị Nguyễn Thị Duyên vay để mua cám cho lợn, gà. Chị Đỗ Thị Lan vay để mua vịt giống về nuôi. Chị Đỗ Thị Liên vay để mua thức ăn cho lợn. Chị Nguyễn Thị Minh vay để thêm vốn đi chợ sắt. Chị Nguyễn Thị Nhâm vay để thêm vốn bán hàng tạp hoá tại chợ làng.

loans.use: Purchasing livestock feed & expanding retail business | Mua cám cho lợn, gà và đi chợ buôn bán

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sun N., is 65 years old and runs a stand at home near a tourist site, selling a variety of souvenir products to plenty of tourists passing through. She can moderately make about $15 per day in revenue. Her income has been divided into two sources. First, she uses some for her family’s daily expenses, and the remaining she saves for expanding her business and to pay back her loan. Her husband works breeding cows and also assists in her business.

She has seven children. All of them are married and stay outside the family’s home. So right now she lives with only her husband and her grand children.

Furthermore, Mrs. Sun N. has applied for a loan to purchase more souvenir products to meet her growing customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more souvenir products to meet growing customer demand

loans.name: Tulsi Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tulshi Maiya M. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur, a part of Nepal where most people are farmers. She is married and has two children. Her husband, Tulshi Ram M., is a laborer who builds houses for a living. They have two sons who are in high school.

The family lives in poverty because her husband's income is not enough to support four people. To overcome this problem, Mrs. M. opened up a poultry farm two years ago. She now makes a living selling chickens in the local market. Because of her success, her family's conditions are slowly improving. To continue this improvement, she has applied for a loan of $150 to buy 100 baby chicks to raise on her poultry farm.

loans.use: To buy baby chickens

loans.name: Hiung

texts.en: Mrs. Hiung K. is 46 years old and a housewife in Phnom Penh Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. Keut Om, is 44 and is currently unemployed. The couple has five children, one of whom is married. Three of the children help to support their family by working in garment factories, earning up to $70 US per month each. Mrs. Hiung is applying for a loan to add to her family's savings and to purchase a motorbike to help her husband start a motortaxi business. In the future, she would like to open and run her own grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to run a motortaxi business.

loans.name: Idigul

texts.ru:
Idigul A. lives in the city of Vahdat. She is married and has 3 children. She has a large plot of land that she grows vegetables and wheat on. It is now time to prepare the land for the upcoming season, so in order to buy seeds, enriched fertilizer, and fuel, she wants to take out a loan. She plans on repaying the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva volunteer.

Асоева Идигуль проживает в городе Вахдат. Замужем и меет троих детей. Имеет большой участок земли , который засеивает овощами и пшеницей. Наступил сезон подготовки земли к новому посеву. Поэтому для покупки семян , минеральных удобрений и горючего хочет получить кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Obtain fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Zikran's Group

texts.en:
Zikran baji is the wife of N. M. and lives in a small city named Arifwala, Pakistan.  She has been living in this city for the last 40 years.  She is the mother of eight children: four sons and four daughters.  Her elder son is a washer man.  The next eldest son runs a grocery shop.  Her elder daughter sews clothes.  The others are enrolled in a local school in her neighborhood.  Her husband is a wholesaler.  

Zikran baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work.  She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan).  Now she is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her son's grocery shop.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members.  Rashidan baji wants a  loan to buy mason tools.  Farhat baji wants a loan to buy materials (iron rods) for her welding business.  Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell.  Latifan baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan.  The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business.  The members mutually guarantee one another's loans.  If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store

loans.name: Nashima

texts.en: Nashima K. is 30 years old and lives in Tangal, Lalitpur with her 34-year-old husband and two sons.  Nashima works with her husband in their watch shop, which they opened together five years ago.  In their shop, Nashima and her husband sell watches and repair timepieces that local people bring to them.  Because her shop would be more efficient and profitable with better tools and a wider variety of products, Nashima is requesting a loan of $150.  She aspires to use the profits to put her two sons through school and thereby better the situation of her family.

loans.use: To buy watches and tools.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.fr: Mme Rebecca A.  est née en 1955 à Bégbé dans la Préfecture au sud du Togo  Elle mariée à un cultivateur avec lequel elle a eu huit (08) enfants.  Pour aider son mari à subvenir aux charges de la famille, elle s’est lancée également dans l’agriculture notamment la culture du mais. Elle sollicite un financement pour s’approvisionner en engrais pour accroître ses récoltes et augmenter son revenu.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rebecca A. was born in 1955 in Bégbé (South Togo). She's married to a farmer and they have eight children. To help her husband in providing for the family, she started cultivating corn. She's seeking a loan to buy fertilizers in order to increase her production and her revenue.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba B. sells used clothing at Cape Coast. Habiba has received no formal education. She is a single parent and has 3 children. Habiba has been selling used clothing since 2004. She is responsible for payment of school fees, utility bills, rent and other family expenses. Her loan will be used as additional capital for the buying of more used clothing for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards acquiring a piece of land she wants to buy to put up a house for her children and herself.

loans.use: Her loan will be used as additional capital for the buying of more used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.es: Dolly  tiene 31 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que son sus ganas de salir adelante. Ella es propietaria de dos motocarros que los tiene desde hace 3 años, con su negocio de transporte de pasajeros, brinda trabajo a sus hermanos, quienes se dedican a este oficio desde hace 5 años atrás, ellos ahora manejan sus motocarros. Lo bueno de este trabajo es que le produce como es debido, manteniéndola bien económicamente. Le es rentable debido a ella misma administra las ganancias, razón por la cual le va muy bien. Es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, y es una clienta puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a reparar sus motocarros para que trabajen sin dificultad alguna.
texts.en:
Dolly is 31 years old. She lives with her husband and two children, who are her inspiration for getting ahead. She is the owner of two motorcars (3-wheeled motorcycle) which she has had for the past 3 years. With her passenger transportation business she provides work for her brothers, who have been in this type of job for the past 5 years. They now drive her vehicles. What is good about this work is the income which supports them economically. It is profitable because she manages the earnings and things are going very well. This is her 7th loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is very punctual with her payments. With the money she requests she will repair her vehicles to that they work better.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair her motorcars.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es socio del Bancomunal Perlas de la Sabiduriíta 
Julio tiene 28 años es conviviente tiene un hijo de 2 años 
Él empezó alquilando una moto-taxi luego se compro una al crédito ya termino de pagarlo hace tres meses

necesita un crédito de 600 soles para invertirlo en mantenimiento de sus moto-taxi y comprar el  SOAT
Julio vive en casa alquilada y su sueño es tener casa propia
texts.en:
Julio is a member of the “Perlas de la Sabiduría” (Pearls of Wisdom) Communal Bank. Julio is 28 years old, has a partner and a two year old son. He began renting a motor-taxi and then bought one on credit which he paid off three months ago. He needs a loan for 600 soles to invest in the maintenance of his motor-taxi and buy a SOAT. Julio lives in a rented house and dreams of having his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her motor-taxi

loans.name: Grupo Guadalupana Group

texts.es:
Este es el grupo Guadalupana, originario del municipio de Niquinohomo, conformado por Rosa Esperanza C. J., Bertha Carolina S., Juanita Isabel R. C., Rodolfo Antonio C. M., estos cuatro integrantes son vecinos bien conocidos, decidieron unirse para ser sujetos de crédito porque no tienen garantías para poner en un banco, en Adim obtuvieron el crédito y están satisfechos por la confianza que les tuvieron, esperan no tener fallas en sus pagos para siempre tener el crédito con Adim.
Doña Juanita Isabel vende plantas y artesanías en los pueblos cercanos y en los departamentos de la zona norte como Río Blanco, en donde ya tiene varios clientes. Esta joven mujer de 26 años con dos hijos pequeños, un varón de 3 años y una mujercita de 5 años, compra los productos en Catarina y en San Juan de Oriente donde logra tener buenos precios. Se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años, la aprendió con su abuela que es ahora quien le cuida los niños cuando ella viaja a vender. Es madre soltera, jefa de hogar, vive con hermanas y la abuela. El crédito lo necesita para comprar artesanías que tiene encargada en Río Blanco y para llevar otras variedades en artesanía de madera como camas de madera, muebles pequeños y mesitas de noche, las que ya requieren una inversión más grande. Espera que con las capacitaciones ella aprenda a manejar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
This group called Guadalupana is from the municipality of Niquinohomo, and is formed by Esperanza C. J., Bertha Carolina S., Juanita Isabel R. C., Rodolfo Antonio C. M.,, these four members are also neighbors very well known, who decided to get together to request a loan from Adim and are satisfied with the trust this institution provides them, and they expect to do their payments on time to keep a good record with Adim. Ms. Juanita Isabel sells plants and handicrafts in the near by towns and areas of the north like Rio Blanco, where she has several clients. This young lady is 26 years old and has two little children, a 3 year old boy and a 5 year old girl; she buys products in Catarina and San Juan de Oriente where she gets good prices. She has been working on this for the last 10 years, and learned from her grandmother who now takes care of her children when she goes to sell. She is a single mother, head of household and lives with her sisters and grandmother. She will use the loan to buy handicrafts her clients from Rio Blanco requested and other varieties of items like wood beds, small furniture and bed stands, which need a larger version. She hopes with the lessons at Adim she will learn to manage her business better.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy more products for her clients

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El señor Hernan B. tiene 46 años, y esta casado con la señora Maria Roman tambien de 46 años de edad, ambos son padres de 2 hijos, y les gustaría que estudien medicina.

El cliente se dedicaba a la explotación de madera, y hace 5 años decidió cambiar de rubro y montó una gomeria, el cual progreso rápidamente, ya que su domicilio cuenta con muy buena ubicación, sobre una Ruta internacional, en donde circulan muchos vehículos de mediano y mayor porte.

El dinero del prestamo será invetido para la compra de cubiertas, y tiene proyectado para el futuro vender repuestos para vehiculos y ampliar su local.

Desea que el pais invierta más en crear industrias para aprovechar mejor la producción agricola y crear fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Hernan B. is 46 years old and married to Maria Roman, also 46. They are the parents of two children and they would like them to study medicine. The client was in the lumber business and five years ago decided to change businesses and opened a tire centre which grew rapidly as his house is very well located next to an international highway with alot of traffic of medium and heavy vehicles. He will use the loan to buy tires and plans to sell spare parts in the future and expand his shop. He wishes the country would invest more in creating industries to take better advantage of agriculture create employment.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Bancomunal El Sembrador.
Rosa es  casada,  tiene seis hijos, la ultima tiene 12 años, esta estudiando en la escuela especial para ciegos.
Rosa  estudio costura y se puso a trabajar desde los dieciocho años, empezó a coser en su casa ropa a medida,  hasta el día de hoy ella sigue  cosiendo ropa a medida, también quiere abrir una bodega en su casa. 
Desde que esta en Finca tiene mas capital para trabajar, ha aprendido a ahorrar, hacer responsable con el dinero que solicita.
Rosa necesita un crédito de 1200 soles,  para abrir una bodega en su casa y comprar arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite.
El sueño de Rosa es poner  un taller de costura.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of Village Bank El Sembrador. She is married with six children, the youngest of whom is 12 and studies in a special school for the blind. Rosa studied sewing and began working at eighteen. She began by sewing clothing made-to-measure in her home. She continues to do this today, but would also like to open a convenience store in her home. Since joining Kiva Partner Finca Peru she has more working capital and has learned how to save and be responsible with the money she borrows. Rosa requires a loan of 1200 soles in order to open this shop and to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and oil. Her dream is to one day open up a tailor's workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a store and purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Tatiana

texts.en: Tatiana is a very diligent housewife. She grows cattle and also produces dairy products as well as beef to sell. She has been raising animals for more than 6 years. Tatiana lives alone in a village in the town of Leova. Tatiana wants to start a business, namely to increase her cattle and produce milk to be sold in the market of her region. Tatiana decided to request a loan from Microinvest in order to develop a business of breeding.

loans.use: starting up a cattle-breeding business

loans.name: Eliodora

texts.es:
La Sra. Eliodora B. es soltera y tiene 2 hijas mayores de edad.  Una de ellas ya le ayuda en su negocio, que  inició con un capital de Gs. 500.000.- son $ 100.- aproximadamente. Trabaja en el rubro de macaterìa, es decir venta de mercaderías en general en forma ambulatoria (casa por casa). Este actividad fue ampliando con el correr de los años ya que cuenta con una amplia clientela porque la zona en la que se encuentran es muy poblada y muy concurrida.

La señora Eliodora retira el préstamo para la compra de varios artículos de mercería y bazar para regalos y  productos de tocador y cosméticos, de esta forma renovaría su stock, para dar satisfacción a todos los clientes quienes ya le hicieron sus pedidos.

Uno de sus apiraciones es poder ampliar próximamente su salón comercial.  Ella quiere refaccionar su vivienda y asi podría ampliar el negocio en lo que se refiere al equipamiento o mobiliario y poder ofrecer un ambiente más cómodo y ameno a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Eliodora B. is unmarried and has two older daughters. One of them helps with her business, which she started with Gs. 500,000, or approximately $100. She sells general merchandise door to door. Her business has grown over the years and she now has ample clients because the area she works in is heavily populated and very busy. Señora Eliodora will use the loan to purchase various merchandise such as gifts, bathroom supplies, and cosmetics to build up her inventory so that she can satisfy all of the orders she has received from clients. She aspires to grow her commercial salon in the near future. She would like to renovate her storefront so that she can increase her business by offering her clients a more comfortable and pleasant atmosphere in addition to her mobile sales.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as: umbrellas, various games, beauty products, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Ferdinand

texts.en:
Ferdinand is a father of two children who runs a cosmetic shop, raises pigs and farms ginger. Ferdinand has his cosmetic shop in Hawker, an area within Bamenda. With this loan, Ferdinand plans to purchase a gamut of cosmetics (from hair to skin products), ginger to plant in his farm, and some supplies he needs to raise his pigs.

This is Ferdinand’s second loan from GHAPE since he became a beneficiary in 2007. He believes he runs a successful cosmetic shop because he notes, "there is constant buying of my products." He has been doing his business for long enough to know what works. He helps the community by "reducing unemployment and helping to oil people’s body." In Bamenda, a lot people use oil (lotion).

Ferdinand plans to use his loan to create profits. With this loan, he wishes to save some of the profits and use the others to help educate his children, as well as pay his bills. He chooses GHAPE loans because the loan conditions are preferable to him.

About GHAPE The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, ginger and pig raising supplies.

loans.name: Katty

texts.es: Katty tiene 35 años, vive en su casa propia con su esposo, sus hijos y su madre. Desde hace 5 años trabaja en su misma casa realizando bellos tejidos a mano, sus herramientas son básicamente sus palitos de tejer. Elabora todo tipo de prendas, desde gorros, chompas, ponchos, etc., según se lo soliciten sus clientes, de esta manera viene generando ingresos para su familia. Adicionalmente, ofrece el servicio de cosmetología cuando sus vecinas o vecinos necesitan algún corte de cabello, peinado o maquillaje en el caso de las mujeres. Hasta el momento, estas actividades le son rentables, por lo que Katty está pensando tener una tienda de comestibles, un salón de belleza y un puesto donde vender sus tejidos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada de pertenecer a su grupo porque le gusta el trabajo en equipo. El dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de más lana de diversas calidades y colores.
texts.en:
Katty is 35 and lives with her husband, children, and mother in her own house, where, for the past 5 years, she has been making beautiful hand-knit things. Her tools are basically her knitting needles. She has been generating income for her family by making all sorts of garments including caps, sweaters, ponchos, etc., according to what her customers want. In addition, she offers cosmetology services whenever her neighbors need a haircut, styling, or makeup. Thus far this has all been profitable, so Katty is thinking about opening a grocery store, a beauty salon, and a place where she can sell her hand-knit items. This will be Katty's first loan with MFP, and she is very excited about belonging to her group because she likes to work with a team. She plans to use her loan to buy more wool in a variety of grades and colors.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool.

loans.name: Bobodonkul

texts.ru: Бободонкул Мамадалиев проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 59 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Бободонкул работал более 30 по профессии агрономом. После этого он решил начать свой бизнес. Он более 20 лет занимается земледелием. Бободонкул в основном выращивает картофель, капусту. Получив кредит, он хочет выращивать еще и овощи.
texts.en:
Bobodonkul M. lives in the Rumi region. He is 59 years old. He is married and has six children. Bobodonkul has worked as an agronomist for more than 30 years. After that he decided to start his own business. He has been in agriculture for more than twenty years. Bobodonkul mainly grows potatoes, cabbage. For the received loan he wants to grow more vegetables.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For expansion of business

loans.name: Judith Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Judith Juana P. C., tiene como actividad económica la venta de comida la cual expende en la pensión que posee junto a su hermano,  actividad que desarrolla diario desde hace 8 meses en el lugar, constituyéndose en una fuente principal de ingresos para ella y su familia, que esta conformada por ella y su hija.
texts.en:
Ms. Judith Juana P. C. sells food in the boarding house she owns with her brother, a business that has continually expanded for the 8 months it has been at the site. This business has become a major source of income for her family, which consists of herself and her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine-V Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Loan intended for an investment in the purchase of tables and chairs to expand business

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en: Florence M. is one of the executive members of Balikyewunya group in Gayaza and has a decorating business that has been running for over 20 years. She also keeps pigs at home. She is a friendly lady and this has won her customers because of her free nature. She is able to make a weekly profit of about 50,000/= and this usually increases in some seasons like Easter and Christmas and on special occasions.  Florence is a married mother of five children who are still in school and she cares for five grandchildren. Her main challenge is paying her children’s school fees. This is one reason Florence works so hard.  She needs a new loan to buy more decorating materials like nets and veils and to buy two pigs for her farm.

loans.use: To buy more decorating materials and more pigs.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.en:
Maria is 21 years old and single with no children.  She has a business selling fruit juice in the morning in front of her home in the city of Pucallpa.  Local juices are generally made from papayas, bananas, beets, carrots, and apples.  

Maria has been working with Kiva partner Manuela Ramos for one year and four months and is a member of the communal bank "Mujeres Forjadoras."  She used her very first loan of 300 soles to invest in the sale of cooked foods typical of the region.  She plans to use this loan of 1000 soles to purchase a blender, glasses, spoons and plates to implement her current business selling juices.

Maria has a number of goals for the future.  One day she would like to have her own business selling pastries.  She would also like to complete her studies in elementary education.

loans.use: A blender, glasses, spoons and plates (to be used for a business selling juices)

loans.name: Christopher's Group

texts.en: K. Christopher is a hard working and determined man with a family of 4 children as he cares for two dependants. All his children are school going and he works tirelessly to ensure that he completes his children’s fees on time. He has a retail shop business where he sells general merchandise in Kungu – Kavule for 10 years and he is happy that he is able to make 100,000/= as profits a week. Christopher wants to turn his retail shop into a wholesale shop in future so that he can increase his profitability and take care of his family better. He needs a loan to be able to add it in his business as working capital so that his business can run smoothly.

loans.use: Restocking his retail shop with more goods for increased profitability.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is married to Ricky, a simple farmer. She is 35 years old, and she is a loving mother to their six children whose ages range from three to seventeen years old. She hopes that all her children will someday earn college degrees.

Lucia manages a snack vending business, and sometimes she also accepts catering jobs. Her ambition is to have a productive business, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 7000 to expand it. She also intends to use some of the loan to help her husband meet farming needs. She believes that somehow she will be able to overcome whatever challenges that come along in life through the help of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To expand her snack vending business & for farming needs

loans.name: Norberto

texts.es:
Nolberto es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro.
Nolberto es casado, tiene 63 años y 4 hijos, Nolberto junto a su esposa tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, además vende ollas renaware por catalogo. Nolberto también brinda servicios de instalaciones eléctricas, pisos, etc.
Nolberto necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de una compresora y cortadora.
Los sueños de Nolberto son construir el tercer piso de su casa y viajar al extranjero.
texts.en:
Nolberto is a partner in the Ccori Ayllu Communal Bank. Ccori Ayllu means "The Golden Family". Nolberto is is 63 year old married man with 4 children. Together with his wife he runs a convenience store from his home. The store also sells Renaware pots through catalog order. Nolberto offers construction services, doing electrical work and flooring installation, etc. Nolberto is requesting a 1000 sol loan which he will invest in the purchase of an air compressor and a saw. He dreams of adding a 3rd floor to his house, and of someday traveling to other countries.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of an air compressor and saw

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel A. married and has one child. He has received junior high education. Emmanuel sells engine oils   at castle near yamoransah, which he has been doing since 2001. His wife is a trader. Emmanuel uses his income to pay his childrens school fees and utility bills. Emmanuel will use the loan to purchase more engine oil for sale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Emmanuel plans to plough back into his business.

loans.use: Emmanuel will use the loan to purchase more engine oil for sale.

loans.name: Fe Erma

texts.en:
At the age of 52 years old, Fe Erma A. is two years older than her husband Biato A.. Their three children: Emilio, 26, Ana Marie, 25, and Angelica, 21, are their blessings from above and the reasons they strive hard to fight against poverty. Now their grandchildren are added as their reason. All of their children now work after graduating from college but they don't oblige them to give them money because they know that their children have also their own families to support, and also because they have their own business that supports them in their living.

This business is a fishing business. They have a fish pond in the sea and her husband is the one who personally manages it because he is a fisherman. When the Typhoon Ondoy entered their area of the Philippines their fish pond was damaged because as the level of water in the sea got high all the fish inside the fish pond were lost. Now they want to expand the fish pond and put other small fish to raise until it is ready fpr harvest. She will use the loan from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) to buy what is needed for expanding the fish pond.

Fe Erma’s hopes that their business will continue to run and grow so that instead of their children helping them that they are the ones who will help them especially in the education of their grandchildren. She is praying to God to give her and her husband a long life so that they will guide their children in taking care of their own families.
