loans.use: To rebuild and increase a fishing business.

loans.name: Choun

texts.en: S., 54, is a married woman and the mother of six children. Three of them are married and the remainder are single and work as garment workers. To earn a living, S. buys silk skirts in bulk on credit from a silk weaver and then she sells them from door-to-door around Phnom Penh. She and her husband also cultivate crops. Because S. sees that her business is the main way for her to generate much income, she would like to request a loan from Kiva to order more silk skirts to sell.

loans.use: To order more silk skirts to sell

loans.name: Holmahmad

texts.ru: Хочаев Холмахмад проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет  5 детей. Холмахмад более 7 лет работает зав.хозом, помимо этого он занимается животноводством, он откармливает и продает скот. Кредит просит для покупки крупно и мелко рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Holmahmad H. lives in the Gissar region. He is 42 years old. He is married and has five children. Holmahmad has bee working as a manager for more than seven years and besides that he also does animal husbandry. He feeds and sells cattle. He is asking for a loan to buy large and small cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Las Picaflores Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las PicaF.” esta representado por L. señora María Inés y conformada por 10 miembros D. los cuales se dedican a L. venta D. diferentes productos como juegos electrónicos, huevos, jugos D. frutas naturales, desayunos periódicos y al transporte publico D. pasajeros.  L. gran mayoría D. las Socias son personas muy trabajadoras que se esfuerzan para sacar adelante sus pequeños negocios D. ya que L. competencia en el mercado es alta y ellas necesitan su ganancia para manutención D. sus hogares ya que L. mayoría D. ellas representan el sustento D. sus familias. El crédito será destinado para compra D. mercadería y para L. reparación D. los vehículos D. los socios que se dedican al trasporte Publico, algunas D. las socias dedicara el crédito al mejoramiento D. sus hogares para brindarles una mejor calidad debida a sus familias. El 50% D. los socios se encuentra en su quinto ciclo con nuestra institución pero participando todos juntos en grupo por su primer ciclo, por lo que conocen bastante D.  grupos solidarios y modalidad D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The PicaF. Group is represented by Mrs. María Inés and maD. up of 10 members who make a living selling different products like electronic games, eggs, natural fruit juices, breakfast, newspapers, and working in public transportation. The large majority of the members are very hardworking people who strive to help their little businesses get ahead. Competition in the market is high and they need their earnings to maintain their homes, since most of them are the only ones providing for their families.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise and to repair the vehicles of those members who work in public transportation. Some of the members will use the loan to improve their homes in order to give their families the better quality of life they deserve. Half of the members are now in their fifth loan cycle with our institution, but this is their first loan together as a group. They already know a lot about supportive groups and work ethic.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor capital

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
El Señor Rubén M. tiene 40 años, es casado y tiene 6 hijos.   Vive en Patzicia, Chimaltenango.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a cultivar verduras y luego las vendía en la terminal,  con sus ganancias logró iniciar una panadería en la colonia la Brigada y le fué bien con este negocio,  luego de 10 años en sociedad con su hermano compró una camioneta para transportar a vendedores y sus productos a la ciudad capital.  El señor M. dice que gracias a Dios ya le pago a su hermano su parte y tiene 3 camionetas,  quiere seguir trabajndo duro con sus negocios. El va a utilizar su prestamo para comprar repuestos para sus camionetas.
Su sueño es darle estudios a sus hijos para que puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Mr. Rubén M. is 40 years old, married, and has 6 children. He lives in Patzicia, Chimaltenango. Previously, he cultivated vegetables and sold them in the bus terminal. With his earnings, he started a bakery in Colonia la Brigada, and things went well with this business. After 10 years, he and his brother bought a bus for transporting vendors and their products to the capital city. Mr. M. says that, thanks to God, he has now purchased his brother's share, and he has 3 buses. He wants to continue working hard in his businesses. His dream is to provide for his children's studies so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Va a comprar repuestos para sus buses

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Mrs. Phon Y. lives in Krang Sbaek village in Takeo province. She is the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in different businesses while the others are attending the local school.

Mrs. Phon Y. is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Y. Yoeurn, makes big pots. He is shown on her left in the photo.

Although they try to work hard the couple still earns less income than needed. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Phon Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to transport salt to sell door to door.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to transport salt to sell door to door

loans.name: Zayra Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Zayra tiene 53 años de edad,  soltera, reside en el barrio 14 de Febrero, procreo nueve hijos los menores a un cursan la primaria,  desde hace diecisiete años se dedica a la venta de tortillas el cual compra el maíz por quintal, y se levanta a horas muy tempranas para ir a moler el maíz que deja ya nesquizado por las noches, para palmear las tortillas en horas de la mañana para vender a sus clientes. Pues da gracias  a Dios por haberle permitido tener su propio negocio ya que durante muchos años trabajo en servicios domesticas el cual el pago era poco y muy cansado. Lo cual ahora ve por su hijo y su casa. Con el crédito  va a comprar  materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, zinc para terminar de hacer las divisiones del cuarto ya que su casa es pequeña y sencilla de madera y zinc ya muy viejo pero por falta de dinero no ha logrado estas mejoras para su familia, con el esfuerzo y el interés que tiene de hacer esta necesidad de mejorar los cuarto, el cual espera ir mejorando con cada préstamo que hará en la institución ya que es el medio para poder lograr terminar de reparar su casa ya que le falta levantar las paredes de concreto, cambiar el techo, las puertas y embaldosar ya que es de tierra. Lo cual espera lograr a largo plazo. Y muy contenta por el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zayra is 53, single, and lives in the 14th of February neighborhood. She has nine children, the youngest still in primary school. For the last sixteen years she has worked selling tortillas. She buy the corn by the quintal (46 kilograms), and she gets up very early to grind it. She leaves the corn soaking at night, forms the tortillas in the morning, and then sells them to her customers. She thanks God for having allowed her to have her own business. For many years she worked as a domestic servant, but that work was poorly paid and very tiring. Now she is able to watch over her children and her home. With the loan she will buy construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement, and zinc to finish dividing up the rooms. Her wood and zinc house is small and simple, and now very old. She hasn’t been able to improve the house for her family because of lack of money. With hard work and the interest that she has, she will repair the rooms with each loan from the institution. She needs to build cement walls, change the roof, the doors, and put tile on the dirt floors. She hopes to do all this over a period of time. She is very thankful for the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy constuction materials such as: stone, sand, cement, zinc to divide up the rooms

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana sells clothing and shoes at the central market in Kherson. She has been in this business for 10 years. Her income is 3,000 UAH per month.

Tetyana is the kind of person who, if she decides something, she goes slowly but persistently until she reaches her goal. When she started this business, she really wanted to be economically independent. She has reached this goal now. Today she has many repeat clients and a stable business. Tetyana is a very friendly person and has good relationships with her neighbors at the market. 

Tetyana would like to borrow 8,600 UAH to increase seasonal inventories. Tetyana hopes to make additional profits and improve her living conditions. She lives in a house with her husband and son.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventories

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden B., 48, is a single, hardworking mother of five children.  She has been managing her own variety store for 10 years.

Eden has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for several months now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she has been able to borrow three times from the CCT Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues. She used the money she borrowed to buy added stocks for her store. She earns a profit of PHP 10,200 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to borrow PHP 8,000. She will use this money to her expanding business by buying assorted beverages.

She dreams that her business will grow and provide her family with a better standard of living. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: Buy  assorted beverages

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Silvia R., age 38, is married with three children, ages 19, 16 and 5. She has a grocery, which she started seven years ago. She works from 8 a.m. to after midnight daily and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $202.

This will be Silvia’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, a Kiva partner. She used the previous loan to start a local chicken business and she has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a new loan to improve on the grocery stock.

Silvia will share this loan with her subgroup, called Riziki Group, which totals seven members. These members deal in selling telephones, fruits, vegetables, eggs, blocks and have shops. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

In the picture, Silvia is in a red dress.

loans.use: To increase grocery stock

loans.name: Tlayecac Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Tlayecac por que en la comunidad donde viven a si llama. Todas las integrantes se dedican al comercio la Sra. Yolanda y Sebastiana venden dulces, Maleny, Luisa, Alicia venden comida, Yadira tiene una estética pequeña, Marcela vende servilletas tejidas, Dominga vende frutas y legumbres, Ambrosia tiene una tienda de abarrotes y Beda cría ganado.
La Sra. Alicia es integrante del grupo es casada tiene una hija que estudia la primaria ella vende comida en un local que esta en su casa.
Con éste crédito ella quiere comprar mesas, sillas, y un poco de dulce para vender en su local de comida y así poder sacar un poco mas de ganancias.
Nos comenta que se siente muy a gusto con este grupo ya que había trabajado en otros pero se sentían muy pesados por tantos problemas que habían y en este es todo lo contrario y nos comenta que espera poder seguir contando con el apoyo de fundación realidad y KIVA para salir adelante con toda su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called Tlayecac, as this is the name of the community where it is located. All the members are merchants. Yolanda and Sebastiana sell candy. Maleny, Luisa, and Alicia sell food. Yadira has a small beauty shop. Marcela sells cloth napkins. Dominga sells fruits and vegetables, Ambrosia has a general store, and Beda raises livestock. Alicia, a member of the group, is married and has a young daughter in primary school. She sells prepared food from her house. With this loan, she would like to buy tables and chairs, as well as a little candy, to sell in her locale so she can increase her profits. She tells us that she feels very comfortable as a part of this group; she had worked in others, but did not enjoy it because there were too many problems. Here, however, it is the opposite, and she hopes to be able to continue counting on the support from the Foundation Realidad and KIVA to continue helping her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack O. O. is 28 years old, married and blessed with 3 children. He lives in Nambale, Busia district, with his family. He runs a cereals business which he started in the year 2009. Before this he was employed at a local sugar factory but due to unavoidable circumstances, he lost his job, thus his business is a source of income.

Shadrack buys his stock twice a week from Busia town. He would like a loan expand his cereals business. He believes his future is built around investments in business, thus he would like to keep expanding his business.

loans.use: Expand Business

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouman est composé majoritairement de femmes célibataires ayant une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans, 4 enfants et habitant toutes le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles  se sont connues à travers des liens de  voisinage et de leurs activités de petit commerce dans le marché Médine. 
Elles font le commerce, de mangues, de riz, d’habits pour enfants et de bazins. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème  prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les quatre précédents.
Mademoiselle Bah Mallé qui fait de l’habillement  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 5 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants. 
Elle se ravitaille en habits en gros à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et  revend à domicile et en ambulant dans les quartiers à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Mademoiselle Bah Mallé espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour  être réinvesti dans son activité et acheter petit à petit les matériels pour son trousseau de mariage.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnouman is composed mostly of unmarried women who average 30 years of age and four children all living in the Darsalam district of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They know one another through community ties and their small-scale businesses at the Médine market.  They do commerce in mangoes, rice,  children's clothing, and damask fabrics.  Concerned about increasing their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fifth solidarity loan after having properly repaid the four preceding ones. Ms. Bah Mallé, who works in clothing, plans on using her loan for buying five dozen pieces of children's clothing.  She gets her stock of clothing wholesale in Bamako (capital of Mali) and resells out of her home and door-to-door through the districts to a customer base of women and men. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in the business and buying little by little the items for her hope chest. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying clothing

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita C., 49 years old and single, is from the village of Masabud Clarin Misamis Occidental. To make a living Tita plants and harvests different vegetables for sale. Tita has been doing so for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

Tita joined GDMPC in 2004 to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from GDMPC. Tita is requesting her ninth loan, for 6000 PHP, which she will use to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her standard of living.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note

To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 50-year-old lady married to a mechanic with a family of six children; they live in Masindi, Uganda. She says she pays the school fees for her children with a dream that they all will be educated up to university. She operates a bar in Masindi and has been in the business for six years, having started doing business with a retail shop. Her bar business has challenges just like any other business with bad debtors and the ever increasing cost of electricity in the country. 

That said though, Christine still feels good about the business and hopes to make it into a big guest house one day. For now, with the help of the credit  facility from HOFOKAM, Christine intends to buy beer, spirits, a  digital television set, and a generator for her pub.

loans.use: buying beer, spirits, digital television set, and a generator

loans.name: Joyce Naisiae

texts.en:
Joyce Naisiae L. is 54 years old. She is married to Francis L. and a mother of four children. Joyce is a farmer and she does poultry keeping which she has been doing for the last two years at her home.

She learned about KADET from other women in a group already registered with KADET in her area of residence. This will be her first loan which she will use to increase the number of broilers and expand the henhouse so as to keep more hens. Poultry-keeping has been a good business for her as most of the hotels get their orders from her. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her poultry farming activity from small-scale to large-scale.

Joyce's dream is do large-scale poultry farming and attain financial independence. She is a hard-working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To spend 20,000 KES to buy more broilers and 20,000 to construct another henhouse

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the village of Regency, Iponan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 44 years old. Elsie is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing hairdressing and beauty services, especially pedicures and manicures, to local community members. Elsie has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be Elsie's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand the business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide services.

location.town: Iponan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La Asociación Comunal “16 DE JULIO” está conformada por nueve personas, ocho mujeres y un varón. Este es su primer ciclo, la presidenta es la señora Eustaquia Santusa Q..  La asociación es parte del centro focal de Santiago II.

La señora Eustaquia, socia de 51 años de edad, casada, madre de 5 hijos,  tiene como negocio la venta de flores, ella comenta que aprendió este negocio de su madre desde los quince años.  

Ingresó a Pro Mujer por invitación de sus amigas.   El crédito le servirá para aumentar el capital de trabajo. Compra la mercadería en el mercado Rodríguez que se encuentra en la ciudad de La Paz, para venderlas en la feria, los días: viernes, sábado y domingo por las mañanas.

Conversando con la presidenta comenta que lo que más le gusta de Pro Mujer es la capacitación y el ahorro.
En cuanto a la asociación comunal, tienen diferentes tipos de negocios de servicio y comercio.
texts.en:
The 16th of July Communal Bank is made up of nine people: eight women and one man. This is their first loan cycle. Ms. Eustaquia is the group's president. This communal bank is part of the Santiago II branch. Ms. Eustaquia is 51 years old, married, and the mother of five children. Her business is selling flowers. She notes that she learned this business from her mother, starting when she was 15 years old. Her friends invited her to join Pro Mujer. She will use this loan to increase her working capital. She buys merchandise in the Rodriguez market in the city of La Paz, then sells the flowers at the fair on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday mornings. When Pro Mujer was speaking with Ms. Eustaquia, she told them that her favorite things about Pro Mujer are the training and savings. The other members of the communal bank have various types of service and commercial businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy flowers

loans.name: Lucila Guillermina

texts.es:
la señora Lucia Guillermina E. vive en la colonia Buena Vista Sur desde hace 45 años, vive con sus hijos y su esposo el señor Manuel Aguilar Gallo quien le ayuda a operar el molino.
 
Lucia tambien con la ayuda de su hija elaboran y venden tortillas, negocio que realizan desde hace varios años en su casa de habitacion,  a mejorado su calidad de vida relata Lucia ya que antes vivian en una casa de piso de tierra, ahora han logrado construir una casa de bloque bien bonita donde viven comodamente.
 
el credito lo utilzara para la compra de maiz, leña y repuestos para el molino.
texts.en:
Lucia Guillermina E. has lived in the Buena Vista Sur section of town for 45 years. She lives with her husband, Manuel Aguilar Gallo, who helps her run her mil. Lucia, with the help of her daughter, also makes and sells tortillas; a business that they have been running out of their home for several years. Their relative quality of life has improved. They used to live in a house with a dirt floor, but they have managed to build a very nice cinder block home where they now live comfortably. She will use the money from this loan to buy dried corn, firewood, and spare parts for her mill.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Corn, firewood, spare parts

loans.name: Ma. Linda

texts.en: Ma. Linda B. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a manicure/pedicure service and a networking business. She lives in Barangay Tapon, Dalaguete, Cebu. Ma. Linda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her manicure/pedicure service and her networking business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000. Ma. Linda is now borrowing PHP 15,000 as additional working capital for her business. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Linda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Samoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Samoeun S. (in the photo), and her husband, Sok Deam, have been married since 2001. They have two children--one son and one daughter. Both of them are in school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Samoeun is a silk weaver, a skill she learned from her mother. She also taught her husband to be a silk weaver. Besides weaving, Mr. Sok Deam is a construction worker. He works in his village. 

Samoeun is requesting a loan of US$ 500 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Luzolo Plus Group

texts.en:
Nzuzi D., aged 42, is the manager of a Community Bank named “Luzolo Plus”. It is composed of 15 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Nzuzi single, has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1988. He sells beverages. His business is located to the south-west of Kinshasa. Nzuzi has already received six times the MFI HOPE DRC loans and repaid them correctly. The loan he will obtain next will be used to buy more crates of drinks to resell retail with the goal of increasing his profits. His business generates a profit of $73 per week. Nzuzi’s ambition is to become a beverage provider in his area. He has a son and takes care of two other children who attend school.

loans.use: To increase the inventory of his business by buying crates of beverages to resell at a profit

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver T. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. He is 32 years old. Oliver is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Oliver owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Oliver has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Oliver joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oliver has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Oliver is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Oliver from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia G. is 77 and widowed but still continues to work.  She is now living with her children.

In 2007, Virginia joined ASHI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in income-generating activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASHI. She is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fishing nets to continue to expand her business.

With the chance given to her family by this KIVA partner, Virginia believes she is getting nearer to achieving her dream that her grandchildren will complete college.  She hopes that through her determination her business will be successful.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing nets to continue to expand her business.

loans.name: Nazgul's Group

texts.en:
Nazgul M. is the wife of a farmer. The couple has 4 daughters, the elder two are institute of higher education students, and the younger two are school girls.

The parents, with the help of their diligent daughters, operate a business in cattle breeding. From the profits of 10 years of hard work,  they have managed to build a house and pay for their children’s study.

In order to increase their total income, the family members decided to fatten and resell more cattle, thus they are planning to obtain several farm animals for further breeding. For this plan to be come true, Nazgul is applying for a loan. She cherishes a dream to improve her family’s living conditions.
	

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 .

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase breeding cattle

loans.name: Nasimu

texts.en:
Nasimu N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda.  She is married and has 1 child.  None of her children is currently in school. Nasimu has a business selling clothes. She has been in this business for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Nasimu has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase clothes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Nasimu hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Nasimu hopes to expand her business even more.    

Nasimu is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Leodan

texts.es: El señor Leodan nacido el 12 de Septiembre de 42 años  en Limoncito casado con la Sra.  Fátima con 3 hijos  tiene su casa en la misma parcela en Santo Corazón a 8 Km de Limoncito tiene 2 parcelas.                                                                                                                                                              El se dedica a la agricultura en una parcela tiene sembrando maíz y yuca, en la otra parcela tiene plantas completas de cítricos como naranja, mandarina, limón y otros, combina estas productos ya que dan en temporadas distintas y siempre tiene ingresos de cualquiera de estos productos, es dinero del crédito es para la compra de semillas, preparado de la tierra ya que así tendrá una buena cosecha, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Leodan, 42, was born on September 12 in Limoncito.  He’s married to Fátima and they have three children.  His house is located on the same property in Santo Corazón, 8 kilometers from Limoncito.   He owns two lots.

He is a farmer.  He grows corn and manioc on one lot and on the other he has citrus trees like oranges, mandarins, lemons and others.  He combines the products since they ripen at different times so he always has income from either one or the other.

The money from the loan is to buy seed and prepare the land so that his harvest will be a good one.  He is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: For corn and manioc crop care.

loans.name: Colette

texts.fr: Née en 1972 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l'Ouémé, Colette est mariée à Christophe, un mécanicien, et est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, trois sont à la charge du couple. Depuis une dizaine d'année, Colette s'est installée avec sa famille à Ekpè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Colette n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a dix ans que Colette vend de façon ambulante de la friperie. De façon secondaire, Colette vend du charbon de bois à son domicile. Colette achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que Colette sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, en vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Born in 1972 in Adjohoun, in the Ouémé district, Colette is married to Christophe, a mechanic, and is the mother of four children who are all at school; three of the children are in the couple's care.  Around ten years ago, Colette moved to  Ekpè, in the Sèmè-Podji district. The couple see to the family's needs together. Colette did not attend school.
Colette has sold second-hand clothes from door to door for ten years, and also sells charcoal from her home. She purchases her goods from Dantokpa, Benin's international market.  It is the second time that she has sought a loan from ALIDé, in order to boost her business and better meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: Purchasing second-hand clothes and charcoal

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman who lives in Brgy. 2, Victorias City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and buying and selling appliances/jewelry. Her husband Efren, who is 58 years old, works as a market supervisor to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children between 29 to 34 years old who already have families of their own. 

Rebecca joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 22 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rebecca has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 50,000 helped her earn a monthly income of PHP 40,500, increasing the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 23rd loan, she is borrowing PHP 50,000, which she intends to use to pay for more stock for her rice retail and general store so that she can continue to save up for future expansion and improvement of her business. Rebecca is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 
Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell to customers

loans.name: Abu White

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Abu White K.. He is married and has two children, ages six and twelve. He has four additional dependents who live with him because he helps educate them. In 1995, Abu established his pharmacy because he wanted to support himself and his family. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 350,000 SLL every month. Abu White has already received and successfully repaid one loan. Now he would like a second loan of 4,000,000 SLL in order to buy more stock for his shop. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 400,000 SLL. In the future, Abu White plans to open another shop and educate his children and dependents to university level. He is serious and determined and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase drugs for his pharmacy

loans.name: Progresando Hacia Adelante 1 & 4 Group

texts.es:
Maria pertenece al grupo Progresando hacia adelante, un grupo formado por 9 mujeres y un hombre,  Los cuales son pequeños empresarios D. L. ciudad D. San Pedro D. Macoris, ciudad del este D. República Dominicana, rodeada D. campos D. caña D. azúcar, y el mar caribe, .  

Maria es madre soltera D. 2 hijos los cuales viven con elL. en su humilD. hogar, en una comunidad D. escasos recursos, ubicada en las afueras D. L. ciudad. Ha trabajado mucho para darle a sus hijos todo lo que han necesitado, como educación, vestimentas y su alimentación, desea poder mejorar su vivienda para vivir mas tranquiL. y segura. 

El negocio D. Maria es un pequeño colmado, donD. venD. diariamente comestibles como arroz, carne, azúcar entre otros alimentos D. consumo diario. Esta recibiendo su 7mo. préstamo en Esperanza, después D. haber invertido durante casi 4 años, sus prestamos anteriores; pagando satisfactoriamente cada uno D. ellos. Maria investirá este préstamo en L. compra D. mercancías como arroz, aceite, refrescos, azúcar, productos enlatados, entre otros. Sus beneficios serán invertido en su negocio, con L. finalidad D. crecer y poder tener buenos ahorros para poder ampliar su negocio y mejorar su vivienda. Maria les da las gracias por su apoyo, y por todos los D. su grupo.
texts.en:
María belongs to the Progresando Hacia Adelante (Progressing Forward) group which is composed of nine women and one man who are all small businesspeople in the city of San Pedro D. Macoris, a city in the east of the Dominican Republic, surrounded by sugar cane fields and the Caribbean Sea.

María is a single mother of two children who live with her in her humble aboD. in a community of scarce resources located in the city’s outskirts.  She has worked hard to proviD. her children with everything they have needed like education, clothing and food.  She hopes to improve her dwelling in order to live more securely and with peace of mind.

María’s business is a small grocery store where she daily sells food like rice, meat and sugar, among other daily use foodstuffs.  She is receiving her 7th loan in Esperanza, having invested her previous loans for almost four years repaying each satisfactorily.

María will use this loan to buy merchandise like rice, oil, soft drinks, sugar and canned goods, among others, with the goal of growing and earning good savings to expand the business and improve her dwelling.  María gives her own and her group's thanks to everyone for their support.

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, oil, beans, soft drinks, snacks.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es: El señor Fernando es albañil constructor y su esposa tiene un puesto de venta de verduras. Con el crédito comprará material de construcción para refaccionar su vivienda. Fernando tiene siete hijos y vive  en casa  propia ubicada en la Zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que lo ayudan a mejorar la calidad  de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando is a bricklayer and his wife has a stand selling vegetables.  He will use the loan to buy building materials and supplies to do some home improvements.

Fernando has seven children and lives in his own house located in La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.  He is very satisfied with the loans he’s been granted because they help him improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies for home improvements.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en: Chann is a widow with three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory. The others attend a local public school. She owns a general store in her local village where she can sell groceries to earn some profit to support her family. She is also a farmer who owns a plot of land where she can grow rice, some of which she sells and some supports her family. She has a problem because her child’s work place is far away from home. So to improve this condition, Chann is asking for a loan to buy a new motorcycle for transportation.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her child to drive to work

loans.name: Mario De Jesus

texts.es:
Mario, de 52 años de edad, nació en la Concordia, Jinotega, casado con tres hijos, tiene 10 años de dedicarse al negocio del  molino y comerciante. Aprobó el segundo año de la secundaria pero tuvo que dedicarse a trabajar y no pudo seguir estudiando ya que no contaba con apoyo de sus padres porque no tenían los medios económicos. 
La instalación del negocio fue en el año 2000 aunque el es de Jinotega por razones laborales se vino a radicar  a Estelí, el tenia 42 años para ese entonces, el pudo comprar su molino con los ingresos que obtuvo de su finca, antes dedicarse al negocio de los molino se dedicaba a la actividad pecuaria.
Hoy en día tiene otros ingresos  como venta de leña y granos básicos. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar mayor inventario de maíz, ya que así lograra  tener mayor inventario y por tanto aumentara su clientela.
Dentro de sus planes futuros esta establecer otras distribuidoras de granos básicos en otros barrios de la ciudad de Estelí. Su próxima meta es lograr de preparar a sus hijos y poderle pagar una carrera universitaria a cada uno, ya que dos de ellos están en la secundaria y uno en la primaria
texts.en: Mario is 52 years old and a native of Concordia, Jinotega. He is married with three children. He has made a living for the past 10 years with his mill business and as a merchant. He was in his second year of high school but had to go get a job and couldn't continue his education since his parents didn't have the economic means. He started his mill business in the year 2000, and although he is from Jinotega, for work reasons he went to the city Estelí. He was 42 then, and he bought his mill with money he earned from his farm, since he previously made a living in livestock. Today he also earns income selling firewood and basic grains. He is requesting the loan to purchase a larger supply of corn so he can increase his inventory and therefore expand his clientele. Among his plans for the future is to establish more basic grain distribution centers in other neighborhoods of Estelí. His next goal is to prepare his children and be able to pay for a university education for each one, since two are currently in high school and the other is in elementary school.

loans.use: to purchase larger quantities of corn

loans.name: Mirna Jeannette

texts.es:
Mirna, tiene 30 años de edad, reside en El Transito, departamento de San Miguel, vive con sus tres hijos y su madre, administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad y tiene una panadera desde hace 5 años, por el momento su dificultad es la falta  alguna mercadería para el negocio.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería y abastecer la tienda, atendiendo mejor a los clientes, sus propósitos son mejorar los negocios, estabilizarse con su familia y superar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirna is 30 years old.  She lives in El Transito, in San Miguel department, with her three children and her mother.  Mirna runs a store selling essentials and she has also owned a bakery for five years.  At the moment, her difficulty is that she lacks some merchandise for her business.

Mirna is requesting a loan to buy merchandise with which to stock her store so that she can better serve her customers.  Her goals are to improve her businesses, to stabilize her family and to help her children to do well.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ileana Maria

texts.es: La señora Ileana Maria Martínez , tiene la edad de 45 años , habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe junto a su esposo que le apoya con los gastos del hogar y sus hijas , los planes hacia un futuro es poder brindarle siempre apoyo a sus hijas para que puedan seguir estudiando y lleguen a ser profesionales  ya que ella por su situación económica no culmino sus estudios , doña Ileana se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa lo cual le genera ingresos mensuales y con sus ganancias y el apoyo de su esposo casi logran el sueño de poder tener una pequeña tienda en su casa de habitación , ella se siente muy contenta con financiamiento ya que los intereses son bajos y eso le ayuda para poder crecer como comerciante .El crédito lo quiere para la compra de cosmético y ropa .
texts.en:
Sra. Illeana Maria Martínez is 45 years old. She resides in the town of Ticuantepe with her husband, who helps with the household expenses, and their daughters. Her future plans include providing her daughters what they need to continue their studies and help them become professionals since she was not able to finish her education as a result of her financial situation.

Doña Ileana sells beauty products and clothing in order to generate a monthly income. With her earnings, she and her husband are close to fulfilling their dream of opening a small store in their home. Ileana is very pleased with the loan because of the low interest rates and the fact that it has helped her grow as a merchant. This loan will be used to buy cosmetics and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
El Banco comunal se denomina “ QORILAZO”; Este Banco se encuentra situado en el Poblado de Cachona - Santiago, perteneciente a la Provincia y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Gilberto, el socio  tiene 34 años de edad, el socio es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos de 15, 12, 9 años de edad, el socio es maestro de obras y junto a sus padre y amigos se presentan a cuanto obras hay el socio desea comprar herramientas en especial tablas, el socio necesita construira un andamio hecho con tablas, al socio y a su grupo de amigos constructores les dieron a realiza la obra del armado de loza y con niveles para lo cual el requiere construir una escalera tipo andamio para facilitar su trabajo. El socio solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de tablas para la armazon de su andamio.

El socio se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
This community bank is called QORILAZO”.  It is located in the town of Cachona-Santiago, in Cusco province and department.

Gilberto is 34 years old.  He lives with his partner and has three children aged 15, 12 and 9.  Gilberto is a master builder and, together with his father and friends, he works on construction sites.  He would like to buy tools for his work, especially planks.  He needs to use these planks to build some scaffolding.  Gilberto and his group of builders have been given a job concreting a multi-storey building and, in order to carry out this work, he needs to build a scaffolding staircase.  He is requesting this loan to invest in buying planks to put together the framework of his scaffolding.

Gilberto is grateful for this loan and would like to make it known that he will make his loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying planks for his scaffolding framework

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; La socia vive en el distrito de Urubamba en la provincia de Urubamba,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 35 años de edad y La socia es separada y tiene 2 hijos de 15, 12 años de edad; la socia tiene un restaurante turístico, ella administra y atiende el restaurante de manera directa, la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en el arreglo y así poder mejorar su restaurante, la socia arreglara el techo y las paredes luego pintaran el local, para comprar el material y el pago del obrero se requiere dinero y la socia desea el crédito para hacer estas inversiones y poder ir pagando las cuotas fraccionadas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales y pintura para su restaurante.

La socia valora y agradece el crédito que le otorgarán para así mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the communal bank Perolniyoc [the name of a canyon]. She lives in the district of Urubamba, which is in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

She is 35 years old and separated. She has two children, aged 15 and 12. She owns a tourist restaurant. She manages the restaurant and serves food herself. She applies for a loan to renovate and improve her restaurant. She will repair the roof and the walls, and then repaint the premises. She needs money to buy construction material and to pay for labor. She wants this loan to make these investments and she will repay the loan in installments.

She values and appreciates the awarded loan. Her quality of life will be improved. She is committed to repay the loan in installments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy construction material and paint in order to renovate her restaurant.

loans.name: Freddy

texts.es:
Es de la ciudad de Managua, señor Freddy se desempeña en el área técnica,   se ha caracterizado por ser una persona honrada  trabajadora con buenos valores y principios  morales. 
Se presento ante esta oficina  de  Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para ser invertido en mejoramiento  en su vivienda en realizar un anexo de un cuarto y compra materiales de construcción como  bloque, cemento, hierro, arena y mano obra, para darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Freddy is from the city of Managua and works in the technical field. He has been characterized as a hard-working, honorable man with good values and moral principles. He came to CEPRODEL to request a loan that he will invest in home improvements. In order to give his family a better quality of life, he will build an annex onto one room, pay for labor, and buy construction materials like cinder block, cement, iron bars, and sand.

loans.use: to improve his home
